row.title: Photodynamic Therapy for Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains photodynamic therapy, how it is administered, and indications and side effects of treatment.

row.field_page_description: Population-based cancer research can provide important information that influences practices, policies, and programs that directly affect and could improve public health.

row.title: Progress in Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Through its Annual Report to the Nation and other reports and publications, the National Cancer Institute – leader of the National Cancer Program – marks the progress that’s been made by the cancer research community.

row.title: Grants Management Contacts
row.field_page_description: Contact a grants management specialist assigned to your institution.

row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes cryosurgery, the technique of using extreme cold to treat tumors. Lists the indications, risks, benefits, and side effects of cryotherapy.

row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that discusses formaldehyde and its possible association with cancer. Includes resources for more information.

row.field_page_description: Learn about the different types of costs related to taking part in a clinical trial, who is expected to pay for which costs, and tips for working with insurance companies.

row.title: Study shows colon and rectal tumors constitute a single type of cancer; The Cancer Genome Atlas generates genomic data for colon and rectal cancers that point to potential targets for treatment
row.field_short_title: Study shows colon and rectal tumors constitute a single type of cancer
row.field_page_description: The pattern of genomic alterations in colon and rectal tissues is the same regardless of anatomic location or origin within the colon or the rectum, leading researchers to conclude that these two cancer types can be grouped as one, according to The Cancer

row.title: HER2’s Genetic Link to Breast Cancer Spurs Development of New Treatments
row.field_short_title: HER2's Genetic Link to Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: When researchers discovered the HER2 gene's importance to breast cancer growth, this led to the development of trastuzumab and other treatments that have improved survival for women with HER2-positive breast cancer.

row.title: Examples of Cancer Health Disparities
Health Disparities Resources
About The Center to Reduce Cancer Health Disparities
NCI-MATCH Trial (Molecular Analysis for Therapy Choice)
row.field_short_title: NCI-MATCH Trial (Molecular Analysis for Therapy Choice)
row.field_page_description: Information about the NCI-MATCH precision medicine trial, in which patients with advanced solid tumors and lymphomas are assigned to treatment arms based on the molecular profiles of their disease.

row.title: Special Populations Networks (SPN)
National Outreach Network (NON)
Long-Term Data from 20 Trials Confirm Tamoxifen’s Long-Lasting Benefit
row.field_short_title: Long-Term Data from 20 Trials Confirm Tamoxifen's Long-Lasting Benefit
row.field_page_description: Women with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who received about 5 years of adjuvant tamoxifen had a lower risk of recurrence in the 15 years after treatment than women who did not receive tamoxifen.

row.title: Radiation Therapy after Breast-Conserving Surgery Improves Survival
row.field_short_title: Radiation Therapy after Breast-Conserving Surgery Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: Radiation therapy after breast-conserving surgery substantially reduces the risk of cancer recurring in the breast and moderately reduces the risk of death from the disease.

row.title: Two Drugs that Hit One Target Improve Survival in Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeted Drug Combination Improves Survival in Women with Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Combining two drugs that target the HER2 protein, trastuzumab (Herceptin®) and pertuzumab, with chemotherapy may be a new treatment option for women with HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: CCG News and Events
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) has been widely recognized for its research efforts to facilitiate advances in cancer genomic research and improve patient outcomes. Find the latest news about and events featuring CCG.

row.title: Anemia and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Anemia is a side effect of cancer treatments, including chemotherapy and radiation therapy. It can make women and men feel fatigued, dizzy, and short of breath. Learn how to manage fatigue caused by anemia during cancer treatment.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Bill Nelson, M.D., Ph.D. - Steering a Partnership to Improve Cancer Outcomes for African Americans in Maryland and DC
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Bill Nelson, M.D., Ph.D.

row.title: Program Spotlight: Arizona's Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention - Fostering the Next Generation of Native American Cancer Researchers
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: Arizona's Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention

row.title: Precision Medicine Initiative® and Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Precision Medicine Initiative® and Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Under the Precision Medicine Initiative, NCI is working to accelerate the pace of research that will help identify which treatments work best for which patients.

row.title: Nausea and Vomiting in People with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Types of nausea and vomiting caused by cancer treatment include: anticipatory, acute, and delayed. Controlling these side effects will help to prevent serious problems such as malnutrition and dehydration in people with cancer.

row.title: Genome Study Yields Clues to Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_short_title: Genome Study Yields Clues to Head and Neck Cancers

row.title: Diarrhea and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Diarrhea, a side effect of cancer treatment, may cause symptoms such as loose, watery stools. Diarrhea can lead to dehydration and malnutrition in cancer patients. Learn about ways to treat and manage diarrhea during cancer treatment.

row.title: Cell Phones and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that outlines the available evidence regarding use of cellular/mobile telephones and cancer risk.

row.title: Home Care Nursing Improves Cancer Symptom Management
row.field_short_title: Home Care Nursing Improves Cancer Symptom Management
row.field_page_description: Home care nursing (HCN) improves the management of symptoms in breast and colorectal cancer patients who take the oral chemotherapy drug capecitabine, according to a study published online November 16 in the Journal of Clinical Oncology.

row.title: Cancer Support Groups
Day-to-Day Life
row.field_page_description: Enjoy life and stay active during and after cancer treatment. Get tips for keeping up with your daily routine, going back to work, and finding spiritual well-being.

row.title: Support for Caregivers of Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Being a caregiver of cancer patients can be stressful. Find out what to expect and how to deal with caring for a loved one with cancer.

row.title: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccines: An Interview with Douglas R. Lowy, M.D.
row.field_short_title: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccines: An Interview with Douglas R. Lowy, M.D.
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Dr. Doug Lowy discusses HPV vaccines, including their efficacy, safety, and the development of next-generation vaccines.

row.title: CGH Staff Present at the World Cancer Congress 2014
About The Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG)
row.field_page_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics applies next-generation sequencing and genomic analysis to identify genetic drivers of cancer and produce data for researchers.

row.title: Office of Budget and Finance (OBF)
CRCHD Funding for Research and Training
row.field_page_description: CRCHD provides extramural research grants to researchers and institutions and training and career development funding opportunities to increase workforce diversity.

row.title: Premenopausal women who received ovarian suppression treatment along with tamoxifen had a lower risk of breast cancer recurrence
row.field_short_title: Ovarian suppression treatment lowers risk of breast cancer recurrence
row.field_page_description: A clinical trial sponsored and supported by NCI showed that suppressing ovarian function reduced breast cancer recurrence in premenopausal women receiving the drug tamoxifen after surgery for early-stage breast cancer.

row.title: Aflatoxins
row.field_page_description: Learn about aflatoxins, a family of toxins associated with an increased risk of liver cancer. Aflatoxins are produced by certain fungi found on agricultural crops such as maize (corn), peanuts, cottonseed, and tree nuts.

row.title: What We Do & Future Goals
Debate, Research on E-Cigarettes Continue
row.field_page_description: Since they first began to be sold in North America in the mid-2000s, electronic cigarettes have been the subject of intense debate. NCI's Dr. Michele Bloch recently presented an update on some of the issues surrounding e-cigarettes.

row.title: Thorium
row.field_page_description: Learn about thorium, which can raise the risk of liver, lung, and pancreatic cancers. The primary ways people are exposed are inhalation, intravenous injection, ingestion, and absorption through the skin.

row.title: Radon
row.field_page_description: Learn about radon, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Radon gas usually exists at very low levels outdoors, but the gas can accumulate in areas without adequate ventilation, such as underground mines or residential basements.

row.title: Inflammatory Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the diagnosis and treatment of inflammatory breast cancer (IBC), an uncommon type of cancer in which the breast becomes red, swollen, and warm.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor When You Have Finished Treatment
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor When You Have Finished Treatment

row.field_page_description: NCI is constantly publishing new information on its websites, so periodically we provide updates on new content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Global Health Diplomacy Begins at Home
row.field_short_title: Global Health Diplomacy Begins at Home

row.title: Radiation Therapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Radiation therapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses high doses of radiation to kill cancer cells and shrink tumors. Learn about the types of radiation, why side effects happen, which ones you might have, and more.

row.title: Apply for a Grant
row.field_page_description: The NCI Grants Process provides an overview of the end-to-end lifecycle of grant funding. Learn about the types of funding available and the basics for application, review, award, and on-going administration within the NCI.

row.title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_short_title: Treating High-grade Lesions to Prevent Anal Cancer in HIV-infected People
row.field_page_description: This study, called the ANCHOR trial, will investigate whether screening and prevention methods similar to those used to prevent cervical cancer can help prevent anal cancer in HIV-infected men and women.

row.title: Treatment Helps Preserve Fertility for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Helps Preserve Fertility for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a large clinical trial, giving a hormone-suppressing drug helped some younger women with breast cancer get pregnant after completing cancer treatment.

row.title: Grant Closeout
row.field_page_description: Requirements and reports to comply with grant closeout, including Final Federal Financial Report (FFR, SF425); Final Research Performance Progress Report (FRPPR); Interim Research Performance Progress Report (IRPPR); Final Invention Statement (FIS, HHS

row.title: Talking about Your Advanced Cancer
Advanced Cancer and Caregivers
row.field_page_description: Learn tips for taking care of yourself, coping with your feelings and grief, asking for help, ,communicating with your loved one about their wishes for care, talking to children about death

row.title: Coke Oven Emissions
row.field_page_description: Learn about coke oven emissions, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Workers at coking plants and coal-tar production plants may be exposed to coke oven emissions.

row.title: Finding Health Care Services
row.field_page_description: If you have been diagnosed with cancer, finding a doctor and treatment hospital for your cancer care is an important step to getting the best treatment possible. Learn tips for choosing a doctor and treatment facility to manage your cancer care.

row.title: Using Trusted Resources
row.field_page_description: Information to help people evaluate the source and credibility of health information that they find in print or online.

row.title: Skin and Nail Changes during Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments can cause skin to become dry, itchy, red, or peel. Nails may become dark, yellow, or cracked. Learn about signs of skin problems that may need urgent medical care. Get a helpful list of questions to ask your doctor.

row.title: Lymphedema and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Lymphedema is a side effect of some cancer treatments. Symptoms of lymphedema are presented. Ways to treat or manage swelling in the arm or leg are covered for cancer patients and cancer survivors.

row.title: Head and Neck Cancers
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the risk factors, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, follow-up, and rehabilitation for cancers of the head and neck.

row.title: New platform developed to link clinical data with electronic health records
row.field_short_title: Platform links clinical data with electronic health records
row.field_page_description: To make data gathered from patients in clinical trials available for use in standard care, NCI has created a new computer tool to support interoperability between clinical research and electronic health record systems. This new software represents an inno

row.title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely
row.field_short_title: Additional Surgery after Breast-Conserving Surgery Varies Widely

row.title: HPV and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Human papillomaviruses (HPVs) are a group of more than 200 related viruses that can cause several cancers including cervical cancer, anal cancer, and oropharyngeal cancer. Learn more about how HPV is transmitted, the different types of HPV, HPV vaccines, and HPV treatment.

row.title: "Light" Cigarettes and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: This fact sheet answers questions about the health effects of smoking "low-tar," "mild," or "light" cigarettes.

row.title: Genetic abnormality predicts benefit from treatment for a rare brain tumor:
row.field_short_title: Genetic abnormality predicts benefit for a rare brain tumor
row.field_page_description: A clinical trial has shown that addition of chemotherapy to radiation therapy leads to a near doubling of median survival time in patients with a form of brain tumor (oligodendroglioma) that carries a chromosomal abnormality called the 1p19q co-deletion.

row.title: Study finds racial and ethnic disparities in U.S. cancer screening rates:
row.field_short_title: Racial and ethnic disparities in U.S. cancer screening rates
row.field_page_description: The percentage of U.S. citizens screened for cancer remains below national targets, with significant disparities among racial and ethnic populations, according to the first federal study to identify cancer screening disparities among Asian and Hispanic gr

row.title: Exposure to Secondhand Smoke Plummets, but Disparities Persist
row.field_short_title: Exposure to Secondhand Smoke Plummets, but Disparities Persist
row.field_page_description: Second-hand smoke exposure has fallen by 50 percent since 1999, a new study finds, but millions are still routinely exposed to secondhand smoke.

row.title: Health Communications Publications
Genetic Studies Yield Clues to Treatment-Related Side Effects in Children with Cancer
row.field_short_title: Genetic Studies Yield Clues to Treatment-Related Side Effects in Children with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified genetic variations in children with brain cancer that increased their risk of rapid hearing loss after treatment.

row.title: Symptoms of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer can cause different symptoms, such as abnormal bumps, night sweats, or unknown weight gain or loss. Only a doctor can tell if symptoms are caused by cancer or some other problem.

row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a large randomized clinical trial that shows a new human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine effectively prevented infection and disease caused by seven HPV types that cause cancer and two HPV types that cause genital warts.

row.title: Step 1: Application Development & Submission
row.field_page_description: There are nine research grant application types, each with specific procedures. Learn more about developing, submitting, and tracking a cancer research grant application.

row.title: Step 2: Application Receipt & Assignment
row.field_page_description: Information on the assignment numbers the Center for Scientific Review (CSR) creates once an application is submitted and other submission policies.

row.title: Fatigue and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Fatigue is a common side effect of many cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, and surgery. Anemia and pain can also cause fatigue. Learn about symptoms and way to manage fatigue.

row.field_page_description: Find video presentations, meeting addresses, and discussions about work by the NCI Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG).

row.title: Insights & Innovations Blog
row.field_page_description: Read interviews with investigators, updates from CCG's Director and others, CCG's latest news and announcements, and overviews of new influential papers in cancer genomics.

row.title: Sunlight
row.field_page_description: Exposure to UV radiation from the sun, sunlamps, and tanning booths causes early aging and skin damage that can lead to skin cancer. Find information, including tips, on how to protect your skin.

row.title: Tobacco
row.field_page_description: Tobacco use is a leading cause of cancer and of death from cancer. Find resources on the harms of tobacco use and how to get help quitting.

row.title: Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: Investigating the genetic foundations of cancer has improved our understanding of cancer biology and led to better prevention, diagnosis and treatment methods.

row.title: Grant Resources
row.field_page_description: Resources to help with the NCI and NIH grants and funding process.

row.title: Research Areas
row.field_page_description: Making sustained progress against cancer requires advances across the research continuum. Learn about the breadth of NCI's work and the programs the institute supports to advance cancer research.

row.field_page_description: Information about cancer screening and early detection research, including a summary of NCI programs dedicated to advancing screening and early detection.

row.title: Choices for Care When Treatment May Not Be an Option
row.field_page_description: Know your choices for cancer care when coping with advanced cancer. Learn about palliative care, hospice care, and trying a clinical trial.

Video Eases End-of-Life Care Discussions
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced cancer who watched a video that depicts options for end-of-life care were more certain of their end-of-life decision making than patients who only listened to a verbal narrative.

row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes what constitutes a cancer cluster and the process for reporting and investigating suspected clusters.

row.field_page_description: A trial of androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) plus six cycles of docetaxel versus ADT alone found that after a median follow-up of nearly 29 months, median overall survival was 13.6 months longer with the combination therapy than with ADT alone.

row.field_page_description: In the PROSPECT trial, patients with locally advanced, resectable rectal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive either standard neoadjuvant chemoradiation therapy or neoadjuvant FOLFOX chemotherapy, with chemoradiation reserved for nonresponders.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on clinical trial results showing that adding androgen deprivation therapy to radiation therapy can improve survival for some men with recurrent prostate cancer.

row.field_page_description: Two studies from The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) program reveal details about the genomic landscapes of acute myeloid leukemia (AML) and endometrial cancer. Both provide new insights into the molecular underpinnings of these cancers.

row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced alveolar soft part sarcoma (ASPS), a rare cancer, achieved some control of their disease using an experimental anti-cancer drug called cediranib.

row.field_page_description: An article about the need for new research on the optimal nutrition for patients being treated for cancer.

Kirschstein National Research Service Award (NRSA) program helps ensure that a diverse pool of highly trained scientists is available to meet the Nation’s research needs. Learn more about the NRSA program and the types of predoc and postdoc trainees awarded.

row.title: Clinical Trial Sequencing Project
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Trial Sequencing Project performs genomic characterization of samples from NCI-sponsored trials with the goal of improving the understanding and treatment of various cancers.

row.title: Tumor Metastasis Research
row.field_page_description: Tumor metastasis research examines the mechanisms that allow cancer cells to leave the primary tumor and spread to another part of the body. Learn about recent tumor metastasis research studies supported by the Division of Cancer Biology.

row.title: Nanoparticles Create Effective CAR T Cells in Living Mice
row.field_short_title: Nanoparticles Create Effective CAR T Cells in Mice
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the development of a method to genetically engineer cancer-fighting immune cells, known as CAR T cells, in living animals using nanoparticles that carry DNA.

row.title: Cancer Risk - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on research related to cancer risk—including inherited, behavioral, and environmental risks and studies about decreasing risk—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: FDA Approvals - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer drugs and devices approved by the Food and Drug Administration—including summaries of the evidence to support the approvals and what they mean for patients—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Treatment - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer treatment research—including new treatments for cancer and their effects, clinical trial results, and overcoming treatment resistance—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.field_page_description: This collaborative study seeks to develop and apply new methods of engineering human breast tumors that allow for modular control over key aspects of a tumor and its microenvironment.

Thyroid Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Thyroid cancer can be of four main types. Anaplastic thyroid cancer is hard to cure with current treatments, whereas papillary (the most common), follicular, and medullary thyroid cancer can usually be cured. Start here to find information on thyroid cancer treatment, screening, research, and statistics.

row.field_short_title: Breast cancer patients with dense breasts do not have increased death risk
row.field_page_description: High mammographic breast density, which is a marker of increased risk of developing breast cancer, does not seem to increase the risk of death among breast cancer patients, according to a study led by Gretchen L. Gierach, Ph.D., NCI. Image shows physician

row.title: Study reveals genomic similarities between breast and ovarian cancers
row.field_short_title: Genomic similarities between breast and ovarian cancers
row.field_page_description: One subtype of breast cancer shares many genetic features with high-grade serous ovarian cancer, a cancer that is very difficult to treat, according to researchers supported by the National Institutes of Health. The findings suggest that the two cancers a

row.title: HIV infection connected to rising anal cancer rates in men in the U.S.
row.field_short_title: HIV infection connected to rising anal cancer rates in men in the U.S.
row.field_page_description: Human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection contributes substantially to the epidemic of anal cancer in men, but not women in the United States, according to new research from NCI. Chart shows overall incidence rates of anal cancers in general population

row.title: Cancer Prevention Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Prevention Steering Committee reviews innovative cancer prevention, screening, and surveillance concepts.

row.title: In Melanoma, Personalized Treatment Vaccines Show Promise
row.field_page_description: In patients with melanoma, a personalized treatment vaccine generated a robust immune response and may have helped prevent a recurrence, the Cancer Currents blog reports.

row.title: “First in Human” Documentary Highlights NCI Immunotherapy Research
row.field_short_title: “First in Human” Highlights NCI Immunotherapy Research
row.field_page_description: The Discovery Channel documentary, First in Human, will feature some of the groundbreaking work on cancer immunotherapy being done at the NIH Clinical Center.

row.title: Ibrutinib Becomes First FDA-Approved Drug for Chronic Graft-Versus-Host Disease
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved ibrutinib for chronic graft-versus-host disease, a common side effect of cancer-related stem cell transplants, NCI’s Cancer Currents blog reports.

row.title: NCI Program Supports Small Businesses to Advance Cancer Research Innovation – A Q&A with Michael Weingarten
row.field_short_title: Supporting Small Business to Drive Cancer Research Innovation
row.field_page_description: NCI’s SBIR program is offering funding to help small businesses develop innovative cancer-related therapies and technologies, including those prioritized by the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: Sexual Health Issues in Men with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, radiation therapy and prostate surgery may affect a man’s sexual function, lower libido, and make it difficult to get an erection. Learn how to manage and treat these sexual problems, during cancer treatment.

row.title: Modified Stem Cells Deliver Chemotherapy to Metastatic Tumors
row.field_short_title: Stem Cells Deliver Chemo to Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Using modified stem cells, researchers delivered a cancer drug selectively to metastatic breast cancer tumors in mice, as this NCI Cancer Currents post explains.

row.field_short_title: Dr. John M. Carethers to Deliver CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_page_description: Dr. John M. Carethers will deliver the second CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar on Oct. 5, 2017.

row.title: FDA Expands Approval of Fulvestrant for Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Fulvestrant for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Fulvestrant (Faslodex®) has been approved by FDA for some women with advanced breast cancer, this Cancer Currents post reports.

row.title: Low-Tech Outreach Methods Improve Colorectal Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: Colorectal cancer screening, completion of the appropriate follow-up was increased by mailed invitations, free test kits, this Cancer Currents post reports.

row.field_page_description: A new study from NCI researchers finds that the HPV vaccine protects young women from infection with high-risk HPV types at the three primary anatomic sites where persistent HPV infections can cause cancer. The multi-site protection also was observed at l

row.title: Multi-center anal pre-cancer treatment and cancer prevention study launched in HIV-infected persons
row.field_short_title: Anal pre-cancer treatment and cancer prevention study launched
row.field_page_description: NCI has launched a multicenter phase III clinical trial called the ANCHOR Study -- Anal Cancer HSIL (High-grade Squamous Intraepithelial Lesion) Outcomes Research Study -- to determine if treatment of HSIL in HIV-infected individuals can prevent anal canc

row.title: Bone Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: There are several types of bone cancer. Osteosarcoma usually starts in osteoblasts, a type of bone cell that becomes new bone tissue. Ewing sarcoma arises from a primordial bone marrow–derived mesenchymal stem cell. Find evidence-based information on bone cancer including treatment, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Breast Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: The most common type of breast cancer is ductal carcinoma, which begins in the cells of the ducts. Breast cancer can also begin in the cells of a lobule and in other tissues of the breast. Find evidence-based information on breast cancer treatment, causes and prevention, genetics, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: The incidence of esophageal cancer has risen in recent decades, coinciding with a shift in histologic type and primary tumor location. Find evidence-based information on esophageal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Liver and Bile Duct Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Liver cancer includes two major types: hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) and intrahepatic bile duct cancer, also known as cholangiocarcinoma. Find evidence-based information on liver and bile duct cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genomics and statistics.

row.title: Plasma Cell Neoplasms (Including Multiple Myeloma) Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on plasma cell neoplasms (including multiple myeloma), which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_short_title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ovarian epithelial, fallopian tube, and peritoneal cancers are diseases in which malignant cells form in the tissue covering the ovary, lining the fallopian tube, or peritoneum. Find evidence-based information on ovarian cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics and statistics.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on ovarian, fallopian tube, and primary peritoneal cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Penile Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Penile cancer is most commonly squamous cell carcinoma. When diagnosed early, penile cancer is highly curable. Some studies suggest an association between human papillomavirus (HPV) infection and penile cancer. Find evidence-based information on penile cancer treatment.

row.title: Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Thymomas and thymic carcinomas are epithelial tumors of the thymus. A thymic epithelial tumor that exhibits cytologic atypia and histologic features no longer specific to the thymus is known as a thymic carcinoma. Find evidence-based information on thymoma and thymic carcinoma treatment.

row.title: Uterine Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on uterine cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.field_page_description: Information about NCI Director and other senior NCI leaders.

row.field_page_description: Information about how the rights and safety of people who take part in clinical trials are protected.

row.title: Five Years of Tamoxifen Continues to Benefit Women 15 Years after Treatment
row.field_short_title: Five Years of Tamoxifen Continues to Benefit Women 15 Years after Treatment
row.field_page_description: In a large randomized clinical trial, women with early-stage breast cancer who received 5 years of adjuvant treatment with tamoxifen had better outcomes up to 15 years after the start of treatment than those who received 2 years of tamoxifen therapy.

row.title: NIH study confirms risk factors for male breast cancer
row.field_short_title: NIH study confirms risk factors for male breast cancer
row.field_page_description: Pooled data from studies of about 2,400 men with breast cancer and 52,000 men without breast cancer confirmed that risk factors for male breast cancer include obesity, a rare genetic condition called Klinefelter syndrome, and gynecomastia.

row.title: NCI Center for Global Health (CGH)
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health coordinates research and works with national and international partners to understand and address the burden of cancer worldwide.

row.title: Research Programs and Initiatives
row.field_page_description: CGH develops international initiatives and collaborates with other NCI divisions, NCI-designated Cancer Centers, and other countries to support cancer control planning, encourage capacity building, and support cancer research and research networks.

row.field_page_description: Aberrant expression of an inflammatory protein, nitric oxide synthase 2 (NOS2), may enhance the progression and metastasis of an aggressive and less common form of breast cancer, known as the estrogen receptor-negative type of disease.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about two studies that suggest a new class of drugs can effectively target a molecular driver of the most common type of kidney cancer.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the FDA approval of the checkpoint inhibitors atezolizumab and pembrolizumab for patients with the most common form of lung cancer.

row.title: Connected Health: An Important Tool for Making Progress against Cancer

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a new report from President’s Cancer Panel outlining how connective technologies can promote cancer prevention, enhance patients’ treatment experience, and accelerate progress in cancer research.

row.title: Cancer Metabolism: A Conversation with Jason Locasale
row.field_short_title: Cancer Metabolism: A Conversation with Jason Locasale
row.field_page_description: Cancers driven by oncogenes such as RAS have altered metabolic pathways. Scientists hope such differences make cancers vulnerable to new drugs.

row.title: Prescription Subsidies Reduce Breast Cancer Treatment Disparities

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a new study showing that subsidies for prescription drugs can help to reduce racial/ethnic disparities in the use of a proven breast cancer treatment.

row.title: Cancer Tissue Engineering Collaborative
row.field_page_description: The NCI's Cancer Tissue Engineering Collaborative (TEC) supports the development and characterization of state-of-the-art biomimetic tissue-engineered technologies for cancer research.

row.title: Abiraterone Improves Survival for Some Men with Hormone-Sensitive Prostate Cancer

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on results from two clinical trials that showed adding abiraterone to androgen-deprivation therapy improved survival for men with metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer.

row.title: New Rituximab Formulation Approved for Some Lymphomas, Leukemia

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on FDA’s approval of a new formulation of rituximab, Rituxan Hycela, for some patients with lymphoma and leukemia.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Funding Opportunities Resources
row.field_page_description: Funding opportunities that address the goals of the Blue Ribbon Panel are available. Learn more about these FOAs and pre-application webinars.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites for September 2017
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for September 2017
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post that provides an update on new content of interest to the cancer community recently added to NCI’s websites.

row.title: Long-Term Nerve Damage Possible after Chemotherapy for Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Nerve Damage after Chemotherapy for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Peripheral neuropathy can persist for 2 years or more in women with breast cancer treated with taxane chemotherapy drugs, as this Cancer Currents post reports.

row.title: NCI Deputy Director
row.field_page_description: Learn about Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute. His research interests include the biology of papillomaviruses and the regulation of normal and neoplastic cell growth.

row.title: Timing and Sequence Critical for Immunotherapy Combination
row.field_short_title: Timing and Sequence Critical for Immunotherapy Combination
row.field_page_description: Combining two immune checkpoint inhibitors, an OX40 agonist and a PD-1 inhibitor, may require a specific sequence, as this Cancer Currents post on a new study in mice explains.

row.title: Adding Immune-based Treatments to Standard Glioblastoma Therapy
row.field_short_title: Adding Immunotherapy and Vaccine to Standard Glioblastoma Therapy
row.field_page_description: This clinical trial is testing standard therapy (surgery, radiation and temozolomide) plus immunotherapy with pembrolizumab with or without a cancer treatment vaccine for patients with newly diagnosed glioblastoma, a common and deadly type of brain tumor.

row.title: Nivolumab Receives Accelerated Approval from FDA for Advanced Liver Cancer
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab Approved by FDA for Advanced Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: The immunotherapy nivolumab (Opdivo®) has been approved by FDA for patients with advanced liver cancer who have previously been treated with sorafenib (Nexavar®).

row.title: Mentor Spotlight: Elva M. Arredondo, PhD

row.title: Leadership and Expert Views - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts featuring the views of NCI leaders and other scientific experts—including first-person commentaries and Q&As about research trends and new research programs—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: TRACERx: Trailblazing Longitudinal Cancer Genomics
row.field_page_description: The Center for Cancer Genomics is supporting TRACERx, a longitudinal lung cancer genomics study.

row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Pembrolizumab for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on FDA’s approval of pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) to be used with chemotherapy as a first-line treatment for non-small cell lung cancer.

row.title: NCI Cancer Moonshot℠ Public Access and Data Sharing Policy

row.field_page_description: NCI has established a data sharing policy that supports open, public access to all research and data for projects funded as part of the Cancer Moonshot. Find details on the policy.

row.title: TCGA study of liver cancer reveals potential targets for therapy
row.field_short_title: TCGA Liver Cancer Study Finds Potential Therapeutic Targets
row.field_page_description: An NCI News Note about a new TCGA study in Cell that reveals several potential therapeutic targets for liver cancer.

row.title: Large Study Verifies Cancer Risk for Women Carrying BRCA1 or BRCA2 Mutations
row.field_short_title: Study Affirms Cancer Risk for Women with BRCA Mutations
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a large, prospective study of breast, ovarian, and contralateral breast cancer risks associated with BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutations.

row.title: NCI’s Technology Transfer Center—Moving Inventions and Ideas from the Lab to Patients: An Interview with Dr. Michael Salgaller
row.field_short_title: Technology Transfer: From the Lab to Patients
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post featuring an interview with Dr. Michael Salgaller about how NCI’s Technology Transfer Center helps to move NCI-developed technologies from the lab to the bedside.

row.title: FDA Clears Wider Use of Cooling Cap to Reduce Hair Loss during Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: FDA Clears Wider Use of Cooling Cap
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about FDA’s clearance of the DigniCap Scalp Cooling System for use in reducing hair loss during chemotherapy by patients with any type of solid tumor.

row.title: 3D Models of Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: This collaborative grant is developing 3D models of both mouse and human biology to investigate aspects of therapeutic vaccination in order to answer key questions relevant to human cancer immunotherapy.

row.title: NCI-COG Pediatric MATCH trial to test targeted drugs in childhood cancers
row.field_short_title: NCI-COG Pediatric MATCH Trial to Test Targeted Therapies
row.field_page_description: An NCI-COG press release about the launch of a nationwide clinical trial that aims to match targeted treatments to pediatric cancers with specific genetic mutations.

row.title: NCI's CURE Program—21 Years of Increasing Diversity in the Biomedical Workforce
row.field_short_title: Increasing Diversity in the Biomedical Workforce
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from Dr. Sanya Springfield on NCI’s CURE program, which helps to improve the diversity of people involved in cancer research and care.

row.title: FDA Grants Full Approval to Blinatumomab for Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Blinatumomab Gets Full FDA Approval for ALL
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the FDA changing its accelerated approval of blinatumomab (Blincyto) for some patients with acute lymphoblastic leukemia to a full approval.

row.title: Ras–dependent Paracrine Cascades
row.field_page_description: Interrupting paracrine cascades in the tumor microenvironment of pancreatic cancers may improve treatment.

row.title: Fertility Issues in Girls and Women with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Fertility issues are common in women getting cancer treatment. Fertility preservation options include egg freezing, embryo freezing, ovarian tissue freezing, ovarian shielding and ovarian transposition. Resources, support, and clinical trials are listed.

row.title: Fertility Issues in Boys and Men with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Fertility issues are common in boys and men getting cancer treatment. Fertility preservation options include sperm banking, testicular shielding, testicular sperm extraction (TESE), and testicular tissue freezing. Support and clinical trials are listed.

row.title: Working with India to Advance Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Working with India to Advance Cancer Research

row.title: Supporting Cancer Research Through Priority initiatives at NCI
row.field_page_description: CRS leads priority initiatives to support cancer research to advance scientific knowledge and help people live longer, healthier lives. Learn more about the Resources for Cancer Researchers portal, Team Science, and Idea Generation with NCI staff.

row.title: TMIST Trial Aims to Provide Clarity on Breast Cancer Screening Approaches
row.field_short_title: TMIST Trial Comparing Breast Cancer Screening Approaches
row.field_page_description: TMIST, a breast cancer screening clinical trial, is comparing tomosynthesis, or 3D mammography, and 2D digital mammography, as this Cancer Currents article explains.

row.title: TCGA Data Leveraged for Developing FDA-Designated Breakthrough Therapy
row.field_short_title: TCGA Data Inform LOXO-101 Drug Development
row.field_page_description: Pharmaceutical company Loxo Oncology used TCGA data in research that led them to develop FDA-designated breakthrough therapy LOXO-101, a targeted therapy.

row.title: Blue Ribbon Panel Report: The Power of the Cancer Community Coming Together
row.field_short_title: Blue Ribbon Panel Report: The Power of Coming Together
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog by the NCI acting director thanking the cancer community for contributing to the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel report, which was presented to the National Cancer Advisory Board on September 7.

row.title: The Impact and Future of the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study: An Interview with Greg Armstrong, M.D.
row.field_short_title: Impact and Future of the Childhood Cancer Survivor Study

row.title: RAS Screens and Assays at FNLCR
row.field_page_description: A primary goal of the RAS Initiative is to develop assays for RAS activity, localization, and signaling and adapt those assays so they can be used for finding new drug candidates. Explore the work leading to highly validated screening protocols.

row.title: Trastuzumab Benefits Women with Locally Advanced or Inflammatory Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Trastuzumab Benefits Women with Locally Advanced or Inflammatory
row.field_page_description: Women treated with trastuzumab (Herceptin) and chemotherapy before surgery and trastuzumab again after surgery had a reduced risk of the disease recurring or progressing compared with women who received pre-surgical chemotherapy but no trastuzumab, accord

row.title: Syndication Services
PDQ® Cancer Integrative, Alternative, and Complementary Therapies Editorial Board
Breast Cancer Risk in American Women
row.field_short_title: Breast Cancer Risk in American Women
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that provides statistics about a woman’s risk of developing breast cancer and information about breast cancer risk factors.

row.title: Vulvar Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Vulvar cancer usually forms slowly, most often on the vaginal lips or the sides of the vaginal opening. Having vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia or human papillomavirus (HPV) infection can increase the risk of developing vulvar cancer. Start here to find information on vulvar cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Gestational Trophoblastic Disease—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) is a general term for rare tumors that form from the tissues surrounding fertilized egg. GTD is often found early and usually cured. Start here to find information on gestational trophoblastic disease treatment.

row.title: Investigational targeted drug induces responses in aggressive lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Targeted drug induces responses in aggressive lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Preliminary results from clinical trials in a subtype of lymphoma show that for a number of patients whose disease was not cured by other treatments, the drug ibrutinib can provide significant anti-cancer responses with modest side effects.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the FDA approval of nivolumab for recurrent or progressive squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck.

row.title: Track 1: Oncology Product Research and Review for M.D. Oncology Fellows
row.field_short_title: IOTF: Oncology Product Review for Oncology Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train physicians in clinical trials methodology and medical product development. Learn more about this cancer training program.

row.title: New Drug Formulary Will Help Expedite Use of Agents in Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: New Drug Formulary Will Help Expedite Use of Agents in Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: NCI launched the “NCI Formulary” that will enable investigators at NCI-designated Cancer Centers to have quicker access to approved and investigational agents for use in preclinical studies and cancer clinical trials.

row.title: Kras and Cancer Metabolism: A Conversation with Carla Martins
row.field_short_title: Kras and Cancer Metabolism: A Conversation with Carla Martins
row.field_page_description: Cancers in which both KRAS genes are mutated are more agressive and have different metabolism compared to cells with one mutated KRAS gene.

row.title: Genome Study Points to New Subtypes of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Points to Genetic Subtypes of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post about a study by The Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network that identified distinct genetic and molecular changes in esophageal cancers that could improve their classification and identify potential new treatments.

row.title: Less-Frequent Zoledronic Acid Treatment Effective at Preventing Bone Metastasis Complications
row.field_short_title: Less-Frequent Zoledronic Acid in Patients with Bone Metastases
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on a clinical trial showing that less frequent zoledronic acid treatment is effective in patients with cancer-related bone metastases.

row.title: New Therapy Benefits Patients with Neuroendocrine Tumors
row.field_short_title: Therapy Benefits Patients with Neuroendocrine Tumors
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on clinical trial results that suggest the new drug <sup>177</sup>Lu-Dotatate may soon be a treatment option for advanced neuroendocrine tumors.

row.title: Connect with Screen to Save
row.field_page_description: Join NCI community health educators and partners in helping to increase colorectal cancer screenings among men and women age 50–75 from racially and ethnically diverse communities and in rural areas.

row.title: Lung Cancer Screening Pilot Reveals Challenges, Growing Pains
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post the complexities and challenges associated with the expansion of lung cancer screening in the United States.

row.title: Study Shows Platelets Can Deliver Immunotherapy, Reduce Tumor Regrowth
row.field_short_title: Platelets Deliver Immunotherapy, Slow Tumor Growth
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on an experimental adjuvant therapy using blood platelets engineered to deliver an immune checkpoint inhibitor.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Some Metastatic Colorectal Cancers
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved nivolumab (Opdivo®) for metastatic colorectal cancer with tumors that have alterations that affect DNA repair, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Prior Approval Requests
row.field_page_description: Approval from NIH may be required before a cancer research grant recipient makes budget modifications or undertakes particular activities. Learn how to request approval.

row.title: Monitoring Research Grant Awards
row.field_page_description: NCI grants management staff regularly monitor individual grants within each budget period and within the overall project period.

row.title: Neratinib Approved by FDA for HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Neratinib for HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Neratinib (Nerlynx) has been approved by FDA for patients with early-stage HER2-positive breast cancer who have finished at least 1 year of adjuvant therapy with trastuzumab (Herceptin).

row.title: Crizotinib Shows Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_short_title: Crizotinib Shows Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Crizotinib (Xalkori®) shrank tumors in children with anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALCL) and inflammatory myofibroblastic tumors (IMT).

row.title: FDA Approves Inotuzumab for Adults with B-Cell Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Inotuzumab Approved for Adults with B-Cell ALL
row.field_page_description: Inotuzumab (Besponsa®) has been approved by FDA for some adults with B-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) that has returned or doesn’t respond to chemotherapy.

row.title: NCI-funded TMIST study compares 2-D and 3-D mammography for finding breast cancers
row.field_page_description: The TMIST study is enrolling 165,000 women to compare 2-D and 3-D mammography for finding breast cancers. This NCI and ECOG-ACRIN press release describes the trial.

row.title: Extensive Lymph Node Removal Doesn't Improve Survival in Some Women with Early-Stage Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Trial Provides Insights on Lymph Node Removal in Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: For some women with early-stage breast cancer who have a lumpectomy, a sentinel node biopsy is sufficient, as this Cancer Currents article explains.

row.title: Copanlisib Approved for Follicular Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: Copanlisib (Aliqopa®), a type of PI3K inhibitor, has been approved by the FDA for the treatment of patients with advanced follicular lymphoma.

row.title: Study Uses Open Data to Analyze “Normal” Tissue Near Tumors
row.field_short_title: Tissue adjacent to tumors may not be “normal,” study finds
row.field_page_description: The tissue immediately surrounding a tumor may not be normal, even if it appears normal under the microscope, as this Cancer Currents article explains.

row.title: Adding chemotherapy following radiation treatment improves survival for adults with a slow-growing type of brain tumor
row.field_short_title: Adding chemo after radiation treatment improves survival for adults with a type of brain tumor
row.field_page_description: Adults with low-grade gliomas, a form of brain tumor, who received chemotherapy following completion of radiation therapy lived longer than patients who received radiation therapy alone, according to long-term follow-up results from a NIH-supported random

row.title: NIH study finds regular aspirin use may reduce ovarian cancer risk
row.field_short_title: NIH study finds regular aspirin use may reduce ovarian cancer risk
row.field_page_description: Women who take aspirin daily may reduce their risk of ovarian cancer by 20 percent, according to a study by scientists at the National Cancer Institute (NCI), part of the National Institutes of Health. However, further research is needed before clinical r

row.title: How Genomics Is Shaping Precision Medicine in Oncology
row.field_short_title: How Genomics Is Shaping Precision Medicine in Oncology

row.title: Contact OGCR
row.field_page_description: Contact the Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR) if you have any questions or need more information on federal legislation and congressional activity affecting cancer research.

row.title: Federal Health Legislation
row.field_page_description: Legislation from the current Congress dealing with federal health related to NCI.

row.title: National Cancer Act of 1971
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Act of 1971, signed into law by President Richard Nixon, established the National Cancer Institute in its current form.

row.title: Driving New Approaches to Cancer Prevention and Early Detection
row.field_short_title: Driving New Approaches to Cancer Prevention and Early Detection
row.field_page_description: Researchers are pioneering new approaches to preventing and screening for cancer, and the management of very early-stage disease.

row.title: Two Drugs Show Efficacy against Common Form of Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Two Drugs Show Efficacy against Common Form of Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Reports from early-stage trials of two new oral drugs provide hope for patients with high-risk chronic lymphocytic leukemia.

row.title: Novel Treatment Approach Shrinks Ovarian Tumors in Mice
row.field_short_title: Novel Treatment Shrinks Ovarian Tumors in Mice
row.field_page_description: Researchers have developed a new approach for treating tumors that express mutant versions of the p53 protein, which are present in more than half of all cancers, including an aggressive and common subtype of ovarian cancer.

row.title: Functional Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics uses functional genomics to understand the impact of cancer genes and pathways, and how to target them effectively.

row.title: Cancer Clinical Trials at the National Institutes of Health Clinical Center
row.field_short_title: Cancer Clinical Trials at the NIH Clinical Center
row.field_page_description: Information about cancer clinical trials at the NIH Clinical Center in Bethesda, Maryland.

row.title: Blinatumomab Extends Survival for Patients with Advanced ALL
row.field_short_title: Blinatumomab Improves Survival in Advanced ALL
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a large clinical trial showing that blinatumomab improves survival and causes fewer side effects than standard chemotherapy.

row.title: NCI Funding for HIV and AIDS Malignancies Research
row.field_short_title: NCI Funding for HIV/AIDS Malignancies Research
row.field_page_description: OHAM supports funding to advance the study of HIV/AIDS-related cancers. Find funding to investigate HIV/AIDS infection, transmission, and treatment.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Research Initiatives
NCI HIV and AIDS Research Coordinated by OHAM
row.field_short_title: NCI HIV/AIDS Research Coordinated by OHAM
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have made a number of critical contributions to HIV/AIDS research since the beginning of the AIDS epidemic. Learn more about intramural and extramural research supported by NCI.

row.title: FDA Approves Ribociclib, Expands Palbociclib Approval for Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Ribociclib, Palbociclib for Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of two targeted therapies, ribociclib and palbociclib, for women with metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: Collection of Patient-Reported Outcomes Feasible in Cancer Clinical Trials

row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a study showing that patient-reported outcomes, or PROs, can be successfully collected during cancer clinical trials

row.title: NCI ALMANAC: A New Tool for Research on Cancer Drug Combinations
row.field_short_title: NCI ALMANAC Tool for Research on Cancer Drug Combinations
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on the NCI ALMANAC, a new resource that provides data showing how well pairs of FDA-approved cancer drugs performed in killing tumor cells from NCI-60 Human Tumor Cell Lines.

row.title: Prevention - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer prevention research—including behavioral interventions and other ways to prevent cancer and prevention-related research programs—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Prognosis - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer prognosis research—including factors that influence prognosis, prognostic biomarkers, and doctor–patient communication about prognosis—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.field_short_title: HPV vaccine shown to also protect against oral HPV infection
row.field_page_description: Costa Rican women who received a vaccine targeting two types of the HPV that cause 70 percent of cervical cancers had the added benefit of protection against oral HPV infection.

row.field_short_title: Survival in prostate cancer prevention trial detailed
row.field_page_description: In the NCI-sponsored Prostate Cancer Prevention Trial, initial findings from a decade ago showed that the drug finasteride significantly reduced the risk of prostate cancer, but among those who did develop prostate cancer, paradoxically, the drug was asso

row.title: NIH study links Hodgkin lymphoma treatment to possible risk of stomach cancer
row.field_short_title: NIH study links Hodgkin lymphoma treatment to possible risk of stomach cancer
row.field_page_description: Hodgkin lymphoma survivors who received certain radiation and chemotherapy regimens have been found to be at increased risk of subsequently developing stomach cancer.

row.title: Finasteride Reduces the Risk of Low-Grade Prostate Cancer in Men 55 and Older
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that tested whether the drug finasteride could help prevent prostate cancer in men age 55 and older.

row.title: NCI clinician-scientists at the forefront of new prostate cancer diagnostics and treatment
row.field_short_title: NCI scientists at forefront of new prostate cancer diagnostics
row.field_page_description: Introduction of the UroNav was the result of nearly a decade’s research and development, principally conducted at NCI. Resembling a stylized computer workstation on wheels, the system electronically fuses together pictures from magnetic resonance imaging

row.title: Avon Foundation for Women, NIH, and The Center for Advancing Innovation launch start-up challenge to advance breast cancer biomedical inventions; student and entrepreneur mentor teams to develop strategic business plan and launch biotech start-up
row.field_short_title: Avon Foundation, NIH, and CAI launch start-up challenge
row.field_page_description: A world-wide competition to bring emerging breast cancer technologies to market is being launched by the Avon Foundation for Women, in partnership with NCI and the Center for Advancing Innovation.

row.title: New studies demonstrate that modified T cells are effective in treating blood-borne cancers
row.field_short_title: Studies demonstrate modified T cells effective in treating blood-borne cancers
row.field_page_description: At the 2013 American Society of Hematology meeting in Dec. 2013, James Kochenderfer, M.D., NCI, presented findings from two clinical trials evaluating the use of genetically modified immune system T cells as cancer therapy. These reports represent import

row.title: January is Cervical Cancer Awareness Month
row.field_short_title: January is Cervical Cancer Awareness Month

row.title: Treatment of Head and Neck Cancer in Adults—Health Professional Version
row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Cancer Treatment in Adults
row.field_page_description: Find information about prognosis, staging, and treatment for adult head and neck cancer sites: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ - Recent Fiscal Year Funding
row.field_page_description: The 21st Century Cures Act authorized $1.8 billion to fund the Cancer Moonshot over a 7-year period. See appropriated funding by fiscal year for the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: NCI Launches the Intramural Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (iCURE) Program!
row.field_page_description: The new iCURE program supports students’ and scientists’ mentored research experiences in the NCI research community and encourages participation by underrepresented individuals.

row.title: Abiraterone Approved for Earlier Use in Men with Metastatic Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Abiraterone Approval Expanded for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: The FDA has expanded the approval of abiraterone (Zytiga) to treat men with metastatic prostate cancer. The agency approved abiraterone, in combination with prednisone, for men whose cancer that is responsive to hormone-blocking treatments (also known as castration-sensitive) and is at high risk of progressing.

row.title: Cabozantinib Approval Expands Initial Treatment Options for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cabozantinib for Initial Treatment of Kidney Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved cabozantinib (Cabometyx®) as an initial treatment for patients with advanced renal cell carcinoma. The approval adds another tyrosine kinase inhibitor to the available options for patients with advanced kidney cancer.

row.title: Forging Military Partnerships to Empower the Cancer Research Enterprise
row.field_short_title: NCI Partners with VA, DoD for Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Partnerships and collaborations are an important component of NCI’s success. In this Cancer Currents blog post, NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless describes three efforts made possible by a memorandum of agreement with three US military institutions: the APOLLO network, NAVIGATE, and BD-STEP.

row.title: NIH-funded study shows sorafenib improves progression-free survival for patients with rare sarcomas
row.field_short_title: Sorafenib Improved Progression-free Survival in Desmoid Tumor Study
row.field_page_description: In an NCI-funded trial for patients with desmoid tumors or aggressive fibromatosis (DT/DF), rare sarcomas with limited treatment options, the drug sorafenib tosylate (Nexavar) extended progression-free survival compared with a placebo.

row.title: Worldwide trends show oropharyngeal cancer rates increasing
row.field_short_title: Worldwide trends show oropharyngeal cancer rates increasing
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists report that the incidence of oropharyngeal cancer significantly increased during the period 1983-2002 among people in countries that are economically developed. Oropharyngeal cancer occurs primarily in the middle part of the throat behind t

row.field_page_description: Scientists have mapped the genetic changes that drive tumors in rhabdomyosarcoma, a pediatric soft-tissue cancer, and found that the disease is characterized by two distinct genotypes. The genetic alterations identified in this malignancy could be useful

row.title: Legislative Activities
row.field_page_description: Find information on current and past legislation along with resources to learn more on congressional activities impacting NCI.

row.field_page_description: Legislation from the current Congress dealing with cancer research related to NCI.

row.field_page_description: Congressional resolutions from the current Congress related to NCI's mission.

row.title: The Cancer Genome Atlas: More Than a Large Collection of Data

row.field_page_description: Though TCGA will wrap up in 2016 with a concluding symposium, cancer genomics projects built upon the success of TCGA will continue to play a major part in the NCI’s mission to better understand and treat cancer in the years to come.

row.title: Cruciferous Vegetables and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies about cruciferous vegetables and cancer. Includes a list of cruciferous vegetables and dietary recommendations.

row.title: NIH study finds childhood CT scans linked to leukemia and brain cancer later in life
row.field_short_title: Childhood CT scans linked to leukemia and brain cancer later in life
row.field_page_description: Children and young adults scanned multiple times by computed tomography (CT), a commonly used diagnostic tool, have a small increased risk of leukemia and brain tumors in the decade following their first scan.

row.title: NCI Dictionary of Cancer Terms Widget
For Some Skin Cancers, Targeted Drug Hits the Mark
row.field_short_title: For Some Skin Cancers, Targeted Drug Hits the Mark
row.field_page_description: Two studies reported June 7, 2012, in NEJM indicate that the drug vismodegib can elicit responses in people with advanced or metastatic basal cell carcinoma and help shrink or prevent tumors in those with basal cell nevus syndrome.

row.title: Coordinating Center for Clinical Trials (CCCT)
row.field_page_description: The Coordinating Center for Clinical Trials (CCCT) plays a key role in supporting NCI’s clinical and translational research programs to advance science and patient care.

row.title: Dasatinib Approved by FDA for Some Children with Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Dasatinib Approved for Some Children with Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved dasatinib (Sprycel®) for children with chronic myelogenous leukemia (CML) that expresses the Philadelphia chromosome and whose disease is in the chronic phase.

row.title: How to Navigate the CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard: Access to Translational Data
row.field_page_description: How the NCI’s CTD<sup>2</sup>Dashboard makes it easy to access and utilize genomic research data for developing cancer treatments.

row.title: Drug Combination Improves Outlook for Some Patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: New Drug Combination Shows Promise for CLL
row.field_page_description: Venetoclax (Venclexta) and rituximab (Rituxan) substantially improved progression-free survival in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) compared with chemotherapy, MURANO trial shows.

row.title: Intramural Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (iCURE)
row.field_page_description: iCURE supports mentored research experiences for students and scientists in the NCI research community. iCURE encourages the participation of underrepresented individuals.

row.title: The Challenging Landscape of Cancer and Aging: Charting a Way Forward
row.field_short_title: The Challenging Landscape of Cancer and Aging
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses research to bettter understand the biology of aging and its relationship to cancer, as well as participation in cancer clinical trials by older patients.

row.title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_short_title: Low-Dose Radioactive Iodine Destroys Thyroid Tissue Left after Surgery
row.field_page_description: A low dose of radioactive iodine given after surgery for thyroid cancer destroyed (ablated) residual thyroid tissue as effectively as a higher dose, with fewer side effects and less exposure to radiation, according to two randomized controlled trials.

row.title: Expanding the Playing Field: Immune-Based Therapy Shows Potential for Lung, Other Cancers
row.field_short_title: Expanding the Playing Field: Immune-Based Therapy Shows Potential for Lung, Other Cancers
row.field_page_description: Results from two early-phase clinical trials presented at the 2012 American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting provide further evidence that priming the immune system to attack tumors has potential as a treatment for certain cancers.

row.title: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee
row.field_page_description: Clinical Trials and Translational Research Advisory Committee, CTAC, is an external oversight committee that advises NCI leadership on its clinical and translational research enterprises.

row.title: New Lancet Oncology publication - Defining a research and policy agenda for betel quid and areca nut
row.field_short_title: New Lancet Oncology publication - Defining a research and policy agenda for betel quid and areca nut

row.title: Selected Presentations by the NCI Director
row.field_short_title: Selected Presentations by the NCI Director
row.field_page_description: This page lists some of the presentations given by Dr. Norman "Ned" Sharpless during his time as NCI director.

row.title: Brentuximab Vedotin Approved for Two Rare Lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Brentuximab Approved for Two Rare Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Brentuximab vedotin (Adcetris®) has been approved for the treatment of adults who have been treated previously for either primary cutaneous anaplastic large cell lymphoma or CD30-expressing mycosis fungoides.

row.title: Unique Trial Aims to Decrease Early Deaths in Patients with Rare Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Decreasing Early Deaths in Patients with Rare Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL) is a highly curable cancer. A new NCI-funded clinical trial is aimed at preventing early deaths in patients with APL.

row.title: Acupuncture May Reduce Treatment-Related Joint Pain for Breast Cancer Patients
row.field_short_title: Acupuncture May Reduce Joint Pain Caused by Breast Cancer Therapy
row.field_page_description: Acupuncture may reduce joint pain caused by aromatase inhibitors in postmenopausal women with breast cancer, according to results of a rigorous clinical trial.

row.title: Incidence of Cancers of the Lower Stomach Increasing among Younger Americans
row.field_short_title: Incidence of Lower Stomach Cancer in US Changing
row.field_page_description: The incidence of cancer that occurs in the lower stomach has been increasing among Americans under age 50, particularly in non-Hispanic white women.

row.title: RAS Community Outreach
row.field_page_description: Through community and technical collaborations, workshops and symposia, and the distribution of reference reagents, the RAS Initiative seeks to increase the sharing of knowledge and resources essential to defeating cancers caused by mutant RAS genes.

row.title: About Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information from the National Cancer Institute about cancer treatment, prevention, screening, genetics, causes, and how to cope with cancer.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Screening/Detection (Testing for Cancer)
