row.title: Visitor Information
row.field_page_description: Visitor information including directions by car and public transportation to NCI in Rockville, MD, and contact details for NCI campuses and the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, MD.

row.title: A to Z List of Cancer Drugs
row.field_short_title: A to Z List of Cancer Drugs
row.field_page_description: List of cancer drug information summaries providing details about cancer drugs and cancer drug combinations.

row.title: NCI and the Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences Sign Statement of Intent
row.field_short_title: NCI and the Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences Sign Statement of Intent
row.field_page_description: Today the National Cancer Institute (NCI) and the Cancer Institute/Hospital of the Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences (CICAMS) signed a statement of intent to share an interest in fostering collaborative biomedical research in oncology and a common goal

row.title: Find a Cancer Center
An Important Moment in Tobacco Control
row.field_short_title: An Important Moment in Tobacco Control
row.field_page_description: The major tobacco companies have begun publishing corrective statements explaining the harms of smoking, addressing common misconceptions about cigarettes.

row.title: Selected Publications by the NCI Director
row.field_short_title: Selected Publications by the NCI Director
row.field_page_description: Dr. Norman Sharpless's written work on cancer research appears in many leading scientific journals, as well as a variety of other publications. This page lists some of the articles published by Dr. Sharpless since becoming NCI director.

row.title: Genetic Ablation of KRAS in Pancreas Cancer: When an Essential Oncogene Isn’t
row.field_short_title: Genetic Ablation of KRAS in Pancreas Cancer: When an Essential Oncogene Isn’t
row.field_page_description: How pancreatic cancer cell lines adapt to loss of their mutant KRAS genes suggest how new treatments for pancreatic cancers should be used.

row.title: Partnerships
row.field_page_description: NCI fellows and trainees assist with science needs, workshops, and career guidance for middle school and high school students. Partner with us to enhance science education in your classroom.

row.title: Office of Cancer Genomics: Integration of Structural, Functional, and Computational Genomic Data Advances Precision Oncology
row.field_short_title: Collaborative Genomics Study Advances Precision Oncology

row.title: Interactive App Improves Colorectal Cancer Screening Rates
row.field_short_title: App Improves Colorectal Cancer Screening Rates
row.field_page_description: Colorectal cancer screening reduces deaths from the disease, yet about one-third of Americans aren’t up to date with screening. In this Cancer Currents blog post, learn what happened when people waiting for routine checkups could order their own screening test using a computer app.

row.title: NCI study revises molecular classification for most common type of lymphoma
row.field_short_title: NCI Study Offers Genetic Insights into Common Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: An NCI study identifies genetic subtypes of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL), helping explain why only some patients with this most common lymphoma respond to treatment, and offering a path toward targeted therapies.

row.title: PACHE Trainee Spotlight: Roslyn Curry Featured on Thesis Thursday Radio Show
row.field_short_title: PACHE Trainee Spotlight: Roslyn Curry Featured on Thesis Thursday Radio Show
row.field_page_description: Roslyn Curry, a student at the University of Arizona (UA), was featured on a local radio program, Thesis Thursday, where she discussed her participation in the U54 PACHE Partnership for Native American Cancer Prevention (NACP) as a research trainee in Dr. William Montfort’s Lab at the University of Arizona Cancer Cente

row.title: Some Children with Wilms Tumor Can Receive Less Therapy, Study Suggests
row.field_short_title: Less Therapy Okay for Some Children with Wilms Tumor?
row.field_page_description: Some children with advanced Wilms tumor, a form of kidney cancer, may be able to skip radiation therapy, findings from an NCI-funded clinical trial show. It’s unclear if the finding will change clinical practice, as this Cancer Currents post reports.

row.title: Patrick McGarey
row.field_page_description: Patrick McGarey, Associate Director for Finance and Legislation, oversees NCI budget, legislation, grants financing and administration, and technology transfer.

row.title: New on NCI Websites for June 2018
row.field_short_title: New on NCI Websites for June 2018
row.field_page_description: NCI’s online collection of cancer information products is constantly growing. See selected content of interest to the cancer community that has been added as of June 2018 in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Cancer Prevention Message Is Key for HPV Vaccination Discussions with Parents
row.field_short_title: HPV Vaccination and Parents: What Message Works Best?
row.field_page_description: When it comes to the HPV vaccine, doctors should emphasize cancer prevention while discussing vaccination with the parents of preteens, results from a new study show. As this Cancer Currents post explains, parents thought this was the best message by far.

row.title: Requests for TCGA Materials
Approval of Osimertinib and Necitumumab Increases Lung Cancer Treatment Options
row.field_short_title: Approvals Increase Lung Cancer Treatment Options
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved two targeted therapies, osimertinib (Tagrisso™) and necitumumab (Portrazza™), for the treatment of some patients with advanced lung cancer.

row.title: Video Intervention Helps Prepare Patients to Participate in Cancer Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: Video Helps Prepare Patients to Participate in Cancer Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Patients who took part in a tailored, video-based educational program had a better understanding of and fewer concerns about participating in clinical trials than patients who received text-based educational.

row.title: Tackling the Global Cancer Burden: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Ted Trimble
row.field_short_title: Tackling the Global Cancer Burden: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Ted Trimble
row.field_page_description: In honor of World Cancer Day, the director of NCI’s Center for Global Health discusses key opportunities in global cancer research.

row.title: Prospective Study Links HPV Detection in the Mouth to Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Confirms Oral HPV Infection Precedes Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: A new study confirms that infection with HPV 16 precedes the development of head and neck cancer.

row.title: NCI-DOE Collaboration Paving Way for Large-Scale Computational Cancer Science
row.field_short_title: Paving the Way for Large-Scale Computational Cancer Science
row.field_page_description: NCI and the Department of Energy have entered into a collaboration to develop a plan to use large-scale computing to influence cancer science and, ultimately, clinical treatment.

row.title: What’s New on NCI’s Websites?
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Study of Cancer’s Origins Reveals Genetic Reprogramming of Single Cells
row.field_short_title: Zebrafish Model of Cancer Reveals Genetic Reprogramming of Single Cells
row.field_page_description: Researchers have used a new zebrafish model of cancer to characterize the early genetic changes associated with the initiation of tumors.

row.title: High-Magnification Microscopy Visualizes Tumor Blood Vessels in Real Time
row.field_short_title: Researchers visualize tumor blood vessels during surgery
row.field_page_description: High powered intravital microscopy reveals that 50 percent of blood vessels in melanoma tumors do not have any blood flow, according to a new study.

row.title: Blocking Calcium Transfer May Selectively Kill Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Blocking Calcium Transfer May Selectively Kill Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that blocking the transfer of calcium ions into mitochondria is toxic to cancer cells and impairs growth of tumors in mice, while sparing normal cells.

row.title: The Cancer Community's Next Steps for the Moonshot Initiative
row.field_short_title: Next Steps for the Moonshot Initiative
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Moonshot Initiative’s Blue Ribbon Panel is moving quickly to develop recommendations on how to accelerate progress against cancer.

row.title: TCGA Data Types Collected
row.field_page_description: Learn about the molecular and clinical data generated for TCGA samples.

row.title: FDA Alters Approved Use of Two Checkpoint Inhibitors for Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: Checkpoint Inhibitor Use Changed for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has altered the approved uses of pembrolizumab (Keytruda) and atezolizumab (Tecentriq) to treat the most common form of bladder cancer. The change is based on whether patients’ tumors have a specific biomarker.

row.title: Developing Biomarkers for Immunotherapy: A Conversation with Drs. Magdalena Thurin and Helen Chen
row.field_page_description: Identifying biomarkers for cancer immunotherapy is the goal of a new NCI-supported research network. Such markers can help to identify patients most likely to benefit from immune-based treatments.

row.title: Develop Ways to Overcome Cancer’s Resistance to Therapy
row.field_page_description: Cancer cells can develop resistance to drugs that were previously effective. This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to increase understanding of how this resistance develops, and to use biomarkers to predict who will develop it, and ways to counteract it to improve patient care and survival.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Endometrial Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Endometrial Carcinoma

row.title: Establish a Network for Direct Patient Engagement
row.field_page_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative will engage patients to contribute their tumor profile data to expand knowledge about what therapies work, in whom, and in which types of cancer. A patient’s genomic data may guide treatment decisions.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Urothelial Bladder Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Urothelial Bladder Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Urothelial Bladder Carcinoma

row.title: Generation of Human Tumor Atlases
row.field_page_description: Human tumor atlases act as maps that describe the multidimensional cellular, structural, and molecular characteristics of human cancers over time. This information will improve understanding of how cancers develop and respond to treatment, ultimately improving care.

row.title: Rosenberg, NCI-supported researchers to receive 2018 Albany Prize
row.field_short_title: Rosenberg named co-recipient of 2018 Albany Prize
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Steven A. Rosenberg, M.D., Ph.D., has been named a recipient of the 2018 Albany Medical Center Prize in Medicine and Biomedical Research for his pioneering immunotherapy research. He will share the prize with two NCI-supported immunotherapy researchers.

row.title: NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP)
row.field_page_description: The NCI Community Oncology Research Program (NCORP) is a community-based program that brings cancer clinical trials and cancer care delivery research to individuals in their own communities.

row.title: Olaparib Approved for Treating Some Breast Cancers with BRCA Gene Mutations
row.field_short_title: Olaparib Approved for Breast Cancers with BRCA Gene Mutations
row.field_page_description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved olaparib (Lynparza®) to treat metastatic breast cancers that have inherited mutations in the BRCA1 or BRCA2 genes as well as a companion diagnostic test for selecting candidates for the therapy.

row.title: For Rare Melanoma, Checkpoint Inhibitors May Hold Substantial Promise
row.field_short_title: Checkpoint Inhibitors Hold Promise for Rare Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Patients with a rare form of melanoma, called desmoplastic melanoma, may be particularly likely to benefit from immune checkpoint inhibitors, a new study shows. As this Cancer Currents post explains, an NCI-sponsored clinical trial is already testing one such drug, pembrolizumab (Keytruda) in patients with this cancer.

row.title: Clinical Trials for Childhood Brain Stem Glioma
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials for Childhood Brain Stem Glioma

row.title: Drug May Help Prevent Resistance to Toxin-Based Leukemia Therapy
row.field_short_title: Drug May Help Prevent Resistance to Toxin-Based Leukemia Therapy
row.field_page_description: Adding the drug 5-AZA to moxetumomab pasudotox, a toxin-based cancer drug, may improve its efficacy in acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL). As this Cancer Currents blog post explains, in mice, both drugs were more effective than moxetumomab alone.

row.title: Brachytherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: When getting brachytherapy, a solid source of radiation is put inside your body. It can be used treat different kinds of cancer, head and neck, breast, cervix, prostate, and eye. Learn more about how what to expect when getting internal radiation therapy.

row.title: Assessing the International Landscape of Cancer Research through Successful Partnership
Get Involved: Community Groups for Trainees and Fellows
row.field_page_description: Cancer research fellows and trainees will find information about special interest groups at NCI and NIH. Learn more about how to get involved.

row.title: New to NCI: Information for New Trainees and Fellows
row.field_short_title: New to NCI: Information for New Trainees
row.field_page_description: Fellows and cancer research trainees will find information to support their onboarding at NCI, including stipend and tax information and NIH rules and regulations. Learn more about orientation for NCI trainees.

row.title: Conversation with Elizabeth Jaffee: An Immuno-Oncology Update
row.field_short_title: Conversation with Elizabeth Jaffee: An Immuno-Oncology Update
row.field_page_description: Immunotherapy has dramatically improved the outlook for some cancer patients. Researchers are striving to increase the proportion of patients that respond.

row.title: New approach to immunotherapy leads to complete response in breast cancer patient unresponsive to other treatments
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy targets metastatic breast cancer–cell mutations
row.field_page_description: A novel approach to immunotherapy developed by NCI researchers led to the complete regression of breast cancer in a patient who was unresponsive to all other treatments. The findings were published in Nature Medicine.

row.title: Midcareer Investigator Award in Patient-Oriented Research (K24)
After Rising for Decades, Thyroid Cancer Incidence Stabilizes
row.field_page_description: After rising steadily since the 1990s, the incidence of thyroid cancer in the United States may be leveling off, according to an analysis of data from NCI’s SEER program.

row.title: Calling on Data Enthusiasts to Help Advance Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Data Sharing and the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_page_description: Health data enthusiasts of all stripes were in Washington, D.C., today for Health Datapalooza. NCI's Dr. Warren Kibbe explains that this annual event explores a topic that is central to NCI’s efforts against cancer: creating knowledge from data.

row.title: Survival Disparities Identified in Young African Americans with Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Survival Disparities Identified in Young African Americans with Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: A blog post on a new study that found African Americans younger than age 50 who are diagnosed with colorectal cancer have significantly worse survival rates than whites of the same age.

row.title: Newly launched Genomic Data Commons to facilitate data and clinical information sharing
row.field_short_title: Newly launched Genomic Data Commons to facilitate data and clinical information sharing
row.field_page_description: The Genomic Data Commons (GDC), a unified data system that promotes sharing of genomic and clinical data between researchers, launched today with a visit from Vice President Joe Biden to the operations center at the University of Chicago.

row.title: Nanotechnology for Treating Cancer: Pitfalls and Bridges on the Path to Nanomedicines
row.field_short_title: Nanotechnology for Treating Cancer: Pitfalls and Bridges on the Path to Nanomedicines

row.title: TAS-102 Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial that compared TAS-102 with placebo in patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose disease progressed following prior treatment.

row.field_short_title: A Conversation with NCI Acting Director, Dr. Douglas R. Lowy

row.field_page_description: The Division of Cancer Biology funds investigator-initiated cancer research using a variety of grant mechanisms such as FOA, PA, RFA & NOT.

row.field_page_description: The Partnership for Public Service presented the 2015 People’s Choice Award to the government staff and researchers who have worked on The Cancer Genome Atlas.

Tool Weighs Benefits, Risks of Raloxifene or Tamoxifen to Prevent Breast Cancer

row.field_page_description: Researchers have developed a benefit-risk index to help guide decisions on whether postmenopausal women at increased risk of developing breast cancer should take raloxifene or tamoxifen to reduce that risk.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Malignant Mesothelioma
Drugs Approved for Multiple Myeloma and Other Plasma Cell Neoplasms
Combination of Idelalisib and Rituximab Improves Survival in Patients with Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Idelalisib Plus Rituximab for Relapsed Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international double-blind phase III trial that compared the combination of idelalisib plus rituximab (Rituxan®) versus placebo plus rituximab.

row.title: NCI-supported facility to conduct cancer trials breaks ground in Puerto Rico
row.field_short_title: NCI-supported facility to conduct cancer trials breaks ground in Puerto Rico
row.field_page_description: The Puerto Rican government has allocated $196 million dollars to build a 287,000 sq. ft., 96-bed, cancer hospital in San Juan. The new hospital, which will provide cancer treatment and conduct clinical trials, is the first of its kind in the Caribbean.

row.title: Global Health Events
row.field_page_description: CGH sponsors a number of global health events for both national and international audiences, focused on the open exchange of scientific knowledge.

row.title: About NCI Center for Global Health
row.field_short_title: About NCI Center for Global Health
row.field_page_description: Provides assistance and guidance to nations as they develop and implement cancer control plans, trains international investigators, and strengthens U.S. national, regional, multilateral, and bilateral collaboration.

row.field_page_description: The Gastrointestinal Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization, and evaluation of concepts for phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in adult gastrointestinal cancers.

row.title: Lymphoma Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Lymphoma Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization and evaluation of concepts for phase II and phase III clinical trials in adult lymphoma.

row.field_page_description: The Symptom Management and Health-Related Quality of Life Steering Committee (SxQoLSC) evaluates and prioritizes clinical trial concepts to manage cancer symptoms and cancer treatment side effects.

row.title: Clinical Imaging Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Imaging Steering Committee serves as a forum for the extramural imaging and oncology communities to provide strategic input to the NCI regarding its significant investment in imaging activities in clinical trials.

row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) announced a collaboration with the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation (MMRF) to incorporate MMRF's wealth of genomic and clinical data on the disease into the NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC), a publicly available datab

row.title: TARGET Initiative Fueling Progress Against Childhood Leukemia

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about how TARGET, an NCI-funded initiative, has led to the launch of clinical trials of targeted therapies for childhood leukemia.

row.field_short_title: Educating Patients about Genetic Test Results
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about the COMET study, which will examine the impact of counseling patients about the results of their tumor profiling results.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about results from a phase II clinical trial showing durable tumor responses to the immunotherapy drug avelumab in patients with metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from Dr. Julia Rowland, director of NCI’s Office of Cancer Survivorship, on efforts to ensure continued progress in survivorship research

row.title: Immune-Cell Traps May Aid Cancer Metastasis

row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a new study that suggests cancer cells may exploit a normal function of neutrophils, a type of immune cell, to help form metastatic tumors.

row.title: Early-phase trial demonstrates shrinkage in pediatric neural tumors
row.field_page_description: The drug selumetinib shrunk neural tumors in children with plexiform neurofibromas.

TCGA study identifies genomic features of cervical cancer
row.field_page_description: Investigators have identified novel genomic and molecular characteristics of cervical cancer.

row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that pembrolizumab improved progression-free and overall survival for patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post from NCI Acting Director Dr. Doug Lowy describing a series of funding opportunity announcements related to the Beau Biden Cancer Moonshot℠.

row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog featuring NCI’s Dr. Paul Jacobsen discussing NCI’s Healthcare Delivery Research Program and improving the delivery of cancer care.

row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2015.

row.title: NCI HIV and AIDS Research
row.field_page_description: OHAM is driving important advances in prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of HIV-associated malignancies. Learn about major programs and initiatives.

row.title: HIV and AIDS Research Resources
row.field_page_description: NCI offers resources to investigators researching HIV/AIDS and HIV-malignancies. Find resources that are specific to this area and links to other selected resources.

row.title: International Conference on Malignancies in HIV/AIDS (ICMH)
row.field_short_title: International Conference on Malignancies in HIV/AIDS (ICMH)
row.field_page_description: This biannual conference focuses on presentation of basic, epidemiologic, and clinical aspects of research on malignancies in HIV-infected and other immunosuppressed individuals.

row.title: Researchers Design a Precise Library for CRISPR-Mediated Genetic Screens
row.field_page_description: Researchers used machine learning method to optimize CRISPR libraries for genomic studies.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of pembrolizumab for the treatment of some adult and pediatric patients with classical Hodgkin lymphoma.

row.title: NCI's Genome Characterization Pipeline
row.field_page_description: The Genome Characterization Pipeline, run by NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics, transforms cancer tissue samples into rich genomic datasets that are shared with the research community.

row.title: Patients Who Choose No Intervention for Small Thyroid Cancers Report Lack of Support
row.field_short_title: Choosing No Intervention for Thyroid Cancer Can Be Difficult
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that patients with early stage thyroid cancers who don’t pursue immediate intervention experience a lack of support from doctors, loved ones.

row.title: Robert Yarchoan, M.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn more about Robert Yarchoan, M.D., director of NCI Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy.

row.title: The Mutational Spectra of Cancer Genes in TCGA Data
row.field_short_title: The Mutational Spectra of Cancer Genes in TCGA Data
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Genome Atlas has catalogued mutations in more than 30 cancer types. Bar graphs show data for KRAS, HRAS, NRAS, BRAF, TP53, EGFR, PIK3CA, and PTEN.

row.title: Aiming to Prevent Hereditary Cancers, Researchers Focus on Lynch Syndrome
row.field_short_title: NCI Lynch Syndrome Workshop Focuses on Preventing Hereditary Cancers
row.field_page_description: An NCI research update article about a workshop to discuss new strategies for preventing hereditary cancers by using Lynch syndrome as a model.

row.title: Regorafenib Becomes First FDA-Approved Drug for Liver Cancer in Nearly a Decade
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Regorafenib for Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on FDA’s approval of regorafenib (Stivarga®), the first drug approved for liver cancer in nearly a decade.

row.title: HPV Vaccination Linked to Decreased Oral HPV Infections
row.field_short_title: HPV Vaccine May Prevent Oral HPV Infection
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that the HPV vaccine Gardasil may sharply reduce oral HPV infections linked to oropharyngeal cancer.

row.title: Genomic Study Seeks Clues to Help Explain Breast Cancer Disparities
row.field_short_title: Genome Study of Breast Cancer in African Americans
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on a genomic study that assessed the extent to which molecular characteristics of breast tumors may help to explain some breast cancer disparities.

row.title: CRCHD Announces New CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar Series
row.field_page_description: In celebration of 21 years of the CURE program, CRCHD is pleased to announce a new scientific seminar series the CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar Series.

row.title: NCI study identifies essential genes for cancer immunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Study identifies essential genes for immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: An NCI press release about a study in Nature that identifies genes in cancer cells that could play a role in immunotherapy response and may help explain why some patients don’t respond.

row.title: Survivors of Breast Cancer Differ on Who Should Manage Follow-Up Care
row.field_short_title: Breast Cancer Survivors’ Preferences on Follow-Up Care
row.field_page_description: Some survivors of early-stage breast cancer prefer that their oncologist handle aspects of their routine follow-up care, according to a new study discussed in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Study Uncovers Previously Unrecognized Effect of Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: A study conducted primarily in mice suggests that pre-surgical chemotherapy in breast cancer can cause changes in cells in and around the tumor that aid metastasis.

row.title: We've Updated Clinical Trials
Manage Your Award
Heart Attack, Stroke Risk May Be Elevated Following Cancer Diagnosis
row.field_short_title: Heart Attack, Stroke Risk Elevated Following Cancer Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: A cancer diagnosis can come with an increased risk of a heart attack or stroke in the months after beginning treatment, a new study suggests.

row.title: Engineering Personalized Micro-Tumor Ecosystems
row.field_page_description: This study seeks to develop a micronized tumor ecosystem which can be used to choose the most effective cancer therapy for a patient before initiation of treatment.

row.title: TMIST (Tomosynthesis Mammographic Imaging Screening Trial)
row.field_page_description: TMIST is a randomized breast screening trial that compares two Food and Drug Administration (FDA)-approved types of digital mammography, standard digital mammography (2-D) with a newer technology called tomosynthesis mammography (3-D).

row.title: Addressing the Global Burden of Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Addressing the Global Burden of Breast Cancer

row.title: Ofelia Olivero, Ph.D.

row.title: 2016 Outstanding Investigator Award Recipients
row.field_page_description: Learn how these investigators' projects aim to break new ground in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical cancer research.

row.title: Create an Adult Immunotherapy Network
row.field_page_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to establish an adult cancer immunotherapy network to develop immune-based approaches for the treatment and prevention of cancer in adult patients and discover why immunotherapy is effective in some patients but not in others.

row.title: Minimize Cancer Treatment’s Debilitating Side Effects
row.field_page_description: Cancer Moonshot initiative to develop a better system for monitoring and managing patient-reported side effects, in an effort to minimize debilitating side effects and reduce cancer costs related to poorly controlled symptoms.

row.field_short_title: Engaging Brazilian Partners in Collaborative Cancer Research

row.field_page_description: Faced with a rare disease, a caregiver founds a patient advocacy group and joins a collaborative genomic research effort.

row.field_page_description: Scientists at the National Institutes of Health, and their colleagues, have discovered that a gene called BACH2 may play a central role in the development of diverse allergic and autoimmune diseases, such as multiple sclerosis, asthma, Crohn's disease, ce

row.title: Reforms speed initiation of NCI-sponsored clinical trials

row.field_page_description: The process of opening a cancer clinical trial for patient accrual often takes years, and research has shown that trials which are slow to register patients often fail to finish. Following a thorough review, NCI’s Operational Efficiency Working Group prod

row.title: Study in mice finds decreased glucose metabolism increases immune potential
row.field_short_title: Study in mice finds decreased glucose metabolism increases immune potential
row.field_page_description: Regulating glucose metabolism in immune cells may extend and enhance their ability to fight cancer and infection.

row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that compared the combination of pomalidomide (Pomalyst®) and low-dose dexamethasone versus high-dose dexamethasone alone in patients with multiple myeloma that has progressed despite other treatments.

row.field_page_description: A pilot trial to assess whether assigning treatment based on specific gene mutations can provide benefit to patients with metastatic solid tumors is being launched this month by the NCI. The Molecular Profiling based Assignment of Cancer Therapeutics, or

row.title: Hearings and Testimonies
row.field_page_description: Written testimony from NCI experts from appropriations hearings and other hearings focused on cancer research and related topics.

row.field_short_title: Patient with Brain Tumor Responds Dramatically to Targeted Therapy

row.field_short_title: Treating Cancer without Harming the Heart
row.field_page_description: Researchers from the fields of oncology and cardiology are working to find ways to prevent, manage, and possibly even reverse the cardiovascular side effects of certain cancer therapies.

row.title: Precision Medicine Trials for Cancer: A New Era
row.field_short_title: Trials offer flexibility, efficiency, and potential for rapid advances.
row.field_page_description: Advances in genomics, imaging, bioinformatics, and related disciplines, allow us to design smaller, quicker, and smarter trials that incorporate the principal tenets of precision medicine.

row.title: Cancer Cell Biology Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI's Division of Cancer Biology research portfolio, this research defines the biological basis for the differences between normal cells and cancer cells.

row.title: Supporting Vice President Biden's Cancer Initiative
row.field_short_title: Supporting Vice President Biden’s Cancer Initiative
row.field_page_description: A message from NCI Acting Director Doug Lowy on the Institute's readiness to work with partners on Vice President Biden's cancer research initiative.

row.field_page_description: Press releases from the National Cancer Institute for the year 2016.

row.title: Center for Research Strategy Contact and Staff
row.field_page_description: Staff and contact information for the Center for Research Strategy.

row.title: Keeping Pace: How New Data Can Affect Ongoing Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: How New Data Can Affect Ongoing Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Research results sometimes outrace the design of an ongoing clinical trial and the trial has to be recalibrated to include newer treatments, according to NCI’s Dr. Jo Anne Zujewski.

row.title: Vaccine Therapy for Unresectable Chordoma
row.field_page_description: In this phase II clinical trial, adult patients with inoperable chordoma who are scheduled to undergo radiation therapy will be randomly assigned to receive a yeast-based vaccine that targets a protein called brachyury or a placebo injection.

row.field_page_description: Research Programs from NCI's Division of Cancer Biology - PS-ON, CSBC, TMEN, OMF, BETRNet, KRAS, MCL, TEC

row.title: Pembrolizumab Shows Promise in Patients with Rare Form of Skin Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Shows Promise against Rare Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a small clinical trial, more than half of the patients with an aggressive form of skin cancer called Merkel cell carcinoma responded to the immunotherapy drug pembrolizumab.

row.field_short_title: Bringing global cancer leaders together at the 4th Annual Symposium on Global Cancer Research

row.title: New Treatment Target Identified for Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Study Identifies Potential Lymphoma Treatment Target
row.field_page_description: NCI researchers have identified new therapeutic targets for diffuse large B-cell lymphoma. Drugs that hit these targets are under clinical development and the researchers hope to begin testing them in clinical trials of patients with DLBCL.

row.title: Improving Cancer Control in Rural Communities: An Interview with Dr. Robert Croyle
row.field_short_title: Improving Cancer Control in Rural Communities
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Dr. Robert Croyle discusses some of the issues related to cancer control faced by rural communities and how NCI is approaching this important problem.

row.title: Charting a Course toward Precision Cancer Prevention
row.field_short_title: Charting a Course toward Precision Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: Cancer researchers are increasingly exploring how cancer risk is influenced by genetic predisposition to cancer and the effects of environmental exposures, and what this means for cancer prevention.

row.title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy for Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy for Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved nivolumab (Opdivo®) for the treatment of patients with classical Hodgkin lymphoma whose disease has relapsed or worsened after receiving an autologous hematopoietic stem cell transplantation followed by brentuximab vedotin (Adcetris®)

row.title: FDA Approves New Immunotherapy Drug for Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Atezolizumab for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on the FDA approval of atezolizumab (Tecentriq®) for the treatment of patients with the most common type of bladder cancer.

row.title: Trials Produce Practice-Changing Results for Brain Cancer
row.field_short_title: Trials Produce Practice-Changing Results for Brain Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about two clinical trials that showed treatment with temozolomide plus radiation increased overall and progression-free survival.

row.field_page_description: Explore the broad range of investigator-initiated research and programs funded by the Division of Cancer Biology (DCB) to advance existing and emerging research areas in cancer biology.

row.field_page_description: Discover the cutting edge technologies being used to better define target vulnerabilities in RAS proteins and pathways essential to cancer cells.

row.field_short_title: Integrated proteomic and genomic analysis of colorectal cancer
row.field_page_description: Investigators who analyzed 95 human colorectal tumor samples have determined how gene alterations identified in previous analyses of the same samples are expressed at the protein level. The integration of proteomic and genomic data, or proteogenomics, pro

row.title: Understanding Cervical Changes: Next Steps After an Abnormal Screening Test
row.field_page_description: Explains abnormal Pap test, HPV test, and Pap/HPV cotest results. Treatment and follow-up care for abnormal cervical cancer screening results including ASC-US, AGC, LSIL, ASC-H, HSIL, AIS. Learn about colposcopy, types of biopsies, CIN, and HPV vaccine.

row.title: Targeted Therapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Targeted therapy is a type of cancer treatment that targets the changes in cancer cells that help them grow, divide, and spread. Learn how targeted therapy works against cancer and about side effects that may occur.

row.title: NIH announces the launch of 3 integrated precision medicine trials; ALCHEMIST is for patients with certain types of early-stage lung cancer
row.field_short_title: NIH announces the launch of 3 integrated precision medicine trials: ALCHEMIST
row.field_page_description: The Adjuvant Lung Cancer Enrichment Marker Identification and Sequencing Trials, or ALCHEMIST, will identify early-stage lung cancer patients with tumors that harbor certain uncommon genetic changes and evaluate whether drug treatments targeted against

row.title: Monoclonal Antibody Therapy for Relapsed or Treatment-Resistant Neuroblastoma
row.field_short_title: Monoclonal Antibody Therapy for Relapsed or Treatment-Resistant Neuroblastoma
row.field_page_description: NCI is sponsoring two clinical trials of a monoclonal antibody called ch14.18, in combination with other drugs, to see if the antibody may be helpful for children or young adults (up to age 21) with relapsed or refractory neuroblastoma.

row.title: Study finds stronger nicotine dependency associated with higher risk of lung cancer
row.field_short_title: Study finds stronger nicotine dependency associated with higher risk of lung cancer
row.field_page_description: NCI headed study finds people who are highly addicted to nicotine -- those who smoke their first cigarette within five minutes after awakening -- are at higher risk of developing lung cancer than those who wait for an hour or more to smoke.

row.field_page_description: Find upcoming RAS-related workshops, seminars, and conferences and previously recorded webcasts of such events.

row.field_page_description: The RAS Structural Biology group determines the structures of RAS proteins, alone and in complex with important effectors.

row.field_page_description: CRCHD supports basic and translational research funding opportunities to increase our scientific knowledge and ultimately reduce cancer health disparities.

Caregiving after Treatment Ends
row.field_page_description: Even when treatment ends, both cancer survivors and caregivers are still dealing with a lot. Find information to help you understand and cope with the transition after cancer treatment.

row.title: Support for Teens When a Family Member has Cancer
row.field_short_title: Support for Teens When a Family Member has Cancer
row.field_page_description: When a parent, brother, or sister has been diagnosed with cancer, family members need extra support. Information to help teens learn how to cope, talk with family members, manage stress, and get support from counselors when a loved one has been diagnosed with, or is being treated for, cancer.

row.title: Multiple biopsies are superior to a single biopsy in detecting cervical cancer precursors
row.field_short_title: Multiple biopsies superior to single biopsy in detecting cervical cancer precursors
row.field_page_description: Performing multiple biopsies during a procedure known as colposcopy—visual inspection of the cervix—is more effective than performing only a single biopsy of the worst-appearing area for detecting cervical cancer precursors. This multiple biopsy approach

row.title: Promoting Cancer Control in Indonesia
Nickel Compounds
row.field_page_description: Learn about nickel compounds, which can raise your risk of lung cancer and nasal cancer. Workers in mining, smelting, welding, and other industrial occupations are most commonly exposed to nickel.

row.title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal
row.field_short_title: Indoor Emissions from the Household Combustion of Coal
row.field_page_description: Learn about the lung cancer risk associated with burning coal inside your home. Indoor emissions from the household combustion of coal contain harmful chemicals such as benzene, carbon monoxide, and formaldehyde.

row.title: Cadmium
row.field_page_description: Learn about cadmium, which may raise your risk of lung cancer. Cadmium is a natural element: all soils and rocks contain some cadmium. Exposure occurs mostly where cadmium products (such as batteries, pigments, metal coatings, and plastics) are made or recycled. Tobacco smoke also contains cadmium.

row.title: Causes and Prevention
row.field_page_description: Covers known cancer risk factors, how certain cancers can be prevented, and ongoing research into causes and prevention.

row.title: New genetic risk variants identified in multiethnic analysis of prostate cancer
row.field_short_title: New genetic variants associated with prostate cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have newly identified 23 common genetic variants -- one-letter changes in DNA known as single-nucleotide polymorphisms or SNPs -- that are associated with risk of prostate cancer. These results come from an analysis of more than 10 million SNP

row.title: CRCHD Dialogue on Disparities
row.field_page_description: Blog from CRCHD. Stay up-to-date with cancer health disparities issues and read CRCHD spotlights on promising research findings and program updates.

row.field_short_title: Chemotherapy Less Toxic to the Heart May Be Option for Some Women with HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A nonanthracycline-containing chemotherapy regimen combined with the targeted therapy trastuzumab may be an option for some women with HER2-positive breast cancer, according to results from the BCIRG-006 trial.

row.title: CURE Scholar Spotlight - Dr. Donita Colette Brady
Tackling Cancer Health Disparities: Small Steps, Big Hopes
row.field_page_description: An article about steps for developing and testing ways to reduce—or eliminate—cancer-related health disparities.

row.field_short_title: National Cancer Institute’s New NCD Coordinator

row.title: Talking to Children about Your Cancer
Follow-Up Medical Care
Late Side Effects of Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatment can cause late side effects that may not show up for months or years after treatment. These late effects may include heart and lung problems, bone loss, eye and hearing changes, lymphedema, and other problems

row.title: The Cancer Information Service (CIS)
Understanding Cancer Prognosis
State and County Exposure Levels to I-131
row.field_short_title: State and County Exposure Levels to I-131
row.field_page_description: Estimated average exposures to I-131 (iodine-131) for individuals living in the contiguous United States at the time of the Cold War, listed by state and county.

row.title: Wood Dust
row.field_page_description: Learn about wood dust, which can raise the risk of cancers of the paranasal sinuses and nasal cavity. High amounts of wood dust are produced in sawmills, and in the furniture-making, cabinet-making, and carpentry industries.

row.title: Soot
row.field_page_description: Learn about soot, which can raise the risk of scrotal and other skin cancers, as well as lung, esophageal, and bladder cancers. Soot is a byproduct of the burning of carbon-containing materials, such as wood, fuel oil, plastics, and household refuse. Chimney sweeps face the highest risk.

row.title: Erionite
row.field_page_description: Learn about erionite, which can raise your risk of lung cancer and mesothelioma. Erionite is a a naturally occurring fibrous mineral. Erionite-related disease has been reported most often among road construction and maintenance workers.

row.title: Benzidine
row.field_page_description: Learn about benzidine, exposure to which raises your risk of bladder cancer. Benzidine is a manufactured chemical. In the past, benzidine was used to produce dyes or products used in clinical laboratories. However, benzidine has not been sold in the United States since the mid-1970s.

row.title: Report Offers Comprehensive Look at Global Smokeless Tobacco Use
row.field_short_title: Comprehensive Look at Global Smokeless Tobacco Use Report
row.field_page_description: The first report of its kind finds that more than 300 million people worldwide use smokeless tobacco products and that they are linked to a number of cancers.

row.title: Three-Drug Combination Benefits Some Patients with Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Three-Drug Combination for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
row.field_page_description: A summary of Interim results from an international, randomized phase III trial that suggest that adding carfilzomib (Kyprolis®) to a standard treatment improves outcomes for patients with multiple myeloma whose cancer has relapsed.

row.title: Implementation Research Workshop in Argentina: Moving Research into Practice
row.field_short_title: Implementation Research Workshop in Argentina: Moving Research into Practice

row.field_short_title: Strengthening National Cancer Planning Efforts and Building on 20 Years of US-Vietnam Relations

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer International Group (HNCIG)
Mouth and Throat Problems during Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments may cause dental, mouth, and throat side effects such as changes in taste (dysgeusia), dry mouth (xerostomia), infections, mouth sores, pain or swelling in your mouth (oral mucositis), sensitivity to foods, and swallowing problems.

row.title: Which Patients Will Benefit from Immunotherapy for Cancer? Some Hints Emerge
row.field_short_title: Who Will Benefit from Cancer Immunotherapy?
row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified a “genetic signature” in the tumors of patients with advanced melanoma who responded to a form of immunotherapy called checkpoint blockade. The results could be the basis for a test that identifies likely responders.

row.title: Understanding Prostate Changes: A Health Guide for Men
row.field_page_description: Prostate changes and symptoms that are not cancer. Learn about symptoms, risk factors, and treatment for prostatitis, enlarged prostate (BPH), prostate cancer. Talk with doctor about prostate cancer screening tests (DRE, PSA), biopsy, and Gleason score.

row.title: New on Cancer.gov: Resources on Melanoma Therapies
row.field_page_description: A blog post about several new Cancer.gov resources that provide details about the changing treatment landscape for advanced melanoma.

row.title: Environmental Carcinogens and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Factors are discussed that may influence whether a person exposed to a cancer-causing substance (carcinogen) will develop cancer.

row.title: Bleeding and Bruising (Thrombocytopenia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments, such as chemotherapy and targeted therapy, can increase patients’ risk of bleeding and bruising, also called thrombocytopenia. Learn about steps to take if you are at increased risk of a low platelet count.

row.title: Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: Cancer screening is checking for cancer in people who don't have symptoms. Screening tests can help doctors find and treat several types of cancer early, but cancer screening can have harms as well as benefits.

row.title: Women with BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations survive ovarian cancer at higher rates than those without mutations
row.field_short_title: Women with BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations survive ovarian cancer at higher rates
row.field_page_description: Results from a National Cancer Institute (NCI) sponsored multicenter study published in the Journal of the American Medical Association on January 25, 2012, provides strong evidence that BRCA1 and BRCA2 gene mutation carriers with ovarian cancer were more

row.title: CGH Celebrates World Cancer Day 2015
Support Services
row.field_page_description: Various services to help you cope during and after your cancer treatment.

row.title: Donor telomere length and survival after hematopoietic cell transplantation in patients with severe aplastic anemia
row.field_short_title: Donor telomere length and survival in severe aplastic anemia
row.field_page_description: A new NCI study has found that, among patients with severe aplastic anemia who received a hematopoietic cell transplant from an unrelated donor, those whose donor white blood cells had longer telomeres had higher survival rates five-years after transplant

row.title: Memory or Concentration Problems and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments, such as chemo, may cause difficulty thinking, concentrating, or other cognitive problems. Learn about steps people with cancer can take to manage these side effects. See a list of helpful questions for families to ask the doctor.

row.title: Intraocular (Eye) Melanoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Intraocular (uveal) melanoma is a rare cancer that forms in the eye. It usually has no early signs or symptoms. As with melanoma of the skin, risk factors include having fair skin and light-colored eyes. Start here to find information on intraocular melanoma treatment.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Your Diagnosis
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Your Diagnosis
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions for patients to ask their doctors when they learn they have cancer and want to know what to expect next.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Cancer
row.field_page_description: Sets of questions, organized by topic, that cancer patients may want to ask their doctors or other members of their health care team to learn more about their cancer and what to expect.

row.field_short_title: Medicare to Cover Annual Lung Cancer Screening for Some Beneficiaries

row.title: Screening Tests
row.field_page_description: Information about tests such as mammography and colonoscopy that may be used to screen for cancer in people without symptoms of disease.

row.title: Study Shows Elevated Number of Cancers in US HIV Positive Population
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Elevated Number of Cancers in US HIV Positive Population
row.field_page_description: In 2010, an estimated 7,760 new cancers were diagnosed among the nearly 900,000 Americans known to be living with HIV infection. According to the first comprehensive study in the United States, approximately half of these cancers were in excess of what wo

row.title: Cancer Staging
row.field_page_description: Staging is the process of determining how much cancer is within the body (tumor size) and if it has spread. Learn about the TNM Staging system and other ways that stage is described.

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Your Treatment
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Your Treatment
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions for cancer patients to ask their doctors about treatment choices and the possible side effects of cancer treatment.

Stem Cell Transplants in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Stem cell transplants are procedures that restore blood-forming stem cells in cancer patients who have had theirs destroyed by very high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy. Learn about the types of transplants and side effects that may occur.

row.field_page_description: NCI is addressing cancer health disparities through its efforts in basic research, community-level programs, and more.

row.title: Global Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: NCI is confronting the global burden of cancer through many programs and international partnerships.

row.field_page_description: The National Clinical Trials Network (NCTN) Steering Committees review concepts, or proposals, for large phase 2 or phase 3 treatment or imaging trials conducted in the NCTN.

row.field_page_description: Researchers, fellows, principal investigators, and medical doctors provide inspiration and advice to students interested in medical research.

row.field_page_description: Information on choosing a doctor or treatment facility, home care, financial help, insurance coverage, end-of-life planning, and resources to help you avoid scams.

row.title: Hormone Therapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Hormone therapy is a treatment that slows or stops the growth of breast and prostate cancers that use hormones to grow. Learn about the types of hormone therapy and side effects that may happen.

row.title: Step 3: Peer Review and Funding Outcomes
row.field_short_title: Step 3: Peer Review and Funding Outcomes
row.field_page_description: The NCI review process seeks to achieve a balanced grant portfolio, that addresses scientific priorities. Learn about NCI’s peer review for grant applications.

row.title: Special Spotlight: 2014 AACR Conference: The Science of Cancer Health Disparities in Racial/Ethnic Minorities and the Medically Underserved
Immunotherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Immunotherapy is treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer. Get information about the different types of immunotherapy and what you can expect during treatment.

row.title: Research on Causes of Cancer
Planning for Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: Find out what issues need to be addressed when dealing with an advanced or metastatic cancer diagnosis. Completing advance directives, looking at health insurance, organizing records and documents, and looking at the meanings in your life are some of the things to think about.

row.title: Smoking’s Disease Burden: Worse than Previously Thought?
row.field_short_title: Smoking’s Disease Burden: Worse than Previously Thought?
row.field_page_description: According to a new study, smoking may be responsible for far more deaths each year than previously thought.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer
row.field_page_description: The Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer is an update of rates for new cases, deaths, and trends for the most common cancers in the United States.

row.title: Resources
Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Care Delivery Research (CCDR) Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes cancer care delivery research study concepts for trials conducted through NCORP.

row.title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy Treatment for Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves First Immunotherapy Treatment for Lung Cancer

row.title: Sleep Problems (Insomnia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Sleep problems are a common side effect during cancer treatment. Learn how a polysomnogram can assess sleep problems. Learn about the benefits of managing sleep disorders in men and women with cancer.

row.title: Artificial Sweeteners and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that reviews research studies on the possible connection between artificial sweeteners and cancer.

row.title: Gastrointestinal Carcinoid Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Gastrointestinal (GI) carcinoid tumors are slow-growing tumors that form in the neuroendocrine cells in the GI tract. The GI tract includes the stomach, small intestine, colon, rectum, appendix, and other organs. Start here to find treatment information and research on gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors.

row.title: Psychological Stress and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the effects of stress on the body, the results of research on the relationship between stress and cancer, and information about coping with stress.

row.title: Where To Get Help When You Decide To Quit Smoking
row.field_short_title: Where To Get Help When You Decide To Quit Smoking
row.field_page_description: This fact sheet provides information about helpful resources for people who have decided to quit smoking.

row.title: Brain Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Brain tumors are growths of malignant cells in tissues of the brain. Tumors that start in the brain are called primary brain tumors. Tumors that spread to the brain are called metastatic brain tumors. Start here to find information on brain cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Adolescents and Young Adults with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information about cancer in adolescents and young adults (AYAs), including treatment, follow-up care, coping, and related research.

row.title: Genetically Engineered Immunotherapy for Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Genetically Engineered Immunotherapy for Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, doctors will collect T lymphocytes from patients with advanced mesothelin-expressing cancer and genetically engineer them to recognize mesothelin. The gene-engineered cells will be multiplied and infused into the patient to fight the cancer

row.title: Questions to Ask Your Doctor about Treatment Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: Questions to Ask about Treatment Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Suggested questions to ask your doctor, if you are thinking about taking part in a clinical trial.

row.title: Research Grants
row.field_page_description: NCI funds a range of cancer research activities through various mechanisms and pay lines. Find cancer research funding opportunities.

row.field_page_description: This fact sheet provides helpful tips related to smoking cessation.

row.title: Helicobacter pylori and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the relationship between H. pylori infection and gastric cancer, gastric mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma, and other cancers.

row.title: Parathyroid Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Parathyroid tumors are usually benign (not cancer) and are called adenomas. Parathyroid cancer is very rare. Having certain inherited disorders can increase the risk of parathyroid cancer. Start here to find information on parathyroid cancer treatment.

row.title: Cancer Training at NCI
row.field_page_description: Training, fellowships, and other professional education opportunities for students and scientists on the NIH/NCI campus in Maryland (intramural).

row.title: Deciding to Take Part in a Clinical Trial
row.field_page_description: Information to help people think about whether taking part in a cancer clinical trial is right for them. Covers benefits and risks of taking part, as well as eligibility criteria.

row.field_page_description: Researchers at the National Institutes of Health have discovered a genetic mutation that appears to increase production of red blood cells in tumors.

row.title: Radiation Therapy and You: Support for People With Cancer
row.field_page_description: This booklet explains the different types of radiation therapy, what people can expect during treatment, side effects that may happen and ways to manage them.

row.field_page_description: Find a list of frequently asked questions related to Biomarker, Imaging and Quality of Life Studies Funding Program (BIQSFP).

row.field_page_description: NCI’s Office of Management Policy and Compliance is responsible for NCI-wide evaluation and implementation of HHS, NIH and NCI policies, guidelines and regulations with oversight in the areas of Risk and Records Management, Organizational Change, PRA/OMB Clearance, Policy, and Delegated Authorities.

row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute’s collection of multimedia includes photography, illustrations, videos, infographics, and apps.

row.field_page_description: In this precision medicine clinical trial, children and adolescents with advanced cancers whose tumors have certain genetic mutations will be treated with drugs that are matched to those mutations.

row.title: Insurance Coverage and Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: Most health insurance plans are required to cover routine patient care costs in clinical trials under certain conditions. Learn about the conditions that insurance plans take into account and how to work with your insurance company.

row.field_page_description: Measurement of circulating tumor DNA in blood can be used to detect disease recurrence in patients with a curable form of cancer known as diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL). In most patients, measurement of ctDNA enabled detection of microscopic diseas

row.title: National Lung Screening Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: National Lung Screening Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: Learn the results of the National Lung Screening Trial (NLST), which compared two ways of detecting lung cancer: low-dose helical (spiral) computed tomography and standard chest X-ray, for their effects on lung cancer death rates in a high-risk population.

row.title: Emergency Resources for the Cancer Community

row.field_page_description: Information to help prepare for an emergency. Includes resources to continue cancer care, to prepare and update NCI employees and contractors, and NCI contacts for grantees.

row.field_page_description: Find RAS datasets, tools, and resources. You can also share your own tools with the community for further collaboration.

row.field_page_description: Insurance plans may cover some costs of taking part in a clinical trial. Learn who to contact for help, questions to ask, and the types of information to collect.

row.field_page_description: OGA supports grants and cooperative agreements awarded to scientific institutions, small businesses, and individuals to help build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda. Learn more about OGA and its program structure.

row.title: About the NCI Council of Research Advocates
row.field_short_title: About the NCI Council of Research Advocates
row.field_page_description: The NCRA focuses on matters that facilitate research and often identifies and responds to challenges facing the Institute at the request of NCI leadership.

row.title: RAS Drug Discovery
row.field_page_description: The RAS Drug Discovery group aims to develop assays that will reveal aspects of RAS biology upon which cancer cells depend. Successful assay formats are made available for high-throughput screening programs to yield potentially effective drug compounds.

row.title: Milestones in Cancer Research and Discovery
row.field_short_title: Milestones in Cancer Research and Discovery
row.field_page_description: During the past 250 years, we have witnessed many landmark discoveries in our efforts to make progress against cancer, an affliction known to humanity for thousands of years. This timeline shows a few key milestones in the history of cancer research.

row.title: NIH study finds leisure-time physical activity extends life expectancy as much as 4.5 years
row.field_page_description: Leisure-time physical activity is associated with longer life expectancy, even at relatively low levels of activity and regardless of body weight, according to a study by a team of researchers led by the NCI.

row.title: Eating Hints: Before, during, and after Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Eating Hints: Before, during, and after Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Eating Hints covers eating problems that may be caused by cancer and its treatment. Learn about common eating problems and ways to manage them.

row.title: Adding Chemotherapy to Radiation Improves Survival for Some Patients with Rare Brain Cancer
row.field_short_title: Adding Chemotherapy to Radiation Improves Survival for Some Patients with Rare Brain Cancer
row.field_page_description: Long-term results from two clinical trials confirm that certain patients with anaplastic oligodendrogliomas live substantially longer if they are treated with a combination of chemotherapy and radiation therapy rather than radiatiation alone.

row.title: Enzymology of GTP-competitive RAS inhibitors
Adrenocortical Carcinoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Adrenocortical carcinoma is also called cancer of the adrenal cortex. A tumor of the adrenal cortex may be functioning or nonfunctioning. Most adrenocortical tumors are functioning. Find evidence-based information on adrenocortical carcinoma including treatment and research.

row.title: Anal Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on anal cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Extracranial Germ Cell Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Extracranial germ cell tumors (GCTs) arise from primordial germ cells, which migrate during embryogenesis from the yolk sac to the gonads. Childhood extracranial GCTs can be divided into the following two types: gonadal, and extragonadal. Find evidence-based information on extracranial germ cell tumors treatment.

row.title: Gastrointestinal Carcinoid Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors are rare, slow-growing tumors that originate in the neuroendocrine cells in the GI tract. Find evidence-based information on gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors treatment and research.

row.title: Facing Forward: When Someone You Love Has Completed Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Facing Forward: When Someone You Love Has Completed Cancer Treatment

row.title: Study Shows Aspirin Reduces Colorectal Cancer in Those at High Risk
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Aspirin Reduces Colorectal Cancer in Those at High Risk
row.field_page_description: Findings from the first large clinical trial of its kind indicate that taking high doses of aspirin daily for at least 2 years substantially reduces the risk of colorectal cancer among people at increased risk of the disease.

row.title: What Do We Mean By "RAS Pathway"?

row.field_short_title: Facing Cancer with Your Spouse or Partner

row.title: Survivorship
row.field_page_description: After cancer treatment, the transition to a new way of life can be hard. Find out how to plan for follow-up care and adjust to physical, emotional, and family changes.

row.title: Approaching Pediatric Cancers through a Global Lens
row.field_short_title: Approaching Pediatric Cancers through a Global Lens

row.title: CCG Contact and Staff
row.field_page_description: Contact information and staff listing for the Center for Cancer Genomics Office of the Director, Office of Cancer Genomics, and the Cancer Genome Atlas Program Office.

row.title: Aristolochic Acids
row.field_page_description: Learn about aristolochic acids, which may increase your risk of bladder cancer and cancers of the upper urinary tract (renal pelvis and ureter). Aristolochic acids are found naturally in many types of plants, some of which are used in herbal products marketed as dietary supplements.

row.title: 1,3-Butadiene
row.field_page_description: Learn about 1,3-butadiene, exposure to which can raise your risk of leukemia. 1,3-Butadiene is a gas used to produce synthetic rubber products, such as tires, resins, and plastics. Other sources of exposure include car exhaust; tobacco smoke; and polluted air and water near industrial facilities.

row.title: More than 300 million people in at least 70 countries use smokeless tobacco
row.field_short_title: More than 300 million people in at least 70 countries use smokeless tobacco

row.title: A key molecular defect in a childhood gastrointestinal tumor may have important diagnostic implications
row.field_short_title: Key molecular defect in a childhood gastrointestinal tumor found
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have identified a key molecular defect in a tumor in children known as gastrointestinal stromal tumor, or GIST, that may have important diagnostic implications.

row.title: CCG Funding Opportunities
row.field_page_description: Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG) Funding Opportunities

row.title: January Monthly Spotlight: Cervical Health and Cervical Cancer Disparities
row.field_short_title: January Monthly Spotlight: Cervical Health and Cervical Cancer Disparities

row.title: Trial Yields Positive Data on Pembrolizumab for Lung Cancer, Potential Response Biomarker
row.field_short_title: Trial Yields Positive Data on Pembrolizumab for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: Findings from an early phase clinical trial may point to a biomarker that identifies patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer most likely to respond to the immunotherapy drug pembrolizumab (Keytruda®).

row.title: Mexico’s National Cancer Control Plan: From Development to Implementation
row.field_short_title: Mexico’s National Cancer Control Plan: From Development to Implementation

row.title: Empowering Women through Education and Advocacy in Breast and Cervical Cancer Prevention and Control
row.field_short_title: Empowering Women through Education and Advocacy in Breast and Cervical Cancer Prevention and Control

row.title: Bladder Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on bladder cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Breast Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on breast cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Stomach (Gastric) Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Almost all gastric cancers are adenocarcinomas. Other types of gastric cancer are gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors, gastrointestinal stromal tumors, and lymphomas. Find evidence-based information on gastric cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Head and neck cancers include hypopharyngeal, laryngeal, lip and oral cavity, metastatic squamous neck, nasopharyngeal, oropharyngeal, paranasal sinus, and salivary gland cancers. Find evidence-based information on head and neck cancer treatment, causes and prevention, research, screening, and statistics.

row.title: Myeloproliferative Neoplasms—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Myeloproliferative neoplasms and myelodysplastic syndromes are diseases of the blood cells. They include chronic myeloproliferative neoplasms, myelodysplastic syndromes, and myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasms. Find evidence-based information on myeloproliferative neoplasms treatment.

row.title: Prostate Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on prostate cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Small Intestine Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Adenocarcinoma is the most common type of small intestine cancer. Other types of small intestine cancer are sarcomas, carcinoid tumors, gastrointestinal stromal tumors, and lymphomas. Find evidence-based information on small intestine cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Thyroid Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: There are four types of thyroid cancer. These are papillary, follicular, medullary, and anaplastic thyroid cancer. Papillary is the most common type of thyroid cancer. Find evidence-based information on thyroid cancer treatment, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Pituitary Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Pituitary tumors represent from 10% to 25% of all intracranial neoplasms. Pituitary tumors can be classified into three groups: benign adenoma, invasive adenoma, and carcinoma. Find evidence-based information on pituitary tumors treatment.

row.title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on soft tissue sarcoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Uterine Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Most uterine cancers start in the endometrium, which is called endometrial cancer. Uterine sarcoma is a form of uterine cancer of the muscle and tissue that support the uterus. Find evidence-based information on uterine cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Vulvar Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Vulvar cancer forms in a woman's external genitalia, and most often affects the outer vaginal lips. Having vulvar intraepithelial neoplasia or HPV infection can affect the risk of vulvar cancer. Find evidence-based information on vulvar cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Resources for Patients
row.field_page_description: Authoritative information about your type of cancer, as well as information on a wide range of cancer topics and the latest cancer research.

row.title: Information for the Cancer Research Community
row.field_short_title: Resources for the Cancer Research Community
row.field_page_description: Find research and development tools, datasets, information about research training programs, and basics about applying for and managing grants.

row.title: NCI Events
row.field_page_description: Find upcoming scientific conferences where NCI will be exhibiting, NCI-hosted lectures, scientific meetings, board meetings, and live social media Twitter chat events involving NCI and our partners.

row.title: Metastatic Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles about metastatic cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Adult Treatment
Chromosomal Instability Score May Predict Response to Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Novel Cancer Biomarker May Predict Prognosis, Treatment Response

row.title: New Therapies Are Changing the Outlook for Advanced Melanoma

row.field_page_description: A summary of interim results from a phase III trial testing ribociclib plus letrozole (Femara®) as a first-line treatment for postmenopausal women with hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: No Safe Level of Smoking: Even low-intensity smokers are at increased risk of earlier death
row.field_page_description: People who consistently smoked an average of less than one cigarette per day over their lifetimes had a 64 percent higher risk of earlier death than people who never smoked.

row.title: FDA Approves New Use for Daratumumab in Multiple Myeloma

row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on the FDA’s approval of daratumumab in patients with multiple myeloma whose disease has progressed after only a single prior treatment course.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites for December 2016
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for December 2016
row.field_page_description: An update on new content of interest to the cancer community recently added to NCI’s websites.

row.title: FDA Approves Rucaparib for BRCA-Positive Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Rucaparib for BRCA-Positive Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about the FDA approval of rucaparib for women with BRCA-positive ovarian cancer who have received at least two chemotherapy regimens.

row.title: The K-Ras Anchor: Another Twist to the Tale

row.field_page_description: The amino acid sequence of the C-terminus of K-Ras4B combines with its lipid modifications to strongly influence its interactions with the plasma membrane.

row.title: RAS Pathway v3.0?
row.field_page_description: Defining the most important elements of RAS signaling is an important objective of the NCI RAS Initiative. Advisor Frank McCormick invites community input on version 3 of the RAS Pathway.

row.field_page_description: The PanCanAtlas, TCGA’s final project, will analyze the whole TCGA dataset.

row.title: Ibrutinib Relieves Chronic Graft-Versus-Host Disease Symptoms
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on results from a small clinical trial showing that ibrutinib can effectively treat graft-versus-host-disease, a common and serious complication of allogeneic stem cell transplants.

row.field_page_description: A genomics study, published in Nature, identified a vulnerability specific to KRAS-mutant lung cancers that can be treated with available drugs.

row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics uses structural cancer genomics to identify genomic alterations that contribute to cancer growth, metastasis, and recurrence.

row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics uses computational cancer genomics to derive insight about cancer genes and pathways using big data.

row.field_page_description: A multinational phase III trial found that the drug abiraterone acetate prolonged the median survival of patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer by 4 months compared with patients who received a placebo.

row.title: Breast Cancers Arising Between Mammograms Have Aggressive Features

row.field_page_description: Breast cancers that are discovered in the period between regular screening mammograms—known as interval cancers—are more likely to have features associated with aggressive behavior and a poor prognosis than cancers found via screening mammograms.
