row.field_page_description: Investigators in The Cancer Genome Atlas Research Network have uncovered a connection between how tumor cells use energy from metabolic processes and the aggressiveness of the most common form of kidney cancer, clear cell renal cell carcinoma.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Genetics Editorial Board

row.field_page_description: Kidney cancer can develop in adults and children. The main types of kidney cancer are renal cell cancer, transitional cell cancer, and Wilms tumor. Certain inherited conditions increase the risk of kidney cancer. Start here to find information on kidney cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Cervical Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Cervical cancer is the fourth most common cancer in women worldwide. The primary risk factor for cervical cancer is human papillomavirus (HPV) infection. Start here to find evidence-based information on cervical cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Harms of Cigarette Smoking and Health Benefits of Quitting

row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that lists some of the cancer-causing chemicals in tobacco smoke and describes the health problems caused by cigarette smoking and the benefits of quitting.

row.title: HIV Infection and Cancer Risk

row.title: Missed Radiation Therapy Sessions Increase Risk of Cancer Recurrence

row.field_page_description: Patients who miss radiation therapy sessions during cancer treatment have an increased risk of their disease returning, even if they eventually complete their course of radiation treatment, according to a new study.

row.title: Fueling Basic Discovery: NCI’s Cooperative Human Tissue Network

row.field_page_description: Quality biospecimens are a foundational resource for cancer research. One of NCI’s longest running biospecimen programs is the Cooperative Human Tissue Network, a resource mainly for basic discovery and early translational research.

row.title: Delirium and Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Diagnosing and Treating Delirium in Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Delirium is a confused mental state. Symptoms may include changes in thinking and sleeping. In cancer patients, it may be caused by medicine, dehydration, or happen at the end of life. Delirium may be mistaken for depression or dementia.

row.title: Sunitinib and Sorafenib Ineffective as Adjuvant Therapies for Kidney Cancer

row.field_page_description: Results from a recent clinical trial show that post-surgical therapy with two anti-angiogenesis drugs does not improve progression-free survival for patients with kidney cancer and may cause serious side effects.

row.title: Care for Childhood Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: Survivorship care for children who have been treated for cancer is important. Get your child's treatment summary, survivorship plan, and recommendations on follow-up care clinics. Learn about long-term and late effects.

row.field_page_description: In this clinical trial, patients with renal cell cancer who have undergone partial or complete nephrectomy will be randomly assigned to take everolimus tablets or matching placebo tablets daily for 54 weeks.

row.field_short_title: Addressing a silent killer – WHO Western Pacific Region Sub-Regional Workshop on Betel (Areca) Nut a

row.title: NCI: Taking Risks to Advance Science
row.field_short_title: NCI: Taking Risks to Advance Science
row.field_page_description: Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses his experience thus far as NCI director and areas, like big data, where NCI can help advance cancer research.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites for December 2017
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for December 2017
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post that provides an update on new content of interest to the cancer community recently added to NCI’s websites.

row.title: 2017 Social Media Events
row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2017.

row.title: Nilotinib Can Be Discontinued in Some Patients with Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Nilotinib Can Be Stopped in Some Patients with CML
row.field_page_description: FDA now says nilotinib (Tasignia) can be safely stopped in some patients with CML whose cancer has been in remission for an extended period.

row.title: Recommended Reads in Cancer Genomics
row.field_page_description: CCG leadership recommends some leisure reading and academic resources in cancer genomics.

row.title: Gastrointestinal Carcinoid Tumors Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on gastrointestinal carcinoid tumors, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: New Cancer Treatment Approach Targets Circadian Clock
row.field_short_title: Targeting the Circadian Clock to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Two compounds that target components of the circadian clock killed several types of cancer cells in the lab and slowed the growth of brain cancer in mice without harming healthy cells, as this Cancer Currents post reports.

row.title: NCI’s Role in Immunotherapy Research
row.field_page_description: Advances in cancer immunotherapy are the result of several decades of basic research, much of it supported by NCI, on how the immune system responds to cancer. Learn how NCI continues to support a wide range of research, from basic research to clinical trials, to advance the field of cancer immunotherapy.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Pituitary Tumors
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Pituitary Tumors

row.title: Can Oxygen “Microbubbles” Make Radiation Therapy More Effective?
row.field_short_title: Using Oxygen “Microbubbles” to Improve Radiation Therapy
row.field_page_description: Oxygen-carrying “microbubbles” could potentially improve the effectiveness of radiation therapy in the treatment of breast cancer, findings from a study in mice suggest. Using the bubbles along with radiation slowed tumor growth more than radiation alone, as this NCI Cancer Currents post reports.

row.title: Drug Combination Reduces Number of Colorectal Polyps in Patients with Hereditary Cancer Syndrome
row.field_short_title: Drug Combo Decreases Colorectal Polyps in People with FAP
row.field_page_description: In people with familial adenomatous polyposis, or FAP, a combination treatment of erlotinib (Tarceva) and sulindac (Aflodac) decreased the number of precancerous colorectal polyps, according to recently published clinical trial results.

row.title: Abemaciclib Approval Expands Initial Treatment Options for Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Abemaciclib Gets New Approval for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: DA has approved the CDK4/6 inhibitor abemaciclib (Verzenio) as a first-line treatment in some women with advanced or metastatic breast cancer. Under the approval, it must be used in combination with an aromatase inhibitor, as this Cancer Currents blog post explains.

row.title: NCI Launches New Resource for Specimens and Data from Cancer Clinical Trials
row.field_short_title: NCTN Navigator Opens to Cancer Researchers
row.field_page_description: NCI has launched Navigator, a new resource for blood and tissue specimens and clinical data from phase 3 cancer clinical trials. As this Cancer Currents post explains, the resource can help researchers answer important questions about patient care.

row.title: With FDA Approval for Advanced Lymphoma, Second CAR T-Cell Therapy Moves to the Clinic
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Second CAR T-Cell Therapy
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved the CAR T-cell therapy axicabtagene ciloleucel (Yescarta™) for patients with advanced non-Hodgkin lymphoma, as this Cancer Currents article explains.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Stomach (Gastric) Cancer
Drugs Approved for Vulvar Cancer

row.field_short_title: Cervical Cancer: paradigms at home and abroad
row.field_page_description: NCI funded a clinical trial that will have an impact on the treatment of late-stage cervical cancer, and also supported a screening trial in India using a network of community outreach workers offering low tech-screening by direct visualization of the cer

row.title: Comprehensive list of gene variants developed for cancer cells from nine tissue types
row.field_short_title: List of gene variants developed for cancer cells from nine tissue types
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have developed a comprehensive list of genetic variants for each of the types of cells that comprise what is known as the NCI-60 cell line collection. This new list adds depth to the most frequently studied human tumor cell lines in cancer

row.title: Stories of Discovery
row.field_page_description: Read these stories describing landmark developments in cancer prevention and treatment supported by NCI funding.

row.title: Radium-223 Improves Survival in Patients with Advanced Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a phase III trial that compared radium-223 dichloride plus the best standard of care versus a placebo plus the best standard of care in men with metastatic, castration-resistant prostate cancer.

row.title: NIH scientists visualize how cancer chromosome abnormalities form in living cells
row.field_short_title: Visualizing how cancer chromosome abnormalities form in living cells
row.field_page_description: For the first time, scientists have directly observed events that lead to the formation of a chromosome abnormality that is often found in cancer cells. The abnormality, called a translocation, occurs when part of a chromosome breaks off and becomes attac

row.title: Preventing Stomach Cancer: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria
row.field_short_title: The Link to H. pylori Bacteria

row.title: About the Office of Advocacy Relations
row.field_page_description: OAR works with cancer research advocates and organizations to ensure the advocacy community's perspectives and ideas are integrated into NCI activities to advance research.

row.title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_short_title: Blocking DNA Repair in Advanced BRCA-Mutated Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with relapsed or refractory advanced cancer and confirmed BRCA mutations who have not previously been treated with a PARP inhibitor will be given BMN 673 by mouth once a day in 28-day cycles.

row.title: Glutamine, Cystine, and Cancer Susceptibilities
row.field_page_description: Cancer cells generate increased amounts of toxic ROS. Recent papers show how understanding how cancers deal with ROS can lead to therapeutic opportunities.

row.title: HIV and Cancer Interaction Highlights Need to Address Disease Stigma
row.field_short_title: HIV and Cancer Interaction Highlights Need to Address Disease Stigma

row.title: Study Tracks the Evolution of Treatment Resistance in Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Tracking Treatment Resistance in Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: In women with metastatic breast cancer that is resistant to available treatments, a new study suggests that their tumors may have common vulnerabilities.

row.title: Alternate Driver of Treatment-Resistant Prostate Cancer Identified
row.field_short_title: New Subtype of Treatment-Resistant Prostate Cancer Identified
row.field_page_description: An emerging subtype of treatment-resistant metastatic prostate cancer can grow without help from androgen hormones, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Many Ovarian Cancers May Start in Fallopian Tubes, Study Finds
row.field_short_title: Many Ovarian Cancers May Start in Fallopian Tubes
row.field_page_description: The most common form of ovarian cancer may originate in the fallopian tubes, a study finding that has implications for prevention and detection of the disease.

row.title: NCI-supported research at ASCO highlights advances in cervical cancer screening and treatment
row.field_page_description: Three NCI-supported trials were highlighted at the ASCO Annual Meeting in Chicago on June 2, 2013.

row.title: NIH scientists find promising biomarker for predicting HPV-related oropharynx cancer
row.field_short_title: Scientists find promising predictor of HPV-related oropharynx cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have found that antibodies against the human papillomavirus (HPV) may help identify individuals who are at greatly increased risk of HPV-related cancer of the oropharynx, which is a portion of the throat that contains the tonsils.

row.title: NIH study finds low-intensity therapy for Burkitt lymphoma is highly effective
row.field_short_title: Study finds low-intensity therapy for Burkitt lymphoma highly effective
row.field_page_description: Adult patients with a type of cancer known as Burkitt lymphoma had excellent long-term survival rates—upwards of 90 percent—following treatment with low-intensity chemotherapy regimens, according to a new clinical trial finding. Burkitt lymphoma is the mo

row.title: Using the Immune System in the Fight Against Cancer: Discovery of Rituximab

row.field_short_title: Off-Label Drug Use in Cancer Treatment

row.title: Research Advocacy at NCI
row.field_page_description: Research advocates bring the patient perspective to NCI's work, informing research focus and supporting timely, relevant, and effective advances in cancer research.

row.title: Chemicals in Meat Cooked at High Temperatures and Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Chemicals in Meat Cooked at High Temperatures and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains how certain chemicals form in meat cooked using high-temperature methods. Includes results of research on consumption of these chemicals and cancer risk.

row.title: News & Events
row.field_page_description: The latest cancer news from the U.S. government's principal agency for cancer research, plus resources designed for science writers and reporters.

row.title: Exploring the Anticancer Potential of Valproic Acid in Advanced Thyroid Cancer
row.field_short_title: Exploring the Anticancer Potential of Valproic Acid in Advanced Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with advanced thyroid cancers of follicular cell origin whose tumors are not sensitive to radioactive iodine therapy will take valproic acid for 10 weeks.

row.title: Colonoscopy Reduces Risk of Death from Colorectal Cancer in High-Risk Patients
row.field_short_title: Colonoscopy Reduces Risk of Death from Colorectal Cancer in High-Risk Patients
row.field_page_description: Long-term results from the National Polyp Study confirm that removing precancerous adenomas not only reduces the risk of colorectal cancer but also reduces the number of deaths from the disease by more than half.

row.title: History of the NCI Cancer Centers Program
row.field_short_title: History of the NCI Cancer Centers Program

row.title: NIH study finds that coffee drinkers have lower risk of death
row.field_short_title: NIH study finds that coffee drinkers have lower risk of death
row.field_page_description: Older adults who drank coffee -- caffeinated or decaffeinated -- had a lower risk of death overall than others who did not drink coffee, according a study by researchers from the National Cancer Institute (NCI), part of the National Institutes of Health,

row.title: More Chemotherapy May Help after Initial Treatment for Childhood Leukemia Fails
row.field_short_title: More Chemotherapy May Help after Initial Treatment for Childhood Leukemia Fails
row.field_page_description: A study suggests that at least some children diagnosed with acute lymphoblastic leukemia who respond poorly to initial chemotherapy may do better if they receive additional chemotherapy rather than a stem cell transplant.

row.title: About CCCT
row.field_page_description: An overview of how the Coordinating Center for Clinical Trials supports NCI's clinical trials and translational research enterprises. Includes CCCT contact information.

row.title: An Organotypic Model Recapitulating Colon Cancer Microenvironment and Metastasis
row.field_short_title: An Organotypic Model Recapitulating Colon Cancer Microenvironment and Metastasis
row.field_page_description: In this study, researchers will engineer three models to examine the microenvironment in both the primary site and metastatic sites of colon cancer.

row.title: NCI Center for Global Health’s Scientific Alliance with Kazakhstan on Women’s Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: NCI Center for Global Health’s Scientific Alliance with Kazakhstan on Women’s Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: NCI Center for Global Health’s Scientific Alliance with Kazakhstan on Women’s Cancer Research

row.title: Low Income Is a Barrier to Clinical Trial Enrollment, Study Suggests
row.field_short_title: Low Income Is a Barrier to Clinical Trial Enrollment, Study Suggests

row.title: Current Congress
row.field_page_description: Find legislation introduced in the 116th Congress that is relevant to the NCI.

row.title: Recent Public Laws
row.field_page_description: Read about legislation related to the mission of NCI that has been signed into law in recent years.

row.title: OGCR Staff
row.field_page_description: Find OGCR staff contact information for questions on current or past legislative activities that relate to the mission of NCI.

row.field_short_title: NCI Scientists Identify New Gene Mutation that Predisposes Families to Melanoma

row.title: Modeling Different Breast Cancer Screening Strategies
row.field_short_title: Modeling Different Breast Cancer Screening Strategies
row.field_page_description: A modeling study for breast cancer screening found that regular mammography screening for women ages 50 to 74 reduces the risk of dying due to breast cancer, with a smaller benefit for women 40 to 49.

row.title: Three New Therapies Approved for Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Three New Therapies Approved for Multiple Myeloma

row.title: Mutation-Specific Approaches to KRAS Cancers: What We Can Learn from G12C-Directed Inhibitors
row.field_page_description: Dr. Sharon Campbell discusses recent advances in targeting specific mutant forms of KRAS proteins in cancers.

row.title: CGH Supports World Cancer Day Every Day
row.field_short_title: CGH Supports World Cancer Day Every Day

row.title: Faint Light at the End of the Tunnel
row.field_short_title: Faint Light at the End of the Tunnel
row.field_page_description: Gideon Bollag describes progress and some of the challenges in inhibiting RAF, the primary effector of RAS in the MAPK pathway.

row.title: FDA Approves Eribulin Mesylate for Advanced Liposarcoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Eribulin Mesylate for Advanced Liposarcoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved eribulin mesylate for patients with liposarcoma whose cancers are advanced or cannot be removed by surgery and are no longer responding to anthracycline-based chemotherapy.

row.title: Learning to Relax
row.field_page_description: Relaxation and imagery exercises to help reduce pain and stress from cancer and its treatment.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Blue Ribbon Panel
row.field_page_description: The Blue Ribbon Panel Report outlines 10 recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer. The panel was established to ensure that the Cancer Moonshot's approaches are grounded in the best science.

row.title: Planning a Genomic Characterization Study? Tips for Collecting and Processing Biospecimens
row.field_page_description: Guidance and tips for the biospecimen processing aspect of your genomic characterization study

row.title: Treatment of Head and Neck Cancer in Children and Adolescents—Health Professional Version
row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Cancer Treatment in Children and Adolescents
row.field_page_description: Find information about prognosis, staging, and treatment for the following head and neck cancer sites in children: esthesioneuroblastoma, larynx and papillomatosis, nasopharynx, oral cavity, and salivary gland.

row.title: Study Finds Biological Differences in Lung Tumors of African Americans and Whites
row.field_short_title: In Black and White Patients, Biological Differences in Lung Tumors
row.field_page_description: In patients with lung cancer, a new study shows different patterns of gene expression in the tumors of African American and white patients may contribute to racial disparities.

row.title: Szent-Györgyi Prize to honor NCI’s Douglas R. Lowy and John T. Schiller
row.field_page_description: A press release announcing that NCI scientists Douglas R. Lowy and John T. Schiller will receive the 2018 Szent-Györgyi Prize for Progress in Cancer Research from the National Foundation for Cancer Research for their work on HPV vaccines.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Kidney (Renal Cell) Cancer
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Kidney (Renal Cell) Cancer

row.title: Retooling NCI MERIT Awards to Support Budding Cancer Researchers
row.field_short_title: Retooled Award Supports Budding Cancer Researchers
row.field_page_description: In this Cancer Currents post, NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses how NCI is retooling a grant mechanism, called the MERIT R37 Award, to help early-stage investigators by extending the length of time they can receive funding under their first independent NIH grant.

row.title: Recognizing HPV Awareness Day
FDA Approves Apalutamide for Some Men with Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Apalutamide for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: Apalutamide (Erleada) is a hormone therapy that counteracts resistance to androgen deprivation therapy. Learn more about the FDA approval of apalutamide for men with castration-resistant nonmetastatic prostate cancer in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Targeted Therapy Larotrectinib Shows Promise in Early Trials, Regardless of Cancer Type
row.field_short_title: Larotrectinib Shows Promise, Regardless of Cancer Type
row.field_page_description: Larotrectinib shrank tumors in patients with 13 different cancer types, clinical trials show. The drug, which targets tumors with TRK fusions, was effective in children and adults. Update reflects FDA approval.

row.title: Scientists in the Community Staff and Contact Information
A Milestone in Cancer Research and Treatment in India
row.field_short_title: A Milestone in Cancer Research and Treatment in India

row.title: BRCA Testing Rates High in Young Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: BRCA Testing Increasing in Young Breast Cancer Patients
row.field_page_description: Testing for genetic mutations strongly associated with an increased breast cancer risk has risen dramatically among women younger than age 40 who are diagnosed with the disease, according to a new study.

row.title: Center for Research Strategy (CRS)
row.field_page_description: CRS develops recommendations on scientific opportunity, funding gaps and mechanisms, while monitoring the direction and application of knowledge and resources.

row.title: HPV Infections Targeted by Vaccine Decrease in U.S.
row.field_short_title: HPV Infections Drop in the U.S.
row.field_page_description: Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) types targeted by the quadrivalent HPV vaccine has declined by nearly two-thirds among teenage girls since HPV vaccination was recommended in the United States.

row.title: New Strategy for Treating Advanced Ovarian Cancer Shows Promise in Mice
row.field_short_title: New Strategy for Treating Advanced Ovarian Cancer Shows Promise in Mice
row.field_page_description: The use of a protein fragment to stimulate cells in the tumor microenvironment against cancer shows promise in animal models of metastatic ovarian cancer.

row.title: Nutritional Requirements of Pancreatic Cancers - A Conversation with Dafna Bar-Sagi
row.field_page_description: In a new RAS Dialogue blog post, Dr. Dafna Bar-Sagi discusses the new interest in her 1986 discovery of the unexpected dietary preference of pancreatic cancer cells.

row.title: Understanding Cancer
row.field_page_description: This page is a gateway to basic information about how cancer develops, trends in cancer cases and deaths, and how cancer affects different populations.

row.title: A Shared Commitment for Accelerating Progress with the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_short_title: A Shared Commitment to the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_page_description: At the AACR annual meeting, Vice President Biden spoke about the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative and the critical role the entire research community will play in accelerating progress against cancer.

row.title: Healthy Kids; Healthy World - Take Your Child to Work Day 2016
row.field_short_title: Healthy Kids; Healthy World - Take Your Child to Work Day 2016

row.title: Crosstalk between Cancer Cells and Neighboring Cells May Contribute to Tumor Growth
row.field_short_title: Molecular Crosstalk Promotes Pancreatic Tumor Growth
row.field_page_description: Pancreatic cancer cells and neighboring normal cells engage in a two-way molecular conversation that helps drive malignant behavior in the cancer cells, according to new study results.

row.title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: PET-CT–Guided Surveillance May Reduce Need for Surgery in Some Patients with Advanced Head and Neck
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck who underwent PET-CT–guided surveillance had fewer operations but similar overall survival rates to those of patients who underwent planned neck dissection.

row.title: Biomedical Research Legislation
row.field_page_description: Legislation from the current Congress dealing with biomedical research related to NCI.

row.title: NIH-IEEE 2015 Strategic Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies for Precision Medicine
row.field_short_title: NIH-IEEE 2015 Strategic Conference on Healthcare Innovations and Point-of-Care Technologies for Prec

row.title: Glossary of Legislative Terms
row.field_page_description: The Glossary of Legislative Terms provides brief explanations of terms and procedures used within the United States Congress.

row.title: Legislative Updates
row.field_page_description: Recent developments on legislation involving cancer research, appropriations, congressional testimony and other related topics.

row.title: FDA Approves Talimogene Laherparepvec to Treat Metastatic Melanoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves T-VEC to Treat Metastatic Melanoma

row.title: Public Health Service Act
row.field_page_description: Information on the Public Health Service Act and related legislation that directly impacted the mission of NCI.

row.title: Two Small RNAs, Often Missing from Cancer Cells, May Suppress Tumors
row.field_short_title: Two Small RNAs, Often Missing from Cancer Cells, May Suppress Tumors

row.title: What's New on NCI’s Websites?
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: DNA and Chromosome Aberrations Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI's Division of Cancer Biology's research portfolio, this research area is focused on making clear the genetic and epigenetic mechanisms of tumorigenesis and mechanisms of chemical and physical carcinogenesis.

row.title: Genome Study Links Misfolded DNA to Brain Tumors
row.field_short_title: Genome Study Links Misfolded DNA to Brain Tumors
row.field_page_description: Changes in the packaging of DNA in the cell nucleus may activate growth-promoting genes that cause cancer.

row.title: Budget and Appropriations Status
row.field_page_description: Information on the status of budget and appropriations legislation in the current Congress, including a recap of the previous year’s appropriations request.

row.title: Extended Adjuvant Therapy Beneficial for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Extended Adjuvant Therapy Beneficial for Some Women with Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on findings from a recent clinical trial which showed that extending adjuvant therapy with an aromatase inhibitor can have important benefits for some women with early-stage cancer.

row.title: Olanzapine Helps Prevent Nausea and Vomiting Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Olanzapine Helps Prevent Nausea and Vomiting Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a large clinical trial that showed an anti-psychotic drug can help prevent nausea and vomiting in patients receiving chemotherapy.

row.title: Pancreatic Organoids - A Conversation with Senthil Muthuswamy
row.field_page_description: Pancreatic organoids can be established quickly, cheaply, and reliably. They mimic patient histopathology and can be frozen and revived for large studies.

row.title: Forging Collaborations to Spur Global Progress against Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about international collaborations announced by NCI and NIH to accelerate progress in reducing the global cancer burden.

row.title: The HPV Vaccine: Increasing the Use of an Important Cancer Prevention Tool
row.field_short_title: President’s Cancer Panel Report: Increasing HPV Vaccine Use
row.field_page_description: A new report on the HPV vaccine from the President’s Cancer Panel identifies priorities and strategies for improving uptake of this cancer prevention tool.

row.title: Scientific Management Training
row.field_page_description: The Scientific Management Training (SMT) course provides management skills to NCI Principal Investigators and NCI Fellows focusing on personnel and project management to assist in succesfully leading scientific research laboratories.

row.title: Statistical Tutorial
row.field_page_description: The Statistical Tutorial (ST) course is designed as a follow up to the Statistical Analysis of Research Data (SARD). This tutorial will apply real-time general principles of statistical analysis of research data.

row.title: What are rare soft tissue tumors?
What are rare endocrine tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare tumors can develop in the endocrine glands and other cells that produce horomones,like thyroid, adrenal, and pituitary glands, and cells in your pancreas. There are a few specific tumors that affect children, teens, and young adults.

row.title: Brain Tumors Through the Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Lens: Researcher Interview with Mario Suvà
row.field_short_title: Mario Suvà on Single-cell RNA Sequencing
row.field_page_description: A neuropathologist talks about single-cell RNA sequencing technology and the brain cancer research it enables.

row.title: Managing Cancer Pain: Are Better Approaches on the Horizon?
row.field_short_title: Developing Better Approaches for Managing Cancer Pain
row.field_page_description: Pain is common in cancer patients and long-term survivors, so researchers are studying potential new pain medications and nondrug approaches for cancer pain.

row.title: African American Men More Likely to Die from Low-Grade Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Disparities in Death from Low-Grade Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: African American men with low-grade prostate cancer are more likely to die from the disease than men of other races, a new study shows.

row.title: Pembrolizumab Now Second Immunotherapy Approved to Treat Merkel Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab to Treat Merkel Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved pembrolizumab (Keytruda) to treat people with locally advanced or metastatic Merkel cell carcinoma, a rare and deadly form of skin cancer.

row.title: FNLCR Acquisitions Reference Library
Dabrafenib–Trametinib Combination Approved for Melanoma, Anaplastic Thyroid Cancer
row.field_short_title: Dabrafenib Plus Trametinib Approved for Melanoma, Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA recently approved the combination of dabrafenib (Taflinar) and trametinib (Mekinist) to treat some patients with melanoma and anaplastic thyroid cancer whose tumors have a mutation in the BRAF gene. As this Cancer Currents blog post explains, this is the first treatment approved specifically for anaplastic thyroid

row.title: Experimental Cancer Drug Metarrestin Targets Metastatic Tumors
row.field_short_title: Experimental Drug Metarrestin Targets Metastatic Tumors
row.field_page_description: An experimental drug called metarrestin appears to selectively target tumors that have spread to other parts of the body. As this Cancer Currents blog post reports, the drug shrank metastatic tumors and extended survival in in mouse models of pancreatic cancer.

row.title: New Treatment Approach Could Help Prevent Recurrences of Some Bladder Cancers
row.field_short_title: Treatment May Help Prevent Bladder Cancer Recurrences
row.field_page_description: Flushing the bladder with the chemotherapy drug gemcitabine after tumors have been removed surgically may reduce the risk of the cancer returning, according to the results of a large clinical trial. As this Cancer Currents blog post explains, the treatment approach is for patients with low-grade bladder cancer.

row.title: NCI-MATCH precision medicine clinical trial releases new findings, strengthens path forward for targeted cancer therapies
row.field_page_description: The NCI-MATCH precision medicine clinical trial has reached a milestone with the release of results from several study treatment arms. Findings from three arms were released at the 2018 ASCO annual meeting, adding to findings from one arm released in 2017.

row.title: The Cancer Genome Atlas Program
Successful Outreach for Collaboration on Cancer Research in Eurasia
row.field_short_title: Successful Outreach for Collaboration on Cancer Research in Eurasia
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute Center for Global Health and N. N. Alexandrov National Cancer Centre of Belarus convened the first Eurasian Cancer Screening Conference on May 17-18th, 2018. Read CGH's Spotlight Blog to learn more about the conference objectives and outcomes.

row.title: From Ignoring Features to Machine Learning Features: Computational Biology Then and Now
row.field_page_description: How various aspects of the computational biology field has changed over the years

row.title: Develop New Cancer Technologies
row.field_page_description: The development of cancer technologies to characterize tumors and test therapies can transform cancer research and clinical care.

row.title: Expand Use of Proven Cancer Prevention and Early Detection Strategies
row.field_short_title: Expand Use of Prevention and Early Detection Strategies
row.field_page_description: This initiative aims to develop, test, and adopt proven cancer prevention and early detection approaches to reduce cancer risk and cancer health disparities in all populations.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ - Funding by Research Category
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel (BRP) provided research recommendations to accelerate progress against cancer. See the NCI obligations for Cancer Moonshot activities by research category.

row.title: CGH Recognizes World Cancer Day 2018
Dense Breasts: Answers to Commonly Asked Questions
row.field_short_title: Dense Breasts: Answers to Commonly Asked Questions
row.field_page_description: Mammograms detect breast density, breast cancer, and breast changes that are not cancer (benign breast changes). Breast density describes the amount of glandular and fibrous tissue, as compared to fatty tissue. Learn what factors are associated with breast density and about other risk factors for breast cancer.

row.title: The Imperative of Addressing Cancer Drug Costs and Value
row.field_short_title: Addressing Cancer Drug Costs and Value
row.field_page_description: The President’s Cancer Panel has released its latest report, Promoting Value, Affordability, and Innovation in Cancer Drug Treatment. The report recommends six actions to maximize the value and affordability of cancer drug treatment.

row.title: Higher Risk of Heart Failure Seen in Some Cancers
row.field_short_title: Higher Risk of Heart Failure Seen in Some Cancers
row.field_page_description: Some people treated for breast cancer or lymphoma have a higher risk of developing congestive heart failure than people who haven’t had cancer, a new study shows. As this Cancer Currents blog post reports, the risk persisted for at least 20 years.

row.title: External Beam Radiation Therapy for Cancer
row.field_page_description: External beam radiation therapy is used to treat many types of cancer. it is a local treatment, where a machine aims radiation at your cancer. Learn more about different types of external beam radiation therapy, and what to expect if you're receiving treatment.

row.title: Mentoring for Trainees and Fellows
row.field_page_description: Mentorship is an important part of the trainee experience at NCI and NIH. Learn how to choose and find mentors and how to get involved in mentoring others.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab and Ipilimumab Combination for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Combination Approved for Advanced Kidney Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved the combination of the immunotherapy drugs nivolumab (Opdivo) and ipilimumab (Yervoy) as an initial treatment for some patients with advanced kidney cancer. The approval is expected to immediately affect patient care, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Easing Concerns about Giving Research Study Participants Their Genetic Test Results
row.field_short_title: Easing Concerns About Returning Genetic Test Results
row.field_page_description: Women with breast cancer participating in a research study were given the opportunity to learn their genetic research results. This Cancer Currents blog details the impact these results had on women who opted to review their results with a genetic counselor.

row.title: Build a National Cancer Data Ecosystem
row.field_short_title: Build a National Cancer Data Ecosystem
row.field_page_description: Researchers, clinicians, and patients across the country will need to share their collective data and knowledge to enable the development of new technologies and reduce the burden of cancer. This Cancer Moonshot initiative empowers and encourages such collaboration.

row.title: Liquid Biopsy May Predict Risk of Breast Cancer Returning Years Later
row.field_short_title: Liquid Biopsy May Help Predict Breast Cancer Relapse
row.field_page_description: The presence of circulating tumor cells found with a liquid biopsy may identify women treated for breast cancer who may be at higher risk of their disease returning years later. The findings may have implications for treatment, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Ribociclib Approval Expanded for Some Women with Advanced Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Ribociclib Approval Expanded for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has expanded the approval of ribociclib (Kisqali) for advanced breast cancer, including new uses in pre- and postmenopausal women. As this Cancer Currents post explains, it’s the first approval under a new FDA program to speed cancer drug reviews.

row.title: Finding Pediatric Cancer Genomic Data through PGDI
row.field_page_description: The Pediatric Genomic Data Inventory (PGDI) connects researchers with valuable pediatric cancer data.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma

row.title: Using Tandem Transplants to Treat Neuroblastoma
row.field_short_title: Using Tandem Transplants to Treat Neuroblastoma-Julie Park, M.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn how an NCI-supported trial led by Julie Park established a new standard of care for children with high-risk neuroblastoma.

row.title: Reflections on My First Year as NCI Director
row.field_short_title: Reflections on My First Year as NCI Director
row.field_page_description: October 2018 marked Dr. Norman Sharpless’s one-year anniversary as NCI director. He reflects on noteworthy events from the past 12 months.

row.title: Eight Factors May Link Disparities in Cancer Death Rates and Income
row.field_short_title: Factors May Link Disparities in Cancer Death Rates, Income
row.field_page_description: Eight factors may explain more than 80% of the relationship between poverty and disparities in cancer death rates, according to a new study.

row.title: Study Improves the Quality of Biopsy Specimens for Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Improving the Quality of Cancer Research Biopsy Specimens
row.field_page_description: NCI researchers have developed and tested recommendations for improving the quality of biopsy specimens collected from patients in cancer clinical trials.

row.title: National CryoEM Facility Acknowledged User Publications
row.field_short_title: Acknowledged Publications from National CryoEM Facility’s Users
row.field_page_description: The National CryoEM Facility provides cancer researchers access to the latest technology for high resolution imaging. View a list of acknowledged publications from National CryoEM Facility’s users.

row.title: Carryover Unobligated Funds
row.field_page_description: Carryover is the process by which unobligated funds remaining at the end of a budget period may be carried forward to cover allowable costs in the next budget period. Learn more about how to carryover NCI grants.

row.title: NAVIGATE: NCI and VA Interagency Group to Accelerate Trials Enrollment
row.field_page_description: The NAVIGATE program will make it easier for veterans to access promising new cancer treatments via clinical trials. This partnership between NCI and the VHA will increase the number of VA Medical Centers participating in and conducting NCI-supported cancer clinical trials.

row.title: Do Frequent Follow-Up Tests Benefit Colorectal Cancer Survivors?
row.field_short_title: Do Frequent Follow-Up Tests Help Colorectal Cancer Survivors?
row.field_page_description: Two studies of colorectal cancer survivors examined whether more frequent follow-up testing for recurrence improved how long people lived. Read this Cancer Currents blog post to learn whether testing frequency affects survival.

row.title: Outcomes & Impact of The Cancer Genome Atlas
row.field_page_description: TCGA has changed our understanding of cancer, how research is conducted, how the disease is treated in the clinic, and more. Learn about the impact of the TCGA program.

row.title: The Opioid Epidemic and Cancer Pain Management: A Conversation with Dr. Judith Paice
row.field_short_title: The Opioid Epidemic and Cancer Pain Management
row.field_page_description: The opioid epidemic is having a significant impact on cancer patients, says Dr. Judith Paice of Northwestern University. In this Cancer Currents post, she explains how oncologists can address concerns about opioid misuse when managing cancer pain.

row.title: Citing TCGA in Publications and Presentations
Intensify Research on the Major Drivers of Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Fusion oncoproteins can lead to the development of childhood cancers. This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to improve our understanding of these proteins and develop inhibitors that target them.

row.title: Analyze Patient Data and Biospecimens from Past Clinical Trials to Predict Future Patient Outcomes
row.field_short_title: Mine Past Patient Data to Predict Future Patient Outcomes
row.field_page_description: Tumor samples and other biospecimens can be analyzed retrospectively to develop hypotheses about which tumor features can help predict clinical benefit. Ideally, this information can be used to improve treatment and outcomes for cancer patients.

row.title: Message from the Center for Global Health's Interim Director
row.field_short_title: Message from the Center for Global Health's Interim Director
row.field_page_description: Center for Global Health Interim Director, Dr. Robert Croyle, discusses CGH accomplishments and plans for the new leadership.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cervical Cancer
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cervical Cancer

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cholangiocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cholangiocarcinoma

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Childhood Embryonal Tumors
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Childhood Embryonal Tumors

row.title: TEST - What's New in Pancreatic Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: TEST - What's New in Pancreatic Cancer Research

row.title: Don't Miss the Connection: The Role of RAF1 and ROKα in RAS-Driven Cancers
row.field_short_title: Cancer Caused by Mutant KRAS Requires RAF1 and ROKα
row.field_page_description: Cancer caused by a mutant KRAS gene is dependent on the presence RAF1. Kinase-independent interaction of RAF1 with ROKα accounts for this dependence.

row.title: OncoArray Links Dozens of DNA Variants to Risk for Common Cancers
row.field_short_title: Linking DNA Variants and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Researchers with the NCI-supported GAME-ON initiative and OncoArray Network are publishing studies identifying dozens of new genetic variants associated with the risk for developing some of the most common cancers, as this Cancer Currents blog post reports.

row.title: Access to Experimental Cancer Drugs
row.field_page_description: An experimental drug has been tested in the lab and with animals and approved for testing in people by the FDA, but can’t yet be advertised, sold, or prescribed. Experimental drugs may be available through clinical trials or expanded access programs - learn more about these programs and how to talk to your doctor.

row.title: April Spotlight: National Minority Health Month
row.field_short_title: April Spotlight: National Minority Health Month

row.title: A Conversation About RAS Dimers
row.field_page_description: RAS proteins seem to be dimeric in living cells, but monomeric in vitro. Understanding RAS dimers may be important for finding treatments for RAS cancers.

row.title: Cancer Control in American Indian and Alaska Native Populations: A Conversation with Dr. Shobha Srinivasan
row.field_short_title: Cancer Control in American Indian and Alaska Native Populations
row.field_page_description: American Indian and Alaska Native (AI/AN) populations are disproportionately affected by certain cancers. In this interview, Dr. Shobha Srinivasan discusses some of these disparities and programs funded by NCI that are helping to address them.

row.title: Moving Beyond BMI: Low Muscle Mass May Affect Cancer Survival
row.field_short_title: Low Muscle Mass Linked with Worse Cancer Survival
row.field_page_description: In a new study, researchers compared the risk of death for women with breast cancer who had low skeletal muscle mass, or sarcopenia, at diagnosis and women who had adequate muscle mass. Learn what they found and what it might mean for patients in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Immunotherapy Drugs Expand Treatment Options for Advanced Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Expands Lung Cancer Treatment Options
row.field_page_description: Results from a large clinical trial show combining the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab (Keytruda) with chemotherapy helped some patients with advanced cancer live longer. As this Cancer Currents post explains, the results will immediately affect patient care.

row.title: Study finds elevated risk of certain rare blood cancers after chemotherapy for most solid tumors
row.field_short_title: Study finds higher risk of rare blood cancer after chemo
row.field_page_description: An NIH study finds patients treated with chemotherapy for most solid tumors had an increased risk of tMDS/AML, a rare but often fatal type of leukemia.

row.title: SDH-deficient Gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST)
Rare Tumor Workshops
row.field_page_description: MyPART holds workshops in the Center for Cancer Research to help scientists learn what to study about rare cancer and share research, advocates discuss issues important to patients, clinicians share their experience treating the rare cancer, and FDA representatives help design experiments and clinical trials

row.title: Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network
row.field_short_title: Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network

row.title: About MyPART
By-Laws for the NIH Fellows Editorial Board
Manuscript Preparation Guidelines
For Early-Stage Lung Cancer, Study Identifies Potential New Biomarker, Treatment Target
row.field_short_title: New Biomarker, Treatment Target for Early-Stage Lung Cancer?
row.field_page_description: A potential biomarker and treatment target for early-stage non-small cell lung cancer may have been found, results from a new study suggest.

row.title: Redox Biology
row.field_page_description: The Redox Biology course provides NIH postdoctoral and clinical fellows with an overview of how redox-active species and radicals are generated, their effects on the cellular and physiological level, and how they alter carcinogenesis, angiogenesis and proliferation in animal models of cancer.

row.title: What are rare digestive system tumors?
References and Resources
row.field_page_description: There are many different systems for acquiring grants or contracts from the National Cancer Institute, and regulations that manage their execution.

row.title: Beat AML 1.0: A Collaborative Program for Functional Genomic Data Integration
row.field_page_description: The Beat AML program publishes an extensive genomic, drug response, and clinical dataset on acute myeloid leukemia. A lead author describes the collaborative effort and future steps.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Mesothelioma
TCGA's Study of Uveal Melanoma
Understanding Laboratory Tests
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the role of screening and diagnostic laboratory tests. Lists the common tests used in cancer medicine and discusses how to interpret test results.

row.title: Malignant Mesothelioma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Malignant mesothelioma is a cancer of the thin tissue (mesothelium) that lines the lung, chest wall, and abdomen. The major risk factor for mesothelioma is asbestos exposure. Start here to find information on malignant mesothelioma treatment.

row.title: Statins and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about results from animal research and ongoing observational studies of people taking statins that suggest that these drugs may lower the risk of certain cancers.

row.title: Hyperthermia in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that defines hyperthermia (treating tumors with heat) and its side effects.

row.title: Uterine Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Uterine cancers can be of two types: endometrial cancer (common) and uterine sarcoma (rare). Endometrial cancer can often be cured. Uterine sarcoma is often more aggressive and harder to treat. Start here to find information on uterine cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Myeloproliferative Neoplasms—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Myeloproliferative neoplasms and myelodysplastic syndromes are diseases in which the bone marrow makes too many red blood cells, white blood cells, or platelets. Sometimes both conditions are present. Start here to find information on myeloproliferative neoplasms treatment.

row.title: Pancreatic Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Pancreatic cancer can form in exocrine cells and neuroendocrine cells. The exocrine type is more common and is usually found at an advanced stage. Pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors are less common but have a better prognosis. Start here to find information on pancreatic cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Antiperspirants/Deodorants and Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet describing studies on whether there is a link between underarm antiperspirants or deodorants and breast cancer.

row.title: Oral Contraceptives and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about research on the association of oral contraceptive use (birth control pills) with risk of various cancers.

row.title: Liver and Bile Duct Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Liver cancer includes hepatocellular carcinoma and bile duct cancer (cholangiocarcinoma). Risk factors for HCC include chronic infection with hepatitis B or C and cirrhosis of the liver. Start here to find information on liver and bile duct cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Clear Cell Renal Cell Carcinoma

row.title: TCGA's Study of Colorectal Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Colorectal Carcinoma

row.title: TCGA's Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Glioblastoma Multiforme

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma

row.title: Cetuximab with radiation found to be inferior to standard treatment in HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer
row.field_short_title: Cetuximab inferior to standard treatment for HPV+ oropharyngeal cancer
row.field_page_description: Results from a randomized clinical trial show patients with HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer treated with radiation and cetuximab had inferior survival compared to the current standard treatment with radiation and cisplatin. The trial’s goal was to find a less toxic treatment approach without compromising survival.

row.title: The International Rare Cancer Initiative
row.field_page_description: The International Rare cancer Initiative focuses on rare cancers because they are a pressing public health priority. Read more to learn about how CGH pushes for practice-changing clinical trials in rare cancers.

row.title: Create a Pediatric Immunotherapy Discovery and Development Network (PI-DDN)
row.field_page_description: This Cancer Moonshot initiative aims to establish a pediatric cancer immunotherapy network to discover and characterize new targets for immunotherapies and ultimately develop new, effective immunotherapy treatments for children and adolescents with cancer.

row.title: Appendix Cancers Are Genetically Distinct from Other Gastrointestinal Cancers, Study Shows
row.field_short_title: Appendix Cancers Genetically Distinct from Other GI Cancers
row.field_page_description: Appendix cancers are distinct from colorectal and other gastrointestinal cancers, the largest-ever genomic study of its kind has shown. As this Cancer Currents post explains, specific mutations may help identify aggressive appendix tumors.

row.title: Moxetumomab Approved by FDA for Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Moxetumomab Approved for Hairy Cell Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved moxetumomab pasudotox (Lumoxiti), a bacterial toxin–based drug, for the treatment of hairy cell leukemia (HCL). The approval covers the use of moxetumomab in patients with HCL who have already undergone standard treatments.

row.title: Getting to Know the Complexities of Cancer: A 2018 TCGA Symposium Preview
row.field_page_description: A preview of some of the research to be presented at the 2018 Cell Symposium, TCGA Legacy: Multi-Omic Studies in Cancer.

row.title: Hope and Challenge: The NCI Annual Plan and Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2020
row.field_short_title: NCI FY 2020 Annual Plan and Budget Proposal Released
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Ned Sharpless announces the release of the institute’s Fiscal Year 2020 Annual Plan and Budget Proposal. The plan represents NCI’s best professional judgement on the optimum funding needed to make the most rapid progress against cancer.

row.title: 2018 World Cancer Congress
row.field_page_description: The 2018 World Cancer Congress features the latest successful interventions in cancer prevention, diagnosis, treatment and care. View a schedule of NCI activities at this year's Congress.

row.title: Three-dimensional Organoid Models to Study Breast Cancer Progression
row.field_short_title: 3D Organoid Models to Study Breast Cancer Progression

row.title: Early-Stage Cancer Trials Support Promise of Precision Medicine, Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on promising findings from several early-stage clinical trials featured at the 2016 American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting in Chicago.

row.title: Setting the Stage for the Next Decade of Tobacco Control Research
row.field_short_title: Setting the Stage for the Next Decade of Tobacco Control Research
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog by Dr. Robert Croyle on a new report that lays out recommended priorities to help shape NCI’s future tobacco control research portfolio.

row.title: International collaboration to create new cancer models to accelerate research
row.field_short_title: New cancer models to accelerate research

row.title: Uncovering a new principle in chemotherapy resistance in breast cancer
National Cancer Reporting Fellowships
row.field_page_description: A four-day seminar to help U.S.-based journalists increase their understanding of scientific research and ability to report accurately on complex scientific findings.

row.title: RAS Spokes/Funding
New on NCI’s Websites for August 2016
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for August 2016
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Pancreatic Cancer Cells May Obtain Nutrients from Neighboring Cells
row.field_short_title: Pancreatic Cancer Cells Rely on Neighbors for Nutrients
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study which showed that pancreatic cancer cells instruct healthy cells around them to provide nutrients they need to survive and grow.

row.title: The ALTTO Breast Cancer Trial
row.field_page_description: A collection of material about the Adjuvant Lapatinib And/Or Trastuzumab Treatment Optimisation, or ALTTO, study that will compare the targeted agents lapatinib and trastuzumab alone, in sequence, or in combination as adjuvant therapy for HER2-positive br

row.title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Positive Results
row.field_short_title: Second HPV Vaccine Shows Early Results
row.field_page_description: The vaccine Cervarix® was 90 percent effective against two types of human papillomavirus (HPV) that can cause cervical cancer, according to the June 30, 2007, Lancet.

row.title: Subscribe to Cancer.gov RSS Feeds
Blood-Forming Stem Cell Transplants
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that explains the step-by-step procedures of two types of transplantations used with high-dose chemotherapy, including their risks and benefits.

row.title: Targeted Cancer Therapies
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes targeted cancer therapies, which are drugs that interfere with specific molecules involved in cancer cell growth and survival.

row.title: Acrylamide and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about acrylamide and cancer risk.

row.title: Retinoblastoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Retinoblastoma is a very rare childhood cancer that forms in the tissues of the retina. Most cases of retinoblastoma are not inherited, but some are, and children with a family history of the disease should have their eyes checked beginning at an early age. Start here to find information on retinoblastoma treatment.

row.title: Mammograms
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that defines screening and diagnostic mammograms; discusses the benefits and potential harms of screening mammography; and summarizes how findings, including breast density, are reported.

row.title: Key Initiatives
row.field_page_description: Learn about major research initiatives NCI has developed to address specific issues of high priority for the cancer research community.

row.title: U.S. population data show no increase in brain cancer rates during period of expanding cell phone use
row.field_short_title: No increase in brain cancer rates during period of expanding cell phone use
row.field_page_description: In a new examination of United States cancer incidence data, investigators at the National Cancer Institute (NCI) reported that incidence trends have remained roughly constant for glioma, the main type of brain cancer hypothesized to be related to cell ph

row.title: The Prostate, Lung, Colorectal, and Ovarian (PLCO) Cancer Screening Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: The PLCO Cancer Screening Trial: Q and A
row.field_page_description: The Prostate, Lung, Colorectal and Ovarian (PLCO) Cancer Screening Trial is a large, randomized study to determine whether the use of certain screening tests will reduce the risk of dying of those four cancers. In addition to answering questions about the

row.title: Combining Angiogenesis-Targeted Treatments for Liver Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Angiogenesis-Targeted Treatments for Liver Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma who are ineligible for a liver transplant or other local therapies will be given oral sorafenib at the standard approved dose and intravenous TRC105.

row.title: Sigmoidoscopy Proves to Be Effective Screening Tool for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Sigmoidoscopy Proves to Be Effective Screening Tool for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a large randomized trial involving healthy men and women aged 55 to 74, sigmoidoscopy substantially reduced the incidence of and mortality from colorectal cancer.

row.title: Study Shows Drug Is Effective for Cancer Patients with Peripheral Neuropathy
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Drug Is Effective for Cancer Patients with Peripheral Neuropathy
row.field_page_description: Results of a phase III trial (CALGB-170601) show that duloxetine (Cymbalta) effectively treats painful peripheral neuropathy caused by certain types of chemotherapy.

row.title: Cancer survivorship conference highlights research for survivor care: Biennial conference aims to improve quality and length of life for cancer survivors
row.field_short_title: Survivorship conference highlights research for survivor care
row.field_page_description: More than 400 leading experts in cancer survivorship convened today for a conference, Cancer Survivorship Research: Translating Science to Care, to focus on such current concerns as how obesity might not have the same effects on all cancer survivors, and

row.title: Tumor Markers
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that defines tumor markers and describes how they can be used to aid diagnosis and treatment.

row.title: Expanding Cancer Clinical Trial Access for Patients with HIV
row.field_short_title: Expanding Clinical Trial Access for Patients with HIV
row.field_page_description: The immunotherapy drug pembrolizumab (Keytruda) is being tested in people with cancer who are HIV positive, as this Cancer Currents blog post explains.

row.title: Fat Cells May Hinder Effectiveness of Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Fat Cells May Hinder Effectiveness of Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: Study shows fat cells can absorb and break down two chemotherapy drugs commonly used to treat leukemia, potentially reducing their effectiveness.

row.title: Prior Cancers Common in Patients Newly Diagnosed with Cancer
row.field_short_title: Prior Cancers Common in Patients Newly Diagnosed with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Many patients diagnosed with a new cancer have had one or more cancers in the past, which has potential implications for clinical trial enrollment.

row.title: What We Do
row.field_page_description: NCI fellows and trainees volunteer for science outreach and teaching activities in the greater Washington, D.C. area. Learn more about our seminars, teaching opportunities, and other ways we assist in the classroom.

row.title: CGH at APEC: HPV Workshop
row.field_page_description: CGH at APEC 2017: HPV Workshop

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Luis G. Carvajal-Carmona, PhD
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Luis G. Carvajal-Carmona, PhD
row.field_page_description: CRCHD R21 grantee, Dr. Luis G. Carvajal-Carmona, is an Associate Professor specializing in cancer genetics, epidemiology, and cancer disparities.

row.title: TARGET Study Finds Major Differences between Childhood and Adult AML
row.field_short_title: Study Finds Differences between Childhood and Adult Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Researchers with TARGET, an NCI-funded program, completed a comprehensive genomic analysis of pediatric acute myeloid leukemia. Learn what they found in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: 2018 Press Releases
row.field_page_description: Press releases from NCI for the year 2018.

row.title: Oncolytic Virus Therapy: Using Tumor-Targeting Viruses to Treat Cancer
row.field_short_title: Using Oncolytic Viruses to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments known as oncolytic viruses are being tested in clinical trials, and one, T-VEC or Imlygic®, has been approved by the FDA. Research now suggests that these treatments work not only by infecting and killing tumor cells, but that they may also be a form of cancer immunotherapy.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Adult Brain Tumors
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Adult Brain Tumors

row.title: New on NCI Websites, March 2018
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post that provides an update on new content of interest to the cancer community recently added to NCI’s websites.

row.title: Testing an Interactive Approach to Promote Exercise in Young Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Promoting Exercise in Young Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: In children and adolescent cancer survivors, an online game helped them get regular exercise, as this NCI Cancer Currents post explains. A NCI-funded trial is testing the approach for acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) survivors.

row.title: Many Men with Penile Cancer Do Not Get Recommended Treatments, Study Finds
row.field_short_title: Are Men with Penile Cancer Getting Recommended Treatments?
row.field_page_description: Professional guidelines recommend that men with penile cancer that has not spread beyond nearby lymph nodes undergo lymph node dissection and receive chemotherapy. As this Cancer Currents blog post reports, that’s not happening for many men.

row.title: The Finding Cancer Trials Collaborative
Advancing Patient Care Through Focused Innovation
row.field_short_title: Advancing Patient Care Through Focused Innovation
row.field_page_description: In this Cancer Currents post, NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless describes the key areas of opportunity he has identified that, with enhanced attention from NCI, he believes can accelerate progress in cancer research and care.

row.title: PACHE Spotlight: Yamilé Molina, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Dr. Yamilé Molina, an Assistant Professor at the University of Illinois-Chicago, discusses her work comparing intervention approaches’ effects on cancer disparities. Dr. Molina also describes what CRCHD diversity training programs, including PACHE, have meant to her career.

row.title: Take with Food: Study Tests Lowering Dose of Prostate Cancer Drug
row.field_short_title: Study Tests Way to Lower Dose of Prostate Cancer Drug
row.field_page_description: In a small clinical trial, researchers compared the efficacy of a low dose of the cancer drug abiraterone (Zytiga) taken with a low-fat breakfast with a full dose taken on an empty stomach, as directed on the drug’s label. Learn what they found in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Career Planning for Trainees and Fellows
row.field_page_description: Cancer research fellows and trainees at NCI can gain technical experience and professional skills while planning for academic, government, or industry careers. Learn more about career development at NCI.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation: overall cancer mortality continues to decline, prostate cancer mortality has stabilized
row.field_short_title: Annual Report to the Nation: Overall cancer mortality declines
row.field_page_description: The 2018 Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer finds overall cancer death rates continue to decline and cancer incidence dropped in men and remained stable in women. A companion study reports on recent changes in prostate cancer trends.

row.title: Building Partnerships to Promote Global Health Equity: Takeaways from the 6th Annual Symposium on Global Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Building Partnerships to Promote Global Health Equity: Takeaways from the 6th Annual Symposium
row.field_page_description: CGH celebrated yet another successful and inspiring Annual Symposium on Global Cancer Research (ASGCR) held in conjunction with the 9th Annual CUGH (Consortium of University on Global Health) Conference on March 15, 2018 in New York, NY. Read more about ASGCR and new global collaborations in cancer research.

row.title: Maximizing the Prospects for Progress Against Cancer
row.field_short_title: Maximizing the Prospects for Progress Against Cancer
row.field_page_description: The 2018 American Society of Clinical Oncology annual meeting featured numerous, potentially practice changing research findings, according to NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless. In this Cancer Currents post, Dr. Sharpless discusses the rapid pace of progress in cancer research.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Lobular Carcinoma

row.title: The Cancer Genome Atlas Computational Tools
NCI and VA collaborate to boost veterans’ access to cancer clinical trials
row.field_short_title: NCI and VA collaborate to boost veterans’ access to cancer clinical trials
row.field_page_description: NCI and VA are launching the NAVIGATE program at 12 VA facilities across the country to enhance the ability of veterans to participate in NCI-sponsored clinical trials.

row.title: Combination Screens for Cancer Vulnerabilities: A Conversation with Kris Wood
row.field_short_title: Combination Screens for Cancer Vulnerabilities: A Conversation with Kris Wood
row.field_page_description: Combining genetic screens with drugs that work downstream of mutant KRAS reveals cellular adaptations to uncontrolled growth that may be targeted.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Acute Myeloid Leukemia

row.title: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Chromophobe Renal Cell Carcinoma

row.title: High-Fat Diet or Diabetes Drug May Enhance Response to Targeted Cancer Drug
