row.title: Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumors—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Extragonadal germ cell tumors are rare and account for only a small percentage of all germ cell tumors. However, the true incidence of these tumors may be higher than originally thought because of failure to diagnose them properly. Find evidence-based information on extragonadal germ cell tumors treatment.

row.title: Leukemia Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on leukemia, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Lung Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Lung cancer appears in two main types. Non-small cell (squamous cell carcinoma, large cell carcinoma, and adenocarcinoma), and small cell lung cancer (oat cell cancer and combined small cell carcinoma). Find evidence-based information on lung cancer treatment, causes and prevention, research, screening, and statistics.

row.title: Study Suggests Smaller Melanoma Excision Margins May Be Option for Some Patients
row.field_short_title: Study Suggests Smaller Melanoma Excision Margins May Be Option for Some Patients
row.field_page_description: A randomized controlled trial of patients with stage IIA–C cutaneous melanoma thicker than 2-mm found that a 2-cm surgical resection margin is sufficient and is as safe for patients as a 4-cm margin.

row.title: Targeted Therapy Shows Benefit in Rare Type of Thyroid Cancer
row.field_short_title: Targeted Therapy Shows Benefit in Rare Type of Thyroid Cancer
row.field_page_description: Treatment with the multitargeted agent vandetanib (Caprelsa) improved progression-free survival in patients with medullary thyroid cancer (MTC), according to findings from a randomized clinical trial.

row.title: Treatment Choices for Men With Early-Stage Prostate Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Choices for Men With Early-Stage Prostate Cancer

row.title: Talking with Your Health Care Team
row.field_short_title: Talking with Your Health Care Team
row.field_page_description: talking to your doctor, ask questions, take notes, ask about costs

row.title: Self-Image and Sexuality
row.field_page_description: Cancer and its treatment can change how you look and feel about yourself. Learn to cope with body changes and issues related to sexuality and intimacy.

row.title: Physical Activity and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes evidence linking exercise and other physical activity, including work and household chores, to reduced cancer risks.

row.title: Hair Dyes and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that reviews research about the possibility of a connection between personal hair dye use and cancer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. Kolawole Okuyemi - Improving Cervical Cancer Screening Attitudes of African Immigrants and Refugees
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Dr. Kolawole Okuyemi - Improving Cervical Cancer Screening Attitudes

row.title: Bacterial Biofilms Provide Clues into Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Bacterial Biofilms Provide Clues into Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: New data suggest that dense bacterial communities called biofilms may contribute to some colon cancers.

row.title: Surgery Choices for Women with DCIS or Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Surgery Choices for Women with DCIS or Breast Cancer

row.title: Appetite Loss and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments may lower your appetite. Side effects such as nausea, fatigue, or mouth sores can also making eating difficult. Learn how to eat well to avoid losing weight or becoming dehydrated, so you stay strong during treatment.

row.title: Constipation and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatment can cause constipation. Symptoms include hard stools, stomach cramps, bloating, and nausea. Causes also include pain medicine, diet changes, dehydration, and being less active. Prevention and treatment of constipation is explained.

row.title: Nerve Problems (Peripheral Neuropathy) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Nerve problems, such as peripheral neuropathy, can be caused by cancer treatment. Learn about signs and symptoms of nerve changes. Find out how to prevent or manage nerve problems during cancer treatment.

row.title: Hair Loss (Alopecia) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Hair loss, also called alopecia, is a side effect of cancer treatments, such as chemotherapy and radiation therapy. Learn how to cope with and manage hair loss. Listen to tips from others who have experienced hair loss.

row.title: Long-Term Trial Results Show No Mortality Benefit from Annual Prostate Cancer Screening
row.field_short_title: Long-Term Trial Results Show No Mortality Benefit from Annual Prostate Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: Thirteen year follow-up data from the Prostate, Lung, Colorectal and Ovarian (PLCO) cancer screening trial show higher incidence but similar mortality among men screened annually with the prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test and digital rectal examination

row.title: Heavy exposure to diesel exhaust linked to lung cancer death in miners
row.field_short_title: Exposure to diesel exhaust linked to lung cancer in miners
row.field_page_description: In a study of non-metal miners in the United States, federal government scientists reported that heavy exposure to diesel exhaust increased risk of death from lung cancer. The research, all part of the Diesel Exhaust in Miners Study, was designed to evalu

row.title: Side Effects of Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Side effects are problems that occur when cancer treatment affects healthy tissues or organs. Learn about side effects caused by cancer treatment. Know what signs and symptoms to call your doctor about. Learn about treatments for side effects.

row.title: Research on Coping with Cancer
Resources for Caregivers
row.field_page_description: Information to help you care for the cancer patient in your life and take care of yourself, as well as general information about cancer and the latest cancer research.

row.title: Resources for Industry
Scientific Meetings and Lectures
row.field_page_description: Scientific meetings and lectures hosted at NCI.

row.title: Gallbladder Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Gallbladder cancer is a rare cancer that is usually diagnosed late due a to lack of early signs and symptoms. It is sometimes found when the gallbladder is checked for gallstones or removed. Start here to find information on gallbladder cancer treatment.

row.title: Cancers by Body Location/System
Skin Cancer (Including Melanoma)—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Skin cancer is the most common type of cancer. The main types of skin cancer are squamous cell carcinoma, basal cell carcinoma, and melanoma. Most deaths from skin cancer are caused by melanoma. Start here to find information on skin cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: PDQ® Editorial Boards
row.field_page_description: Description About the PDQ Editorial Boards

row.title: Calcium and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on calcium and cancer prevention. It includes information about dietary recommendations for calcium.

row.title: When Your Parent Has Cancer: A Guide for Teens
row.field_short_title: When Your Parent Has Cancer: A Guide for Teens
row.field_page_description: Help for teens whose mom or dad has cancer. Learn how families cope and find support when a parent has cancer. Tips to help you talk with your friends, deal with stress, and take care of your mind and body are also shared.

row.title: Policies
row.field_page_description: Learn about the policies governing the National Cancer Institute’s website, including accessibility, comments, privacy and security, reuse of graphics and text, and more.

row.title: Reuse of NCI Information
row.field_page_description: Find information about use of NCI information, registered trademarks, and copyrighted material.

row.title: Freedom of Information Act
row.field_page_description: Learn about the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) and how it provides individuals with a right to access information in the possession of the U.S. federal government.

row.title: Bevacizumab significantly improves survival for patients with recurrent and metastatic cervical cancer
row.field_short_title: Bevacizumab improves survival for patients with advanced cervical cancer
row.field_page_description: Patients with advanced, recurrent, or persistent cervical cancer that was not curable with standard treatment who received the drug bevacizumab (Avastin) lived 3.7 months longer than patients who did not receive the drug, according to an interim analysis

row.title: PDQ® Levels of Evidence
Turning Evidence into Practice
Advancing Cancer Care Delivery Research in the Next Decade
row.field_short_title: Advancing Cancer Care Delivery Research in the Next Decade
row.field_page_description: NCI’s new Healthcare Delivery Research Program (HDRP) will focus on advancing the science of cancer care delivery in ways that improve survival and enhance patient care experiences.

row.title: 2014 Press Releases
row.field_page_description: Press releases from the National Cancer Institute for the year 2014.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Julie Dang, M.P.H. - Personalizing Outreach to Address Asian Cancer Health Disparities
A higher than expected fraction of adolescent osteosarcoma patients carry a gene mutation that is often inherited
row.field_short_title: A higher than expected fraction of adolescent osteosarcoma patients carry a gene mutation
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that inherited variations in a known tumor suppressor gene among children and adolescents with osteosarcoma, a cancer of the bone, are more common than previously thought.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Nathan Ellis, Ph.D. Seeks Molecular Basis of Colorectal Cancer Disparities in African Americans
Anal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Anal cancer is a rare malignancy and accounts for a small percentage of cancers of the lower alimentary tract. The most common type of anal cancer is squamous cell carcinoma in the anal canal. Find evidence-based information on anal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, research, and statistics.

row.title: Cervical Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on cervical cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Gallbladder Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Cancer that arises in the gallbladder is uncommon. Almost all gallbladder cancers are adenocarcinomas. The most common symptoms caused by gallbladder cancer are jaundice, pain, and fever. Find evidence-based information on gallbladder cancer treatment.

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on head and neck cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Kidney (Renal Cell) Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Kidney cancer has three main types. Renal cell cancer, or renal cell adenocarcinoma, forms in the tubules of the kidney. Transitional cell carcinoma forms in the renal pelvis and ureter. Wilms tumors are common in children. Find evidence-based information on kidney cancer treatment, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Menopausal Hormone Therapy and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the results of research on menopausal hormone therapy (MHT). Includes information about the effect of MHT on the body and benefits and risks of using menopausal hormones.

row.title: PDQ® - NCI's Comprehensive Database
PDQ® Screening and Prevention Editorial Board
Website Linking Policy
row.field_page_description: Learn about linking to the website of the National Cancer Institute (NCI) and about NCI's policy for links on its site.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Soft Tissue Sarcoma
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Soft Tissue Sarcoma

row.title: Ten Years of Tamoxifen Reduces Breast Cancer Recurrences, Improves Survival
row.field_short_title: Ten Years of Tamoxifen Reduces Breast Cancer Recurrences, Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: Taking adjuvant tamoxifen for 10 years after primary treatment leads to a greater reduction in breast cancer recurrences and deaths than taking the drug for only 5 years, according to the results of a large international clinical trial.

row.title: Cancer immunotherapy in children: How does it differ from approaches in adults?
row.field_page_description: More often than not, cancer immunotherapies that work in adults are used in modified ways in children. Seldom are new therapies developed just for children, primarily because of the small number of pediatric patients relative to the adult cancer patient

row.title: Research on Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on childhood cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Monica Baskin, Ph.D. - Studying Weight Loss for Cancer Prevention in African-American Women
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Monica Baskin, Ph.D. - Studying Weight Loss for Cancer Prevention

row.field_short_title: Teleconference Summary: NCI Clinical Trials Systems

row.title: Most Recent Reported Fiscal Year Budget
row.field_page_description: See NCI obligations resulting from appropriated and reimbursable funding for the recently reported fiscal year.

row.title: Lymphoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Lymphoma refers to cancers that form in the lymphatic system, including Hodgkin lymphoma, non-Hodgkin lymphoma, AIDS-related lymphoma, and primary CNS lymphoma. Find evidence-based information on lymphoma treatment, research, genomics, and statistics.

row.title: Lymphoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on lymphoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Pancreatic Cancer Research Results and Study Updates
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on pancreatic cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Brain Tumors

row.title: Pathology Reports
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet describing the information found in a pathology report, the document that contains results of the examination of tissue removed during biopsy or surgery.

row.title: Secondhand Smoke and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the studies on the health effects of exposure to environmental (secondhand) tobacco smoke.

row.title: Lymphoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Lymphoma is cancer that begins in cells of the lymph system. The two main types are Hodgkin lymphoma and non-Hodgkin lymphoma (NHL). Hodgkin lymphoma can often be cured. The prognosis of NHL depends on the specific type. Start here to find information about lymphoma treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Research Funding Opportunities
row.field_page_description: Find a wide range of funding announcements to support cancer research and training, organized by topic and by funding mechanism.

row.title: The Genetics of Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information about genetic changes, how they may be inherited or acquired during a person's life, how they can increase cancer risk, and genetic testing for mutations.

row.title: Carcinoma of Unknown Primary—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Carcinoma of unknown primary (CUP) occurs when cancer cells have spread in the body and formed metastatic tumors but the site of the primary cancer is not known. There are a number of reasons why the primary cancer may not be found. Start here to find treatment information for carcinoma of unknown primary.

Complementary and Alternative Medicine
Refining Post-Surgical Therapy for Women with Lymph Node-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Refining Post-Surgical Therapy for Women with Lymph Node-Positive Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: In this trial, women with HER2-negative, HR-positive breast cancer and 1-3 positive lymph nodes with recurrence scores of 25 or lower will be randomized to undergo adjuvant chemotherapy before starting endocrine therapy or to begin endocrine therapy.

row.title: Comment Policy
row.field_page_description: Learn the policy about how comments are managed on National Cancer Institute websites.

row.title: NCI study finds that sunitinib benefits patients with renal cell carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Sunitinib benefits patients with renal cell carcinoma
row.field_page_description: Findings from clinical trial patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma, a common kidney cancer, show they did not have accelerated tumor growth after treatment with sunitinib, in contrast to some study results in animals.

row.field_short_title: Tumor suppressor identified as inhibitor of inflammation
row.field_page_description: Scientists at NCI have found that a protein, FBXW7, which acts as a tumor suppressor, is also important for the reduction in strength of inflammatory pathways. It has long been recognized that a complex interaction exists between cancer causing mechanisms

row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved lenvatinib (Lenvima) to treat some patients with the most common type of thyroid cancer.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on the recent annual Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections, where investigators presented important new findings on HIV-related cancers.

row.field_page_description: Find Clinical Trials Reporting Program (CTRP) user guides, resources, and contact information.

row.title: Radon and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about radon, an odorless radioactive gas, and its possible association with cancer, and how to test for radon in the home.

row.title: Bone Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Bone cancer is rare and includes several types. Some bone cancers, including osteosarcoma and Ewing sarcoma, are seen most often in children and young adults. Start here to find information on bone cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the sentinel lymph node biopsy procedure and details two clinical trials evaluating the effectiveness of this procedure.

row.title: BRCA Mutations: Cancer Risk and Genetic Testing
row.field_short_title: BRCA Mutations: Cancer Risk & Genetic Testing
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, what to do if a person tests positive for alterations in one of these genes, and consequences of genetic testing.

row.title: Extracranial Germ Cell Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Extracranial germ cell tumors are tumors that develop from germ cells (fetal cells that give rise to sperm and eggs) and can form in many parts of the body. They are most common in teenagers and can often be cured. Start here to find information on extracranial germ cell tumors treatment.

row.field_page_description: These examples show how biology contributes to health disparities (differences in disease incidence and outcomes among distinct racial and ethnic groups, ), and how biological factors interact with other relevant factors, such as diet and the environment.

row.field_page_description: Find helpful information about the GDS Policy, including when the policy applies, example projects, and providing informed consent.

row.field_short_title: Study Identifies New Opportunities for Targeted Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: A team of NCI researchers has reported that several types of gastrointestinal cancer have tumor-specific mutations that can be recognized by the immune system, thereby offering a new therapeutic opportunity for patients with these tumors.

row.title: Precision Medicine in Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Precision medicine helps doctors select cancer treatments that are most likely to help patients based on a genetic understanding of their disease. Learn about the promise of precision medicine and the role it plays in cancer treatment.

row.field_page_description: Steven A. Rosenberg and colleagues at the National Cancer Institute have treated a patient with metastatic colon cancer by using the patient's own cells to target the G12D mutation in KRAS.

row.title: NCI launches study of African-American cancer survivors
row.field_short_title: NCI launches study of African-American cancer survivors
row.field_page_description: An NCI press release about the launch of the Detroit Research on Cancer Survivors (ROCS) study, which will look at factors affecting cancer progression, recurrence, mortality, and quality of life among African-American cancer survivors.

row.title: CGH Hosts the Regional Centers of Research Excellence Program Launch Meeting for Cohort 1 Investigators
row.field_short_title: CGH Hosts the Regional Centers of Research Excellence Program Launch Meeting for Cohort 1 Investigat

row.title: About the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy
row.field_short_title: About the Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy
row.field_page_description: The Office of HIV and AIDS Malignancy (OHAM) enhances NCI’s research in the field of HIV/AIDS and facilitates coordination of this effort. Learn more about the clinical and programmatic initiatives that OHAM oversees.

row.title: A Panel of Isogenic RAS-Dependent Cell Lines Developed at the Frederick National Laboratory
row.field_short_title: A Panel of Isogenic RAS-Dependent Cell Lines Developed at the Frederick National Laboratory
row.field_page_description: Cells lacking all RAS genes but those that have been modified and introduced by viral transduction are highly useful for drug screens.

row.title: FDA Approves Niraparib as Maintenance Therapy for Recurrent Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Niraparib as Maintenance Therapy for Recurrent Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of niraparib as maintenance therapy for some women with recurrent ovarian cancer.

row.title: Multiple Myeloma Awareness and African American Disparities
row.field_short_title: Multiple Myeloma Awareness and African American Disparities

row.title: Cancer Driver Discovery Program
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Driver Discovery Program aims to sequence a large number of cancer cases in order to increase statistical power for identifying recurrent driver mutations.

row.title: FDA Approves Immunotherapy Drugs for Patients with Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Drugs Approved for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s approval of four immunotherapy drugs for patients with bladder cancer.

row.title: Screening and Early Detection - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on cancer screening and early detection research—including diagnostic biomarkers and advances or trends in screening practices—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Survivorship and Supportive Care - Cancer Currents Blog
row.field_page_description: Blog posts on survivorship and supportive care research—including the physical, psychosocial, and economic issues faced by cancer survivors and their caregivers—from NCI Cancer Currents.

row.title: Study Identifies Genetic Mutations in Tumors From 10,000 Patients with Metastatic Cancer
row.field_short_title: Mutations in 10,000 Patients with Metastatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have reported the results of an initiative to characterize the genetic mutations in tumors from more than 10,000 patients with advanced cancer treated at the center.

row.title: Pembrolizumab Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Advanced Melanoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from a randomized phase III study that showed pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) improved survival in patients with advanced melanoma compared with Ipilimumab (Yervoy®).

row.title: Download the NCI FYI Mobile App
row.field_short_title: Download the NCI FYI Mobile App
row.field_page_description: The NCI FYI mobile application offers a centralized source of available resources to fellows and trainees working at NCI in Maryland.

row.title: CURE Spotlight: Cesar Castro, M.D. Develops Smartphone Technology for Cancer Detection in Underserved Communities
Many Women with Dense Breasts May Not Need Additional Screening
row.field_short_title: Many Women with Dense Breasts May Not Need Additional Screening

row.title: NCI Budget Summary Data
row.field_page_description: Find detailed data about funds available to NCI and information about how NCI obligated its funding this fiscal year.

row.title: NCI Extramural Programs
row.field_page_description: The majority of NCI's budget funds extramural grants and contracts. Find information about extramural funding by grant activity, institution, state, and country.

row.title: NCI and NIH AIDS Funding History
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have made a number of key discoveries in HIV/AIDS research. Find information about the history of funding levels for HIV/AIDS research year over year.

row.title: Director's Corner: Professional Development Workshop Helps Early Stage Investigators Build Independent Careers in Scientific Research
row.field_short_title: Director's Corner: Professional Development Workshop Helps Early Stage Investigators

row.title: New Research: Using Lung Cancer Screening As An Opportunity to Help Smokers Quit
row.field_short_title: New Research: Using Lung Cancer Screening As An Opportunity to Help Smokers Quit

row.title: Vulvar Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on vulvar cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Too Few Patients with Cancer Communicate Preferences for End-of-Life Care
row.field_short_title: Study Shows Need for End-of-Life Care Preferences

row.title: Study Identifies Biomarker that Detects Early Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_page_description: Exosome Biomarker Detects Pancreatic Cancer

row.title: FDA Approves Rolapitant to Prevent Nausea and Vomiting from Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Preventing Nausea and Vomiting from Chemotherapy

row.title: Contact the Division of Cancer Biology
row.field_page_description: Find staff and contact information for DCB's offices and branches.

row.title: Progress against Cancer: The Role of Basic Science
row.field_short_title: Progress against Cancer: The Role of Basic Science

row.title: Identifying Novel Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_short_title: Drug Combinations to Overcome Treatment Resistance
row.field_page_description: A review of current research identifying and testing drug combination approaches that have the potential to overcome or delay resistance to cancer treatment.

row.title: CGH Director strengthens research and control partnerships in Kenya
row.field_short_title: CGH Director strengthens research and control partnerships in Kenya
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health director Edward Trimble met with Kenyan partners in December 2016 to increase engagement in cancer control strategy.

row.title: For Some Breast Cancer Survivors, Drug May Reduce Treatment-Related Joint Pain
row.field_short_title: Drug Reduces Cancer Treatment-Related Joint Pain
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post about a clinical trial demonstrating that duloxetine (Cymbalta®) may reduce joint pain caused by aromatase inhibitors in women being treated for early-stage breast cancer.

row.title: Shifts Seen in Tobacco Product Types Purchased in US
row.field_short_title: Shifts Seen in Tobacco Product Types Purchased in US
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a new study showing shifts in the types of tobacco products purchased in the United States, including increased purchases of snuff and large cigars.

row.title: Selected Publications by Dr. Doug Lowy
row.field_page_description: In these selected published articles, Douglas R. Lowy, M.D., Deputy Director of the National Cancer Institute (NCI), presents some of his work in cancer research.

row.title: Conditional Reprogramming: An Interview with Dr. Richard Schlegel on Growing Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Conditional Reprogramming to Grow Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog featuring Dr. Richard Schlegel discussing conditional reprogramming, a new cell culture technique for rapidly growing normal and tumor cells.

row.title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Bladder Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Nivolumab for Bladder Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the clinical trial that led the FDA to approve nivolumab for bladder cancer and what the approval means for patients.

row.title: Center for Cancer Genomics Research
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Cancer Genomics aims to transform the diagnosis and treatment of cancer through structural, functional, and computational genomics research, and the promotion of data sharing.

row.title: Researchers Use CRISPR Gene-Editing Tool to Help Turn Immune Cells against Tumors
row.field_short_title: CRISPR Gene-Editing Tool May Help Improve Cancer Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog about using the CRISPR gene-editing technology to genetically engineered immune cells and improve the ability of these cells to kill cancer cells in mice.

row.title: Targeted Cancer Drug May Also Help Protect Fertility, Study Suggests
row.field_short_title: Targeted Cancer Drug May Also Help Protect Fertility
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on a new study in mice suggesting that a class of targeted cancer drugs may help some women undergoing cancer treatments preserve their fertility.

row.title: Less Chemotherapy May Be Best Choice for Some Patients with Colon Cancer, Study Shows
row.field_short_title: Less Adjuvant Chemotherapy for Colon Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on a study which showed a shorter chemotherapy course following surgery may be preferred for some patients with colon cancer.

row.title: Powering Off Cancer
row.field_page_description: Many cancers are more dependent on metabolic reactions that occur in mitochondria than normal cells. New therapies that target these reactions are being tested.

row.title: Geraldina Dominguez, Ph.D.
Extensive Lymph Node Surgery Does Not Increase Survival in Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Trial Provides Guidance on Lymph Node Surgery in Melanoma
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on results from a clinical trial which show that a conservative approach to lymph node removal surgery may be best for some patients with melanoma.

row.title: Cancer Researchers Report Progress in Studying Exceptional Responders
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a recent NCI-sponsored meeting to discuss research on exceptional responders—patients with cancer who have dramatic and long-lasting treatment responses.

row.title: Glioblastoma—Unraveling the Threads: A Q&A with Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of the NIH Neuro-Oncology Branch
row.field_short_title: Unraveling the Threads: Making Progress against Glioblastoma
row.field_page_description: Progress against the brain cancer glioblastoma has been slow. In this Cancer Currents post, Drs. Mark Gilbert and Terri Armstrong of NCI’s Neuro-Oncology Branch discuss what’s being done to change that.

row.title: Two New Therapies Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Two New Therapies Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Two new treatments for adults with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) have been approved by FDA: enasidenib (Idhifa®) and cytarabine-daunorubicin CPX-351 (Vyxeos®), as this Cancer Currents post explains

row.title: Sexual Health Issues in Women with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Cancer treatments such as chemotherapy, hormone therapy, and radiation may cause sexual problems in women. Conditions may include vaginal dryness, vaginal stenosis, and vaginal atrophy. Learn how to manage and treat these sexual problems.

row.title: CRCHD Hosts Career Development and Scientific Workshop
row.field_short_title: CRCHD Hosts Career Development and Scientific Workshop
row.field_page_description: CRCHD recently hosted a Career Development and Scientific Workshop to support investigators interested in applying for NIH funding opportunities.

row.title: NCI supports 10 New Bilateral Collaborative Research Partnerships on Cancer
row.field_short_title: NCI supports 10 New Bilateral Collaborative Research Partnerships on Cancer

row.title: Cancer Prevention Steering Committee Roster
row.field_page_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Prevention Steering Committee.

row.title: CAR T-Cell Therapy Approved for Some Children and Young Adults with Leukemia
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves CAR T-Cell Therapy for Children with Leukemia
row.field_page_description: Tisagenlecleucel (Kymriah™), a form of CAR T-cell therapy, has been approved by FDA for some children and young adults with advanced acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL).

row.title: FDA Approves Olaparib as Maintenance Therapy for Recurrent Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Olaparib for Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: Olaparib tablets (Lynparza®) have been approved by FDA for some women with ovarian cancer to use as a maintenance treatment, this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Why I Do Cancer Research
National Cryo-Electron Microscopy Facility Team Members
row.field_page_description: The National Cryo-Electron Microscopy Facility team is responsible for the operational activities of NCEF. Find team member bios and a list of NCEF working group members.

row.title: Supporting Informed Decision Making
row.field_page_description: CRS conducts portfolio analyses and collects data on scientific topics, funding mechanisms, and investigator characteristics to help NCI leadership make data-driven decisions about the scientific research enterprise.

row.title: Contact the Office of Communications and Public Liaison
row.field_page_description: Find contact and staff information for NCI's Office of Communications and Public Liaison (OCPL). OCPL is staffed by experts in science writing, digital communications, and media and public affairs.

row.title: Peter Garrett
row.field_page_description: Bio for Peter Garrett, director of NCI's Office of Communications and Public Liaison (OCPL). As OCPL Director, Peter oversees digital communications and social media, science writing, clearance, stakeholder outreach, media relations, and internal communications.

row.title: Endometrial Cancer Incidence Rising in the US and Worldwide
row.field_page_description: Endometrial cancer diagnoses have increased worldwide in recent years, with the highest incidence rates in North America and Europe, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Alcohol and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the evidence linking alcohol consumption to the risk of various cancers. Includes information about factors that affect the risk of alcohol-associated cancers.

row.title: Preventing High-Risk Adenomas and Second Cancers in Colon Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Preventing High-Risk Adenomas and Second Cancers in Colon Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: In this phase III trial, people who have had curative surgery for colon cancer will be randomly assigned to take sulindac and a placebo, eflornithine and a placebo, both sulindac and eflornithine, or two placebo pills for 36 months.

row.title: New understanding of oral HPV infections in healthy men
row.field_short_title: New understanding of oral HPV infections in healthy men
row.field_page_description: Scientists report that newly acquired oral HPV infections in healthy men are uncommon and, when present, tend to go away within one year.

row.title: Relieving Mouth Sores from Cancer Treatment: The Discovery of Palifermin
row.field_short_title: Relieving Mouth Sores of Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Painful mouth and throat sores can be a side effect of intensive cancer treatments for many patients. Learn how NCI scientists developed the drug, Palifermin, which vastly improves the quality of life for cancer patients.

row.title: Hormone Therapy for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes hormone therapy and its role in treating prostate cancer. Includes information about the types of hormone therapy, how they are used, and possible side effects.

row.title: Enhancing Breast and Ovarian Cancer Care: The Discovery of BRCA1 and BRCA2
row.field_short_title: Enhancing Breast and Ovarian Cancer Care: BRCA1 and BRCA2

row.title: TCGA bladder cancer study reveals potential drug targets, similarities to several cancers
row.field_short_title: TCGA bladder cancer study reveals potential drug targets
row.field_page_description: Investigators with TCGA have identified new potential therapeutic targets for a major form of bladder cancer, including important genes and pathways that are disrupted in the disease. They also discovered that, at the molecular level, some subtypes of bla

row.title: Committees of Interest
row.field_page_description: Learn more about the specific committees which appropriate funds, authorize programs, or oversee activities of the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: National Cancer Act of 1937
row.field_page_description: National Cancer Act of 1937, signed into law by President Franklin D. Roosevelt, created the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Checking In on Cancer Checkpoint Inhibitors
row.field_short_title: Checking In on Cancer Checkpoint Inhibitors

row.title: Cancer Can Lead to Financial Hardship, Study Confirms
row.field_short_title: Study of Cancer and Financial Hardship
row.field_page_description: A substantial number of working-age cancer survivors report material or psychological financial hardship associated with their cancer.

row.title: DNA Misfolding Revealed as Novel Oncogenic Mechanism
row.field_short_title: DNA Misfolding Revealed as Novel Oncogenic Mechanism

row.title: Penile Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on penile cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons (GDC) is a unified cancer genomics knowledge base that promotes data sharing and facilitates precision medicine in oncology.

row.title: Opportunities in Cancer Nanotechnology: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Piotr Grodzinski
row.field_short_title: Opportunities in Cancer Nanotechnology: A Conversation with NCI’s Dr. Piotr Grodzinski

row.title: Pediatric Terminology
The benefits of looking across many cancer genomes: A perspective
row.field_short_title: The benefits of looking across many cancer genomes
row.field_page_description: Cancer is not a single entity, but rather, it is more than one hundred complex and distinct diseases, with most cancer types demanding a unique treatment strategy. TCGA researchers have developed a formal project for a cross tumor analysis, called Pan-Can

row.title: Genomic understanding of glioblastoma expanded
row.field_page_description: Glioblastoma multiforme (GBM) was the first cancer type to be systematically studied by TCGA in 2008. In a new, complementary report, TCGA experts examined more than 590 GBM samples--the largest to date utilizing genomic characterization techniques and ne

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975–2010, Featuring Prevalence of Comorbidity and Impact on Survival Among Persons with Lung, Colorectal, Breast or Prostate Cancer: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975–2010
row.field_page_description: The Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, covering the period 1975–2010, showed death rates for lung cancer, which accounts for more than one in four cancer deaths, dropping at a faster pace than in previous years.

row.title: When Your Brother or Sister Has Cancer: A Guide for Teens
row.field_short_title: When Your Brother or Sister Has Cancer
row.field_page_description: Help when a brother or sister has cancer. Learn how families cope and find support when a sibling has cancer. Tips to help you talk with your friends, deal with stress, and take care of your mind and body are also shared.

row.title: Common Cancer Myths and Misconceptions
Cancer Informatics: Expanding Access to Cancer Genomics Data
row.field_page_description: The NCI Genomic Data Commons and Cloud Pilots expand access to cancer genomics data by compiling and harmonzed data into a central data repository.

row.title: What an Indian Proverb Can Teach Us About Communication
row.field_short_title: What an Indian Proverb Can Teach Us About Communication

row.title: A Conversation with Allan Balmain
Managing Costs and Medical Information
row.field_page_description: People with cancer may face major financial challenges and need help dealing with the high costs of care. Cancer treatment can be very expensive, even when you have insurance. Learn ways to manage medical information, paperwork, bills, and other records.

row.title: A Harmful Trend: Increased Waterpipe Smoking
row.field_short_title: A Harmful Trend: Increased Waterpipe Smoking

row.title: Profiles in Cancer Research
Cancer Immunology, Hematology, and Etiology Research
row.field_short_title: Cancer Immunology, Hematology, and Etiology Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI’s Division of Cancer Biology’s research portfolio, studies supported include the characterization of basic mechanisms relevant to anti-tumor immune responses and hematologic malignancies.

row.title: Track 4: Cancer Prevention Product Research and Review for Postdoctoral Research Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train individuals in the medical product development and application process. Learn more about this cancer training program.

row.title: IOTF Mentors: Track 1 and Track 2
row.field_page_description: While at FDA, fellows are assigned a mentor who is a senior member of FDA scientific review staff. Learn more about mentors for Tracks 1 and 2.

row.title: GICR Partners Task Force for Cancer Registration in Vietnam
row.field_short_title: GICR Partners Task Force for Cancer Registration in Vietnam
row.field_page_description: Global taskforce aims strengthen population-based cancer registries with improved operations, access to case reports, and cancer surveillance.

row.title: Nivolumab Improves Survival for Patients with Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab for Recurrent Head and Neck Cancer Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: A summary of clinical trial results showing that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improved overall survival compared with standard chemotherapy in patients with head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

row.title: The Global Economic Burden of Tobacco: An Interview with Dr. Mark Parascandola
row.field_short_title: Economic Study of Global Tobacco Burden
row.field_page_description: In an interview on Cancer Currents, Dr. Mark Parascandola discusses findings from an economics study showing that, globally, tobacco use burdens economies with more than US $1 trillion annually in health care costs and lost productivity.

row.title: Study finds premature death rates diverge in the United States by race and ethnicity
row.field_short_title: Premature death rates diverge in the United States
row.field_page_description: An NCI press release on a study that shows premature death rates have declined in the United States among Hispanics, blacks, and Asian/Pacific Islanders but increased among whites and American Indian/Alaska Natives.

row.title: Democratizing Access to CCG Data: Cancer Genomics Cloud Pilots
row.field_page_description: The cloud pilots provide access to NCI data and computational resources in the cloud, enabling diverse researchers to advance precision oncology.

row.title: HIV and AIDS Research News & Events
row.field_page_description: OHAM monitors HIV/AIDS research and events. Keep up-to-date with news about HIV/AIDS-related cancer research and learn about relevant meetings and conferences.

row.title: Avelumab Becomes First Approved Treatment for Patients with Merkel Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: Avelumab First Approved Drug for Rare Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA’s first-ever approval of a drug for the rare skin cancer Merkel cell carcinoma and updated data on patients’ tumor responses.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ Blue Ribbon Panel Members
row.field_page_description: Information about the Cancer Moonshot Blue Ribbon Panel of experts. The panel was established to ensure the Cancer Moonshot's goals and approaches are grounded in the best science.

row.title: Researcher Interview: Jinghui Zhang
row.field_page_description: Center for Cancer Genomics Interview with Jinghui Zhang, Ph.D.

row.title: Recurrent Cancer: When Cancer Comes Back
row.field_page_description: Cancer can recur when treatment doesn’t fully remove or destroy all the cancer cells. Learn about the different types of recurrence and how recurrent cancer is restaged and treated.

row.title: Support for Families When a Child Has Cancer
row.field_short_title: Support for Families When a Child Has Cancer
row.field_page_description: When a child has been diagnosed with cancer, parents need practical advice and information. Learn how to talk with your child and their siblings about cancer. Get answers to commonly asked questions from parents and children. Tips to help you talk with your child’s doctor, during treatment, are included.

row.title: NCI-MATCH: A Status Report and Future Directions
row.field_short_title: NCI-MATCH: A Status Report and Future Directions
row.field_page_description: Leaders of the NCI-MATCH trial provide an update to the cancer community on the trial’s status and plans for it moving forward.

row.title: The CTD<sup>2</sup> Dashboard: A Platform to Explore Evidence-based Observations
row.field_page_description: Findings from CTD2 centers are displayed on the Dashboard for the community to explore.

row.title: Study Shows Experimental Screening Test Can Detect Endometrial and Ovarian Cancers
row.field_short_title: Experimental Test Detects Endometrial and Ovarian Cancers
row.field_page_description: Finding a way to detect endometrial and ovarian cancers early, when they are most likely to respond to treatment, has been a challenge for cancer researchers. An experimental liquid biopsy test called PapSEEK may help to change that, this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Courses and Fellowships for Trainees and Fellows
row.field_page_description: Cancer research fellows and trainees at NCI can take advantage of scientific and professional development courses. Current and prospective trainees will also find a listing of fellowships opportunities. Learn more about courses and fellowships.

row.title: Collaboration and Team Science: A Field Guide
row.field_page_description: Collaboration and Team Science: A Field Guide provides insight into the practices of conducting collaborative work. Since its 2010 publication, the authors have worked and learned from teams and organizations all over the world. Learn from these experiences in the second edition of the Team Science Field Guide.

row.title: Paulette Gray, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Paulette S. Gray, Ph.D. is the Director for the Division of Extramural Activities (DEA). As the director of the division, she is responsible for the overall scientific, fiscal, and administrative management of the division, including broad strategic planning, development, implementation, and evaluation.

row.title: TCGA Timeline & Milestones
Altering Chemotherapy Improves Outcomes in Early-Stage Pancreatic Cancer
row.field_short_title: Chemotherapy Change Improves Pancreatic Cancer Outcomes
row.field_page_description: For people with early-stage pancreatic cancer, results from two clinical trials suggest that altering the type and timing of chemotherapy improves survival. The findings will likely change the standard of care, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: NExT: Advancing Promising Cancer Therapies from the Lab to Clinical Trials
row.field_page_description: The NCI Experimental Therapeutics (NExT) program works with researchers and top scientific experts to advance promising or novel cancer therapies from the earliest stages of research to clinical trials. Learn about recent successes from NExT in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Can Age Affect Response to Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors?
row.field_short_title: Patient Age and Response to Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors
row.field_page_description: The age of patients with melanoma may influence how well their cancer responds to immune checkpoint inhibitors. As this Cancer Currents post explains, researchers who led the study believe the findings may point to a strategy to improve responses to these immunotherapy drugs.

row.title: NIH and Prostate Cancer Foundation launch large study on aggressive prostate cancer in African-American men
row.field_short_title: NIH, PCF launch study on prostate cancer in black men
row.field_page_description: RESPOND is the largest coordinated study on biological and non-biological factors associated with aggressive prostate cancer in African-American men. The study is an effort to learn why these men disproportionally experience aggressive disease.

row.title: Cancer Immunotherapy Drug Simultaneously Targets Two Proteins that Block Immune Response
row.field_short_title: Cancer Immunotherapy Drug Targets Two Proteins
row.field_page_description: Two groups of researchers, working independently, have fused a TGF-beta receptor to a monoclonal antibody that targets a checkpoint protein. The result, this Cancer Currents blog describes, is a single hybrid molecule called a Y-trap that blocks two pathways used by tumors to evade the immune system.

row.title: NIH completes in-depth genomic analysis of 33 cancer types
row.field_page_description: The NIH’s TCGA program concludes with the PanCancer Atlas, an in-depth genomic analysis of 33 cancer types. Findings are being published as a collection of 27 papers across multiple Cell journals.

row.title: Rucaparib Approved as Maintenance Treatment for Some Recurrent Ovarian Cancers
row.field_short_title: Rucaparib Approved as Maintenance Therapy for Ovarian Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has expanded its approval of rucaparib for women with ovarian, fallopian tube, or primary peritoneal cancer. As this Cancer Currents blog post explains, it can now be used to treat women with recurrent disease whose tumors shrank after subsequent treatment with a platinum-based chemotherapy.

row.title: Resources for Trainees
row.field_page_description: Fellows and cancer research trainees can find orientation, community involvement, and career development information. Learn more about resources for trainees.

row.title: After TCGA: Building Clinical Genomic Resources
row.field_page_description: Clinical focus on upcoming cancer characterization projects after TCGA

row.title: Tobacco Breaks Hearts: World No Tobacco Day 2018
row.field_short_title: Tobacco Breaks Hearts: World No Tobacco Day 2018
row.field_page_description: This year World No Tobacco Day highlights the impact of tobacco use on heart disease under the banner “Tobacco Breaks Hearts.” Read more about the effects of tobacco use on your health.

row.title: TAILORx trial finds most women with early breast cancer do not benefit from chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: TAILORx finds no chemotherapy benefit for most early breast cancers
row.field_page_description: Findings from the TAILORx clinical trial show chemotherapy does not benefit most women with early breast cancer. The new data, released at the 2018 ASCO annual meeting, will help inform treatment decisions for many women with early-stage breast cancer.

row.title: Toxin-Based Drug Moxetumomab Pasudotox May Be New Option for Rare Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Toxin-Based Drug May Be New Option for Rare Leukemia
row.field_page_description: In patients with hairy cell leukemia, the toxin-based treatment moxetumomab pasudotox may be an effective new treatment option. As this Cancer Currents post explains, the drug looked to be highly effective in a large clinical trial.

row.title: Donna Siegle
row.field_page_description: Donna Siegle serves as the NCI Acting Executive Officer, responsible for leading the NCI Office of Management (OM).

row.title: Cancer Research Training Award (CRTA)
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Research Training Award (CRTA) is an NCI fellowship award with an “umbrella” appointment mechanism for fellowship programs within NCI divisions, offices, and centers. Learn more about CRTA at NCI.

row.title: NCI-led research team develops predictor for immunotherapy response in melanoma
row.field_short_title: IMPRES predicts which melanomas will respond to immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: In a new study, NCI-led researchers developed a gene expression predictor that can indicate whether melanoma in a specific patient is likely to respond to treatment with immune checkpoint inhibitors, a type of immunotherapy.

row.title: Combination of Immunotherapy Drugs Approved for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Combination Approved for Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: The combination of the immune checkpoint inhibitors ipilimumab (Yervoy) and nivolumab (Opdivo) has been approved by FDA for the treatment of patients with metastatic colorectal cancer whose tumor cells have DNA repair defects.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Cutaneous Melanoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Cutaneous Melanoma

row.title: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Lower Grade Glioma

row.title: Targeted Drug Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia with IDH1 Gene Mutations
row.field_short_title: Ivosidenib Approved for Acute Myeloid Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved ivosidenib (Tibsovo) for the treatment of adults with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) that has a specific mutation in a gene called IDH1. Ivosidenib becomes the first FDA-approved treatment that targets IDH1.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma
row.field_page_description: Find information about drugs for Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma. The drugs listed have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and include both generic and brand names.

row.title: Study Provides Closer Look at Postmenopausal Bleeding and Endometrial Cancer
row.field_short_title: Closer Look at Postmenopausal Bleeding and Endometrial Cancer
row.field_page_description: A new study shows that 90% of postmenopausal women diagnosed with endometrial cancer reported vaginal bleeding before their diagnosis. Approximately 9% of women who saw a doctor for bleeding, the study showed, later received an endometrial cancer diagnosis.

row.title: Exosomes May Help Tumors Evade Immune System
row.field_short_title: Exosomes May Help Tumors Evade Immune System
row.field_page_description: Exosomes studded with the PD-L1 protein may help cancers evade the immune system, findings from a new study suggest. The presence of exosomes bearing the immune checkpoint protein could be a treatment biomarker, as this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Prevention and Early Detection of Hereditary Cancers
row.field_page_description: This Moonshot initiative aims to develop effective cancer prevention and early detection approaches for those at high risk for inherited cancer syndromes and implement appropriate clinical management.

row.title: TCGA Research Network Publications
TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Breast Ductal Carcinoma

row.title: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

row.title: Tailored Psychotherapy Eases Depression in People with Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Easing Depression in People with Advanced Cancer
row.field_page_description: In people recently diagnosed with advanced cancer, a tailored psychotherapy approach called CALM lessened symptoms of depression, results from a clinical trial show. The approach also may help prevent depression, this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: Enhancements to NCI’s SEER Program Creating New Research Opportunities
row.field_page_description: NCI’s SEER program is expanding and operating a series of pilot studies that, as Dr. Lynne Penberthy explains, are focused on the routine collection of more clinical and genomic data to help researchers better understand cancer and its impact.

row.title: Two Drugs Work Together to Block ‘Master Regulator’ of Breast, Other Cancers
row.field_short_title: Drug Combination Blocks Driver of Breast and Other Cancers
row.field_page_description: Arsenic trioxide and retinoic acid work together to target Pin1, a master regulator protein that drives breast and other cancers. The findings could spur clinical trials, as this Cancer Currents blog explains.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Lung Squamous Cell Carcinoma

row.title: Nivolumab and Ipilimumab Effective against Melanoma That Has Spread to the Brain
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Drugs Shrink Brain Metastases from Melanoma
row.field_page_description: In patients with melanoma that has spread to the brain, the combination of the immune checkpoint inhibitors nivolumab (Opdivo) and ipilimumab (Yervoy) halted the growth of or shrank metastatic brain tumors, an early phase clinical trial shows.

row.title: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon
row.field_short_title: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon
row.field_page_description: Annual Plan and Budget Proposal FY 2020 Coming Soon

row.title: The R50 Research Specialist Award: Ensuring a Stable Cancer Research Workforce
row.field_short_title: Ensuring a Stable Cancer Research Workforce
row.field_page_description: NCI’s R50 Research Specialist Award was launched in 2016 to help sustain a stable workforce of experienced scientists who can take fullest advantage of advanced technologies and the era of big data.

row.title: Resources for Researchers
row.field_page_description: Resources for Researchers is a directory of NCI-supported tools and services for cancer researchers.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation: Cancer Death Rates Continue to Decline; Increase in Liver Cancer Deaths Cause For Concern
row.field_short_title: Annual Report to the Nation: Cancer Death Rates Continue to Decline
row.field_page_description: The Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer (1975-2012) shows that death rates continued to decline for all cancers combined, as well as for most cancer sites for men and women, as well as for most cancer sites for men and women.

row.title: Novel Strategy Isolates Immune Cells in the Blood that Recognize Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Identifying Immune Cells in Blood that Recognize Tumors
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have developed a novel strategy for identifying immune cells circulating in the blood that recognize specific proteins on tumor cells, a finding they believe may have potential implications for immune-based therapies.

row.title: Blue Ribbon Panel announced to help guide Vice President Biden’s National Cancer Moonshot Initiative
row.field_short_title: Blue Ribbon Panel announced to help guide Vice President Biden’s National Cancer Moonshot Initiative
row.field_page_description: The Blue Ribbon Panel, a working group of the National Cancer Advisory Board, will recommend how best to advance the themes of the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative.

row.title: Toward Precision Therapy for Children with Cancer: An Interview with Dr. Javed Khan
row.field_short_title: Toward Precision Therapy for Children with Cancer: An Interview with Dr. Javed Khan
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Dr. Javed Khan discusses a new NCI clinical program and the promise and challenges of genome-guided therapy for children with cancer.

row.title: Strengthening relations with Latin American countries through health diplomacy
row.field_short_title: Strengthening relations with Latin American countries through health diplomacy

row.title: Venetoclax Approved for Some Patients with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved venetoclax for patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) whose tumors have a specific genetic alteration.

row.title: Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy
row.field_page_description: The NIH Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy was issued to promote broad sharing of genomic research data and ensure oversight and protections for research involving human data.

row.title: Online Tool Helps Users Distinguish Moles from Melanoma
row.field_short_title: Online Tool Helps Users Distinguish Moles from Melanoma
row.field_page_description: “Moles to Melanoma: Recognizing the ABCDE Features” presents photos that show changes in individual pigmented lesions over time, and describes the different appearances of moles, dysplastic nevi, and melanomas.

row.title: Clinical Trial Registration, Amendments, and Updates
row.field_page_description: Policies on clinical trial registration, amendments and updates related to CTRP.

row.title: The Genomic Data Commons Launches
Intramural Investigators Submitting Data
row.field_page_description: Find general requirements for intramural investigators submitting genomic data. Different processes may exist based on operational differences in NCI intramural research programs.

row.title: A short narrative - Challenges and opportunities in expanding research in the Middle East, North Africa Region
row.field_short_title: A short narrative - Challenges and opportunities in expanding research in the Middle East, North Afr

row.title: Patient-Derived Antibody Appears to Selectively Target Tumor Cells, Spur Immune Attack
row.field_short_title: Antibody Targets Tumor Cells, Spurs Immune Attack
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on an antibody derived from patients that killed tumor cells in cell lines of several cancer types and slowed tumor growth in mouse models of brain and lung cancer without evidence of side effects.

row.title: Blood Test for Genetic Changes in Tumors Shows Promise as Alternative to Tumor Biopsy
row.field_short_title: Blood Test Shows Promise as Alternative to Tumor Biopsy
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study which showed that a so-called liquid biopsy produced results highly similar to those of traditional tumor biopsies.

row.title: Addressing a silent killer - The International Conference on Betel Quid and Areca Nut
row.field_short_title: Addressing a silent killer - The International Conference on Betel Quid and Areca Nut

row.title: NCI launches largest-ever study of breast cancer genetics in black women
row.field_short_title: NCI launches largest-ever study of breast cancer genetics in black women
row.field_page_description: The Breast Cancer Genetic Study in African-Ancestry Populations initiative is a collaborative research project that will identify genetic factors that may underlie breast cancer disparities.

row.title: Seeking Cancer Clues in Blood, Researchers Explore Exosomes
row.field_short_title: Seeking Cancer Clues in Blood, Researchers Explore Exosomes
row.field_page_description: A feature-length Research Update article about exploring ways to use vesicles known as exosomes to develop new clinical tests and tools for patients with cancer.

row.title: New on NCI's Websites for July 2016
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for July 2016
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Scientific Steering Committees
row.field_page_description: A functional overview of NCI's Scientific Steering Committees (SSCs). SSCs are tasked with evaluating and prioritizing clinical trials based on scientific merit in a transparent process.

row.title: Mutations Linked to Immunotherapy Resistance
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study that identified acquired mutations in relapsed melanoma tumors that led to resistance to the checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.

row.title: Tumor DNA in Blood May Signal Response to T-Cell Transfer Immunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Tumor DNA in Blood May Signal Immunotherapy Response
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about using tumor DNA in blood as a marker of response for a form of immunotherapy.

row.title: Counseling Improves Survivorship Plan Implementation for Low-Income Breast Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Counseling Improves Survivorship Care Plan Implementation
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a randomized trial that showed that low-income women who received counseling and a survivorship care plan got improved follow-up care

row.title: Exceptional Responders Initiative: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Exceptional Responders Initiative: Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: NCI has embarked on the Exceptional Responders Initiative to understand the molecular underpinnings of exceptional responses to treatment, primarily via chemotherapy, in cancer patients.

row.title: CAR T Cells: Expanding into Multiple Myeloma
row.field_short_title: CAR T Cells Expanding into Multiple Myeloma
row.field_page_description: CAR T-cell therapy is showing promise in multiple myeloma, according to recently presented data from two early-phase clinical trials.

row.title: CURE Honors
row.field_page_description: In celebration of 21 years of the CURE program, CRCHD honors outstanding CURE scholars, mentors, and champions.

row.title: FDA Expands Approval of Ceritinib for ALK-Positive Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Ceritinib Approval for Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on the FDA approval of ceritinib for patients with untreated ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer and a clinical trial of alectinib as a first-line lung cancer treatment.

row.title: RAS and MYC: Co-conspirators in Cancer
row.field_short_title: RAS and MYC: Co-conspirators in Cancer
row.field_page_description: Inhibiting post-translational modifications of MYC to decrease its transcriptional activity is a new strategy for treating RAS-driven cancers.

row.title: Two-Drug Combination Approved for Lung Cancers with BRAF Mutations
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Drugs for Lung Cancers with BRAF Mutations
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on FDA’s approval of dabrafenib (Tafinlar®) plus trametinib (Mekinist®) for the treatment of metastatic non-small cell lung cancer with the BRAF V600E mutation.

row.title: Types of Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: This page lists the different cancer treatments, including chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, and targeted therapy and takes you to more information about each type.

row.title: Dual-Biomarker Blood Test Shows Promise for Pancreatic Cancer Early Detection
row.field_short_title: Test Shows Promise for Pancreatic Cancer Early Detection
row.field_page_description: A new blood test may accurately detect pancreatic cancer at its earliest stages, when it is most likely to respond to treatment, findings from a new study suggest.

row.title: Annual Reporting and Auditing
row.field_page_description: Reporting helps ensure desired results are achieved throughout the grants lifecycle. Learn more about reporting and auditing requirements for cancer research grants.

row.title: Bringing the Investigational Breast Cancer Drug Endoxifen from Bench to Bedside with NCI Support
row.field_short_title: Bringing Endoxifen from Bench to Bedside
row.field_page_description: Endoxifen, a breast cancer drug being tested in clinical trials, had critical support from NCI, the Mayo Clinic’s Dr. Matthew Goetz writes in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: CAR T Cells: Engineering Patients’ Immune Cells to Treat Their Cancers
row.field_short_title: CAR T Cells: Engineering Immune Cells to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Research on CAR T-cell therapy—a rapidly emerging form of cancer treatment, primarily for blood cancers like leukemia and lymphoma—is moving at a swift pace.

row.title: NIH-funded study shows increased survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer who receive chemotherapy when starting hormone therapy
row.field_short_title: Increased survival in men with metastatic prostate cancer receiving chemo and hormone therapy
row.field_page_description: Men with hormone-sensitive metastatic prostate cancer who received the chemotherapy drug docetaxel given at the start of standard hormone therapy lived longer than patients who received hormone therapy alone, according to early results from a NIH-supporte

row.title: Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR)
row.field_short_title: Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR)
row.field_page_description: The Office of Government and Congressional Relations (OGCR) advises the NCI Director, staff, and advisory boards on legislative and Congressional activities as they relate to the NCI mission.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Patients with Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab to Treat Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

row.title: Microbes within Our Bodies May Cause or Contribute to Cancer
row.field_short_title: Microbes within Our Bodies May Cause or Contribute to Cancer

row.title: Christal Sohl, Ph.D.
The NCI Predoctoral to Postdoctoral Fellow Transition Award (F99/K00)
row.field_short_title: The NCI Predoctoral to Postdoctoral Fellow Transition Award (F99/K00)
row.field_page_description: Apply for the NCI F99/K00 Award that helps late-stage doctoral candidates finish their training and then transition into cancer-focused research positions.

row.title: Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC)
row.field_page_description: As the leading economic forum in the Asia-Pacific region, APEC facilitates economic growth and prosperity in the Asia-Pacific region through trade and investment liberalization, business facilitation, and economic and technical cooperation.

row.title: Structural Biology and Molecular Applications Research
row.field_short_title: Structural Biology and Molecular Applications Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI's Division of Cancer Biology's research portfolio, research and development in this area focuses on enabling technologies, models, and methodologies to support basic and applied cancer research.

row.title: Tumor Biology and Microenvironment Research
row.field_page_description: Part of NCI's Division of Cancer Biology's research portfolio, research in this area seeks to understand the role of tumor cells and the tumor microenvironment (TME) in driving cancer initiation, progression, maintenance and recurrence.

row.title: FDA Approves Alectinib for ALK-Positive Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
Shining a Spotlight on Tumor Exosomes
row.field_short_title: Shining a Spotlight on Tumor Exosomes-David Lyden M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Learn how NCI support is helping researcher David Lyden understand how cancer cell exosomes create a nurturing environment for the growth of metastatic tumors.

row.title: Working to Reduce the Cancer Burden Caused by Tobacco
row.field_short_title: Working to Reduce the Cancer Burden Caused by Tobacco-Michael Fiore, M.D., M.P.H., M.B.A.
row.field_page_description: Tobacco use in the US continues to cause great harm. Learn about Dr. Michael Fiore and his NCI working group’s recommendations on Tobacco Control Research Priorities for the Next Decade.

row.title: Studying “Total Diet” and Its Impact on Health, Including Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Studying the Impact of Total Diet on Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: Dr. Jill Reedy explains a shift in diet and cancer risk studies, with researchers using a holistic approach that analyzes dietary patterns across the lifespan.

row.title: Engineered ECM Platforms to Analyze Progression in High Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: Engineered ECM Platforms Analyze Progression in High Grade Serous Ovarian Cancer

row.title: Genomic Test Helps Identify Thyroid Nodules That Don’t Require Surgery
row.field_short_title: Test Identifies Thyroid Nodules That Don’t Require Surgery
row.field_page_description: A new test measures genomic changes in thyroid biopsy samples and generates a score based on how strongly each change is associated with thyroid cancer.

row.title: Targeted Treatment for Rare Digestive Tract Cancers May Extend Survival
row.field_short_title: Targeted Treatment for Rare GI Cancers May Extend Survival
row.field_page_description: In patients with biliary tract cancer with a BRAF mutation, treatment with dabrafenib plus trametinib shrank tumors, results from a phase 2 trial show.

row.title: Adamantinoma
Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network - Backup
row.field_short_title: Pediatric and Adult Rare Tumor Network - Backup

row.title: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
MyPART Team
2019 Speakers for the Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers Course

row.title: Johns Hopkins/NCI Molecular Target and Drug Discovery Fellowship
row.field_short_title: JHU and NCI Molecular Target and Drug Discovery Fellowship
row.field_page_description: Training fellows in bioassay development, chemical libraries, molecular targets and cancer, and high-throughput screening laboratory automation.

row.title: Director’s Innovation Award Program
row.field_page_description: The NCI Director’s Intramural Innovation Award Program is designed to support development of highly innovative approaches and technology aimed at significant problems from across the CCR portfolio.

row.title: New study using cryo-electron microscopy shows how potential drugs could inhibit cancer
row.field_short_title: Cryo-electron microscopy shows how potential drugs could inhibit cancer
row.field_page_description: New study shows an imaging technique called cryo-electron microscopy that views, in atomic detail, the binding of a potential drug to a protein in cancer cells.

row.title: Stopping Multiple Myeloma in Its Tracks
row.field_short_title: Stopping Multiple Myeloma in Its Tracks-Valerie Winston
row.field_page_description: The results of standard tests indicated that Valerie Winston was at risk for multiple myeloma. Read how an NCI combination therapy clinical trial helped her avoid the full impact of multiple myeloma.

row.title: Developing the First Precision Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: Learn about the NCI-funded research that enabled the first FDA approved precision medicine- the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.

row.title: Gene Tied to Alzheimer’s May Be Associated with Cancer-Related Cognitive Problems
row.field_short_title: Alzheimer’s Gene May Play Role in Chemobrain

row.field_short_title: TEST - What's New in Lung Cancer Research

row.title: The Cancer Moonshot: Moving from Planning to Research
row.field_short_title: The Cancer Moonshot: Moving from Planning to Research
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Moonshot is supporting innovative science, as it moves from the planning phase to the research phase, explains NCI’s Dr. Dinah Singer.

Angiosarcoma
Clear cell renal carcinoma
Papillary renal cell carcinoma
The Role of Families and Caregivers of People with Rare Cancers
