row.field_short_title: Atezolizumab Approved for Lung Cancer Initial Treatment
row.field_page_description: FDA recently approved the immunotherapy drug atezolizumab (Tecentriq) for advanced nonsmall cell lung cancer (NSCLC) that lacks EGFR or ALK mutations.

row.title: Participating in a Clinical Trial for Rare Cancer
row.field_short_title: Participating in a Clinical Trial for Rare Cancer
row.field_page_description: When you are diagnosed with a rare cancer, you and your family may think about joining a clinical trial or study.You may get access to a new drug, or a chance to see world-renowned doctors. You are also helping future rare cancer patients by helping researchers today.

row.title: E-mail Us
Nearly 800,000 deaths prevented due to declines in smoking; NIH study examines the impact of tobacco control policies and programs, and the potential for further reduction in lung cancer deaths
row.field_short_title: Nearly 800,000 deaths prevented due to declines in smoking
row.field_page_description: Twentieth-century tobacco control programs and policies were responsible for preventing more than 795,000 lung cancer deaths in the United States from 1975 through 2000. If all cigarette smoking in this country had ceased following the release of the firs

row.title: Report to the nation finds continuing declines in cancer death rates since the early 1990s; Feature highlights cancers associated with excess weight and lack of sufficient physical activity
row.field_short_title: Report to the nation finds continuing declines in cancer death rates
row.field_page_description: Death rates from all cancers combined for men, women, and children continued to decline in the United States between 2004 and 2008, according to the Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975-2008. The overall rate of new cancer diagnoses,

row.title: Scientists find that chromosomal abnormalities are associated with aging and cancer
row.field_short_title: Chromosomal abnormalities are associated with aging and cancer
row.field_page_description: Two new studies have found that large structural abnormalities in chromosomes, some of which have been associated with increased risk of cancer, can be detected in a small fraction of people without a prior history of cancer. The studies found that these

row.title: Study Suggests New Treatment Option for Some Lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Study Suggests New Treatment Option for Some Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Updated findings from a large European clinical trial indicate that patients with some types of lymphoma could initially be treated with the chemotherapy drug bendamustine (Treanda) and the targeted agent rituximab (Rituxan).

row.title: Preoperative Chemotherapy, Radiation Improve Survival in Esophageal Cancer (Updated)
row.field_short_title: Preoperative Chemotherapy, Radiation Improve Survival in Esophageal Cancer (Updated)
row.field_page_description: Patients with esophageal cancer who received chemotherapy and radiation before surgery survived, on average, nearly twice as long as patients treated with surgery alone, according to results of a randomized clinical trial published May 31, 2012, in NEJM.

row.title: Development of Physiologic Tissue Models to Assess Tumor Explant Response to Immune Checkpoint Blockade
row.field_short_title: Development of Physiologic Tissue Models to Assess Tumor Explant Response to Immune Checkpoint Block
row.field_page_description: This study seeks to better predict patient-derived tumor responsiveness to immune checkpoint blockade.

row.title: FDA Approves Alectinib For Initial Treatment of ALK-Positive Lung Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Alectinib for Untreated ALK-Positive Lung Cancer
row.field_page_description: Alectinib (Alcensa) has been approved by the FDA for untreated ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), based on results from the ALEX trial.

row.title: Dr. Levi Garraway to Deliver NCI CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_short_title: Dr. Levi Garraway to Deliver NCI CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar
row.field_page_description: On July 24, 2018, Dr. Levi Garraway will deliver the next CURE Distinguished Scholars Seminar. Dr. Garraway will present on the Molecular and Genomic Characterization of Human Solid Tumors.

row.title: Selumetinib Continues to Show Promise in Children with NF1
row.field_short_title: Selumetinib Shrinks Tumors in Children with NF1
row.field_page_description: The investigational drug selumetinib shrank tumors in some children with a genetic syndrome called neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1). As this Cancer Currents post explains, the drug also improved symptoms related to tumors known as neurofibromas, which can cause pain, difficulty breathing or walking, and disfigurement.

row.title: Respondent Burden
Approval Expanded for Venetoclax in Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Approval Expanded for Venetoclax in Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
row.field_page_description: FDA expanded the approval of venetoclax (Venclexta) for people with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) to include those whose cancer has progressed after previous treatment, regardless of whether their cancer cells have the deletion 17p gene alteration.

row.title: Dr. Alan S. Rabson, Long-Time NCI Deputy Director and Cancer Research Stalwart, Dies
row.field_short_title: Long-Time NCI Deputy Director Dr. Alan Rabson Dies
row.field_page_description: Long-time NCI senior leader Alan Rabson, M.D., passed away on July 4, at the age of 92. His career spanned 6 decades, including research on tumor virology and cancer pathology and senior NCI leadership roles.

row.title: TCGA Ethics & Policies
TCGA's Study of Adrenocortical Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Adrenocortical Carcinoma

row.title: Aggressive Prostate Cancer Subtype More Common Than Expected
row.field_short_title: Aggressive Prostate Cancer Subtype More Common Than Expected
row.field_page_description: Some men with advanced prostate cancer may be more likely than previously thought to develop a more aggressive form of the disease, a new study shows. As this Cancer Currents post reports, the subtype, called t-SCNC, was linked with shorter survival.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Hepatocellular Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Hepatocellular Carcinoma

row.title: Statement from NCI Director Dr. Norman E. Sharpless on the Death of Senator John McCain
row.field_short_title: Statement from NCI Director on the Death of Senator McCain
row.field_page_description: Statement from NCI Director on the death of Senator John McCain. McCain, a long-time supporter of cancer research, passed away on August 25.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Lung Adenocarcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Lung Adenocarcinoma

row.title: Conversation with Scott Kopetz: RAS in Colorectal Cancer, Initiation and Resistance
row.field_short_title: Conversation with Scott Kopetz: RAS in Colorectal Cancer, Initiation and Resistance
row.field_page_description: Mutated RAS genes are an important cause of colorectal cancers, and play a role in resistance to current drug therapies.

row.title: Vaping Pods Produce High Nicotine Levels in Young Users
row.field_short_title: Vaping Pods Produce High Nicotine Levels in Young Users
row.field_page_description: Pod-style e-cigarettes produce higher levels of nicotine in the body than conventional cigarettes. Learn why this finding in young users is so concerning.

row.title: For HPV-Positive Women, Test Can Guide Cervical Cancer Screening Follow-Up
row.field_short_title: For HPV-Positive Women, Test Can Guide Screening Follow-Up
row.field_page_description: For women who test HPV-positive during cervical cancer screening, the dual stain test is better than the Pap test at identifying those at increased risk of developing precancers over the next 5 years and can better guide follow-up care.

row.title: Thinking Chemically to Discover New Targeted Cancer Drugs
row.field_short_title: Thinking Chemically to Discover New Targeted Cancer Drugs-Kevan Shokat, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: About a third of all cancers are driven by mutations in RAS genes. Learn how NCI funding is helping Dr. Kevan Shokat develop drugs that inactivate molecular drivers of cancer such as RAS.

row.title: Pursuing a Cancer Prevention Vaccine
row.field_short_title: Pursuing a Cancer Prevention Vaccine-Olivera Finn, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Read the story of NCI-funded scientist Olivera Finn whose research led to the first clinical trial of a prevention vaccine for people at high risk for cancer.

row.title: Running (and Eating) Away from Cancer
row.field_short_title: Running (and Eating) Away from Cancer-Sue Wharfe
row.field_page_description: Learn how Sue Wharfe benefitted from taking part in a clinical trial of exercise and nutrition for breast cancer survivors that was supported by NCI funding.

row.title: Addressing Cancer Disparities in Appalachia
row.field_short_title: Addressing Cancer Disparities in Appalachia-Electra Paskett, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Dr. Electra Paskett addresses cancer disparities through science and community partnerships. With NCI’s support, her efforts have made improvements in underserved communities.

row.title: Combining Drugs to Treat Ovarian Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Drugs to Treat Ovarian Cancer-Betsy Brauser
row.field_page_description: Approximately 70 percent of women diagnosed with ovarian cancer will die from the disease. Read about the NCI-funded combination drug trial that has successfully treated Betsy Brauser's recurrent cancer.

row.title: Using TCGA Data, Resources, and Materials
row.field_short_title: Using TCGA Data, Resources, and Materials
row.field_page_description: Using TCGA in your research? Learn about the data and other resources available.

row.title: Blood Test Shows Promise for Detecting Genetic Changes in Brain Tumors
row.field_short_title: Blood Test May Detect Genetic Changes in Brain Tumors
row.field_page_description: The minimally invasive test could be used to identify and follow molecular changes in children with highly lethal brain tumors called diffuse midline gliomas.

row.title: With Advances in Cancer Immunotherapy, Scientists Discuss Need to Develop New Mouse Models
row.field_short_title: Researchers Discuss Developing Better Cancer Immunotherapy Models
row.field_page_description: Developing better cancer immunotherapy mouse models was the focus of a recent NCI-sponsored meeting, including current challenges and future opportunities.

row.title: Genomic Profiling Tests Cleared by FDA Can Help Guide Cancer Treatment, Clinical Trial Enrollment
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Two Genomic Profiling Tests for Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved two genomic profiling tests for tumors. One of the tests, FoundationOne CDx (F1CDx), can be used as a companion diagnostic for some cancer therapies.

row.title: Fusobacterium May Help Colorectal Cancer Grow and Spread
row.field_short_title: Bacteria May Aid Growth of Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: The bacteria Fusobacterium may help fuel the growth of colorectal cancer, and antibiotics may help to treat it, a new study suggests.

row.title: NCI Scientists in the Community
Treatment of Head and Neck Cancer in Adults—Patient Version
row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Cancer Treatment in Adults
row.field_page_description: Find diagnosis, staging, and treatment information for these head and neck cancers: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ - Obligations by Budget Mechanism
row.field_page_description: NCI reports Cancer Moonshot obligations by funding mechanism. See obligations for Moonshot grants, intramural research, and contracts, including the number of grant awards, funding amounts, and percentages by mechanism of the total Cancer Moonshot budget.

row.title: TEST - Lung Cancer Research
Study Identifies Potential Cause of Hearing Loss from Cisplatin
row.field_short_title: Potential Cause of Cisplatin-Linked Hearing Loss Identified
row.field_page_description: The chemotherapy drug cisplatin is retained in the inner ear for long periods, possibly explaining the hearing loss linked to treatment with the drug.

row.title: Gut Bacteria Influence Effectiveness of a Type of Immunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Gut Bacteria Affect Response to Immunotherapy
row.field_page_description: Three new studies have identified intestinal bacteria that appear to influence the response to checkpoint inhibitors. This Cancer Currents blog post explains how the researchers think their findings could be used to improve patients’ responses to these immunotherapy drugs.

row.title: 2017 Embassy Science Fellowship: Bangkok, Thailand
FDA Approves New Treatment for Certain Neuroendocrine Tumors
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves New Treatment for Neuroendocrine Tumors
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved Lutathera® for some people with neuroendocrine tumors (NETs) that affect the digestive tract. On January 29, FDA approved Lutathera® for adult patients with advanced NETs that affect the pancreas or gastrointestinal tract, known as GEP-NETs.

row.title: NCI-MATCH Update: More Labs, New Arms, and Initial Findings
row.field_short_title: NCI-MATCH: More Labs, New Arms, and Initial Findings
row.field_page_description: The NCI-MATCH cancer precision medicine trial is adding new treatment arms and testing labs, and reporting initial findings, NCI’s Dr. Lyndsay Harris explains.

row.title: TCGA Contact Information
row.field_page_description: Find contact information for The Cancer Genome Atlas Program.

row.title: Chondromyxoid fibroma
Rhabdoid Tumor
Natural History Study of Rare Solid Tumors
row.field_short_title: Natural History Study of Rare Solid Tumors
row.field_page_description: By taking part in a natural history study, you can speed up the development of new treatments by giving researchers the tools they need to understand how cancer forms and grows and to find new treatments.

row.title: The Role of Advocacy in MyPART
row.field_short_title: The Role of Advocacy in MyPART
row.field_page_description: Our mission is to engage patients as partners in rare tumor research. Non-profit organizations dedicated to improving the experiences and outcomes of people with rare solid tumors are important members of the MyPART network.

row.title: What Is MyPART?
row.field_page_description: MyPART is a group of scientists, patients, family members, advocates, and healthcare providers who want to help find treatments for rare cancers. We are working on childhood, teen, and young adult solid rare tumors that have no cures.

row.title: Contact MyPART
Statistical Analysis of Research Data
New on NCI Websites for December 2018
row.field_short_title: New on NCI Websites for December 2018
row.field_page_description: See selected content that has been added to NCI’s websites as of December 2018, in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: News
CCR Fellows and Young Investigators Association
row.field_page_description: The Fellows and Young Investigators Association enhances the intramural training program by organizing, promoting and informing the NCI fellows of career development and training opportunities at the NIH. This association fosters communcation among fellows, NCI research community and senior management.

row.title: What are rare vascular tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare vascular tumors form in cells that make blood or lymph vessels, and can occur anywhere in the body, such as the skin, in the tissues below the skin, or in an organ. There are specific tumors that affect children, teens, and young adults.

row.title: Curbing Production of Immune Checkpoint Protein Slows Liver Cancer in Mice
row.field_short_title: Blocking Cancer’s Production of an Immune Checkpoint Protein
row.field_page_description: Production of PD-L1, an immune checkpoint protein, can be blocked in mice with liver cancer by an investigational drug called eFT508, a new study shows.

row.title: What are rare nerve tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare nerve tumors can form in the nervous system anywhere in the body. They can form in nerve cells or in cells around the nerve cells, like Schwann or perineurial cells.

row.title: Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research Acquisitions
row.field_page_description: The NCI Office of Acquisition administers contracts for the Frederick National Laboratory for Cancer Research. Browse opportunities for subcontracting and learn more about the prime contract competition.

row.title: test rare tumor1
After Lung Cancer Screening, Follow-Up Procedures May Be Riskier than Thought
row.field_short_title: Risks of Follow-Up Procedures after Lung Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: After lung cancer screening, complication rates from diagnostic procedures may be higher than indicated by results of the NLST trial, a new study suggests.

row.title: Szent-Györgyi Prize to honor NCI’s Steven A. Rosenberg
row.field_page_description: The 2019 Szent-Györgyi Prize for Progress in Cancer Research will be awarded to NCI’s Steven A. Rosenberg, M.D., Ph.D., for his pioneering role in the development of immunotherapy.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Thymoma
TCGA's Study of Uterine Carcinosarcoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Uterine Carcinosarcoma

row.title: NCI Meeting Room
row.field_page_description: Researchers can arrange a meeting with their Program Directors ahead of AACR to discuss individual grants and learn about new research initiatives at NCI. See the NCI Resource Room hours.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Paraganglioma & Pheochromocytoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Paraganglioma & Pheochromocytoma

row.title: Working with NCI Divisions, Offices and Centers to Advance Global Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: Working with NCI Divisions, Offices and Centers to Advance Global Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: According to recently released global cancer burden statistics, an estimated 18.1 new cancer cases and 9.6 million deaths from cancer were expected in 2018. Read CGH's newest Spotlight Blog to see how we are Working with NCI Divisions, Offices, and Centers to Advance Global Cancer Research.

row.title: Stimulating the Immune System Shrinks Some Slow-Growing Lymphomas
row.field_short_title: Stimulating Immune System Shrinks Some Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: Injecting SD-101 into a single tumor, plus radiation, in patients with indolent B-cell lymphoma shrank tumors elsewhere in the body, trial results show.

row.title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Classify Lung Cancer Types, Predict Mutations
row.field_short_title: Using Artificial Intelligence to Classify Lung Cancer Types
row.field_page_description: Using artificial intelligence, cancer researchers have trained a computer program to read slides of tissue samples and accurately identify the two most common forms of lung cancer.

row.title: Trial Results Highlight Changing Lung Cancer Treatment Landscape
row.field_short_title: Trials Highlight Changing Lung Cancer Treatment Landscape
row.field_page_description: The ALK inhibitor brigatinib (Alunbrig) and checkpoint inhibitor durvalumab (Imfinzi) can improve outcomes in patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer, results from two large clinical trials have affirmed.

row.title: Immunotherapy Drug Cemiplimab Approved for Advanced Squamous Cell Skin Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cemiplimab Approved for Advanced Squamous Cell Skin Cancer
row.field_page_description: The immunotherapy drug cemiplimab (Libtayo) has been approved by FDA for advanced cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma, a common type of skin cancer.

row.title: Making the Case for Biomarkers in Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Making the Case for Biomarkers in Cancer Treatment-T.J. Sharpe
row.field_page_description: Read how melanoma survivor T.J. Sharpe’s experience on two clinical trials highlights the need for biomarkers to predict benefit from immunotherapy.

row.title: ATAC-seq on TCGA: Insights Into the Noncoding Region in Primary Cancers
row.field_page_description: Using a chromatin accessibility assay to examine the noncoding genome in TCGA.

row.title: Meticulous Reconstructions of Tumor Origins With Single-Cell DNA Sequencing: Researcher Interview with Nicholas Navin
row.field_short_title: Nicholas Navin on Single-Cell DNA Sequencing
row.field_page_description: A pioneer in single-cell DNA sequencing talks about the technology and the research it enables.

row.title: Olaparib after Initial Treatment Delays Ovarian Cancer Progression
row.field_short_title: Olaparib Maintenance Therapy Delays Ovarian Cancer Progression
row.field_page_description: Could results from the SOLO-1 trial change the standard of care for women with newly diagnosed ovarian cancer that harbors a BRCA mutation?

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Testicular Cancer
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Testicular Cancer

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Adult Glioblastoma
row.field_short_title: Clinical Trials to Treat Adult Glioblastoma

row.title: Molecular Switch Links High-Fat Diet to Prostate Cancer Metastasis
row.field_short_title: High-Fat Diet Linked to Prostate Cancer Metastasis
row.field_page_description: A new study in mice has revealed a molecular link between a high-fat diet and the growth and spread of prostate cancer. As this Cancer Currents post explains, researchers also showed that an anti-obesity drug that targets a protein that controls fat synthesis could potentially be used to treat metastatic prostate cance

row.title: Lung Cancer Screening Most Beneficial for Those at Highest Risk, Analysis Suggests
row.field_short_title: Lung Cancer Screening May Benefit Those at Highest Risk
row.field_page_description: People at the highest risk for lung cancer, based on a risk model, may be more likely to benefit from screening with low-dose CT, a new analysis suggests. The study authors believe the findings may better define who should undergo lung cancer screening, as this Cancer Currents blog post explains.

row.title: TEST - What's New in Breast Cancer Research
row.field_short_title: TEST - What's New in Breast Cancer Research

row.title: Brentuximab Approved for Initial Treatment of Advanced Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: FDA Expands Approval of Brentuximab for Hodgkin Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has expanded the approved uses of brentuximab (Adcetris) in people with Hodgkin lymphoma. As this Cancer Currents post explains, it can now be used in combination with three chemotherapy drugs as an initial treatment in patients with advanced disease.

row.title: NCI Expands Repository of Cancer Research Models: A Conversation with Drs. Doroshow and Evrard
row.field_short_title: NCI Expands Repository of Cancer Research Models
row.field_page_description: NCI is expanding its Patient-Derived Models Repository (PDMR), which generates and distributes models like patient-derived xenografts and organoids. In this Cancer Currents Q&A with Drs. Yvonne Evrard and James Doroshow, learn how the expansion can help cancer researchers make more rapid progress.

row.title: International Cancer Screening Network
row.field_page_description: The International Cancer Screening Network promotes evidence-based cancer screening implementation and evaluation with cooperation from multilateral organizations around the globe. Learn more about how ICSN aims to reduce the global burden of cancer by supporting research and international collaboration.

row.title: Radiation Therapy Side Effects
row.field_page_description: Radiation therapy has side effects because it not only kills or slows the growth of cancer cells, it can also affect nearby healthy cells. Many people who get radiation therapy experience fatigue. Other side effects depend on the part of the body that is being treated. Learn more about possible side effects.

row.title: NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium: Program Logistics and Evaluation Coordinating Center (U24)
An NCI Affordable Cancer Technologies project selected as one of Physics World’s Top Ten Breakthroughs of 2018
row.field_short_title: An NCI Affordable Cancer Technologies project selected as one of Physics World’s Top Ten
row.field_page_description: Interested in technology devices for LMICs? Read how Eric Ford from the University of Washington and his team have recently been recognized by Physics World for his NCI-funded work to bring intensity-modulate radiotherapy (IMRT) to low- and middle-income settings.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Prostate Cancer

row.title: TCGA's Study of Adult Soft Tissue Sarcoma
TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
row.field_page_description: TCGA'S Study of Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma

row.title: Blog Posts by the NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless
row.field_short_title: Blog Posts by the NCI Director
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless writes posts regularly for NCI's Cancer Currents Blog that highlight his vision for NCI, meetings with and partnerships in the cancer community, and strategic and scientific initiatives to advance cancer research and care.

row.title: NCI study finds gut microbiome can control antitumor immune function in liver
row.field_short_title: Gut microbiome can control antitumor immune function in liver
row.field_page_description: An NCI study in mice that found a connection between gut bacteria and antitumor immune responses in the liver has implications for understanding mechanisms that lead to liver cancer and for potential treatments. The study was published in Science.

row.title: FDA Approves Second CAR T-Cell Therapy for Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Tisagenlecleucel Approved to Treat Some Lymphomas
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved the CAR T-cell therapy tisagenlecleucel for adults with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma that is relapsed or refractory. Learn more about this new approval and how it may affect patients in this NCI Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: Can Immunotherapy Succeed in Glioblastoma?
row.field_page_description: Researchers are hopeful that, for the deadly brain cancer glioblastoma, immunotherapy might succeed where other therapies have not. As this Cancer Currents post reports, different immunotherapy approaches are being tested in clinical trials.

row.title: Meet the Expert Sessions
row.field_page_description: Meet the Expert Sessions at American Public Health Association (APHA) Annual Meeting and Expo from Saturday, November 10 to Wednesday, November 14 in San Diego, CA.

row.title: The Genomic Data Commons Turns 2: Progress in Clinical Tool Development
row.field_page_description: Milestones and challenges ahead in building an interactive, open-access precision medicine tool

row.title: Trial Produces Practice-Changing Findings for Some Children, Young Adults with Leukemia
row.field_short_title: Nelarabine Improves Survival in Young Patients with T-Cell ALL
row.field_page_description: For some children and young adults with T-cell ALL, adding nelarabine (Arranon) to chemotherapy should be the standard of care, new clinical trial results suggest.

row.title: Biosimilars for Cancer Emerge as Patents on Widely Used Biological Drugs Expire
row.field_page_description: As the patents on widely used biological drugs to treat cancer expire, biosimilar drugs are being developed for the treatment of patients with cancer. You can learn how biosimilars may expand treatment options in this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: TCGA Molecular Characterization Platforms
Going Back to Work
A New Normal
Cancer Currents: An NCI Cancer Research Blog
row.field_page_description: Cancer Currents blog providing news and research updates from the National Cancer Institute

row.title: Get the Facts about Exposure to I-131 Radiation
Center for Cancer Genomics (CCG)
More than 300 million people in at least 70 countries use smokeless tobacco
row.field_short_title: More than 300 million people in at least 70 countries use smokeless tobacco
row.field_page_description: The first-ever report on the global use and public health impact of smokeless tobacco finds that more than 300 million people in at least 70 countries use these harmful products.

row.title: Secondhand Tobacco Smoke (Environmental Tobacco Smoke)
row.field_page_description: Learn about secondhand tobacco smoke, which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Secondhand tobacco smoke is the combination of the smoke given off by a burning tobacco product and the smoke exhaled by a smoker. Also called environmental tobacco smoke, involuntary smoke, and passive smoke.

row.title: Asbestos
row.field_page_description: Asbestos are a group of naturally occurring fibrous minerals used in fire-resistant and insulating material. Breathing high levels of asbestos can cause several diseases, including lung cancer and malignant mesothelioma. The use of asbestos is now highly regulated in the United States.

row.title: Nivolumab Improves Overall Survival in Patients with Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.field_short_title: Nivolumab for Metastatic Melanoma without a BRAF Mutation
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from an international phase III trial show that nivolumab (Opdivo®) improves overall survival compared with the chemotherapy drug dacarbazine in patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors do not have a mutation in the BRAF gene.

row.title: Benzene
row.field_page_description: Learn about benzene, a component of crude oil and other substances. Exposure to benzene may increase the risk of leukemia and other blood disorders. Among smokers, 90 percent of benzene exposure comes from smoking. Benzene may also be found in glues, adhesives, and paint or cleaning products.

row.title: Beryllium
row.field_page_description: Learn about beryllium, exposure to which can increase your risk of lung cancer. Beryllium is a naturally occurring, light-weight metal used in products such as aerospace components, transistors, nuclear reactors, and golf clubs. Most exposures occur to workers who produce such products.

row.title: Coal Tar and Coal-Tar Pitch
row.field_page_description: Learn about coal-tar products, which can raise your risk of skin cancer, lung cancer, and other types of cancer. Examples of coal-tar products include creosote, coal-tar pitch, and certain preparations used to treat skin conditions such as eczema, psoriasis, and dandruff.

row.title: Crystalline Silica
row.field_page_description: Learn about crystalline silica (quartz dust), which can raise your risk of lung cancer. Crystalline silica is present in certain construction materials such as concrete, masonry, and brick and also in commercial products such as some cleansers, cosmetics, pet litter, talcum powder, caulk, and paint.

row.title: Global Prostate Cancer Disparities in Black Men
row.field_short_title: Global Prostate Cancer Disparities in Black Men

row.title: Combining Two Types of Targeted Therapy Improves Survival in Some Patients with Advanced Melanoma (Updated)
row.field_short_title: Dabrafenib Plus Trametinib for Advanced Melanoma
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from two phase III trials show that patients with metastatic melanoma whose tumors have specific mutations in the BRAF gene lived longer following treatment with dabrafenib (Tafinlar®), a BRAF inhibitor, plus trametinib (Mekinist®), a

row.title: Targeting Ras Membrane Association: Still an Achilles Heel
row.field_short_title: Targeting Ras Membrane Association: Still an Achilles Heel
row.field_page_description: Mark Philips describes how post-translational modifications of KRAS protein influence trafficking

row.title: Program Spotlight: 2014 Professional Development Workshop Scientific Poster Winners
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: 2014 Professional Development Workshop Scientific Poster Winners

row.title: Program Spotlight: CRCHD Mock Grant Review
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: CRCHD Mock Grant Review

row.title: Drugs Approved for Esophageal Cancer
Program Spotlight: Partnership for the Advancement of Cancer Research Project Brings Cancer Research Training to Underrepresented Students at New Mexico State University
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: Partnership for the Advancement of Cancer Research Project

row.title: Rare kidney tumor provides insights on role of metabolic changes in cancer
row.field_short_title: Rare kidney tumor provides insight on metabolic changes
row.field_page_description: Researchers in The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) Network have uncovered a number of new findings about the biology and development of a rare form of kidney cancer. They found that the disease – chromophobe renal cell carcinoma – stems in part from alteratio

row.title: RAS Reagents
row.field_page_description: The RAS Reagents group prepares proteins, DNAs, and cell lines, all of which are required to attack cancers caused by mutant RAS.

row.title: National Lung Screening Trial
row.field_page_description: The National Lung Screening Trial (NLST), a research study sponsored by the National Cancer Institute that used low-dose helical CT scans or chest X-ray to screen men and women at risk for lung cancer.

row.title: NCI study examines outcomes from surgery to prevent ovarian cancer
row.field_short_title: Study examines outcomes from surgery to prevent ovarian cancer
row.field_page_description: A new study looked at women at high risk of ovarian cancer who had no clinical signs of the disease and who underwent risk-reducing salpingo-oophorectomy (RRSO). The study results showed cancer in the removed tissues of 2.6 percent (25 of 966) of the par

row.title: Understanding Cervical Changes: A Health Guide for Women
row.field_short_title: Understanding Cervical Changes: A Health Guide for Women

row.title: Facing Forward: Making a Difference in Cancer
row.field_short_title: Facing Forward: Making a Difference in Cancer

row.title: Thinking About Complementary and Alternative Medicine
row.field_short_title: Thinking About Complementary and Alternative Medicine

row.title: CRCHD Diversity Training
Breast Changes and Conditions
row.field_page_description: Breast changes include benign conditions and those that increase the risk of breast cancer. Symptoms and treatment of breast conditions such as ADH, ALH, cysts, DCIS, and LCIS are explained to women who may have received an abnormal mammogram finding.

row.title: Feelings and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ways to cope with your emotions and manage the emotional effects of cancer, including anger, fear, stress, and depression.

row.title: The RAS Initiative
row.field_page_description: NCI established the RAS Initiative to explore innovative approaches for attacking the proteins encoded by mutant forms of RAS genes and to ultimately create effective, new therapies for RAS-related cancers.

row.title: Method for Identifying Combination Therapies to Combat Treatment Resistance Shows Promise
row.field_short_title: Method for Studying Treatment Resistance Shows Promise
row.field_page_description: A blog post about a method for studying treatment resistance

row.title: CRCHD Mission
Vinyl Chloride
row.field_page_description: Learn about vinyl chloride, which can raise the risk of a rare form of liver cancer, as well as brain and lung cancers, and leukemia and lymphoma. Vinyl chloride is used primarily to make PVC, a substance used in products such as pipes.

row.title: Colorectal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Colorectal cancer studies often consider colon and rectal cancer together. Worldwide, colorectal cancer is the third most common form of cancer. Find evidence-based information on colon and rectal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Stomach Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on stomach cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Leukemia—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: There are different types of leukemia, including acute myeloid leukemia, acute lymphoblastic leukemia, chronic lymphocytic leukemia, chronic myelogenous leukemia, and hairy cell leukemia. Find evidence-based information on leukemia treatment, research, genomics, and statistics.

row.title: Treatment Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on cancer treatment, including news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Grants & Training
Scientific Conferences Where NCI Exhibits
row.field_page_description: Scientific conferences where NCI will be exhibiting, including ASCO, AACR, BIO, and APHA.

row.title: NCI Organization
row.field_page_description: Links to NCI's 30 divisions, offices, and centers who work together to build, maintain, and enhance a cohesive and comprehensive cancer research agenda.

row.title: Surgery to Reduce the Risk of Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Surgery to Reduce the Risk of Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes mastectomy and salpingo-oophorectomy, two surgeries that may be used to reduce breast cancer risk in women at very high risk, and nonsurgical options.

row.title: Contact Us for Help
Tumor Grade
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that discusses tumor grade and its role in prognosis. Explains concepts like normal cell biology and cell differentiation.

row.title: Computed Tomography (CT) Scans and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the CT scan procedure and technology and its uses in screening, diagnosis, and treatment.

row.title: MERIT Award
row.field_page_description: Early Stage Investigators who have submitted R01 applications may be eligible for the Method to Extend Research in Time (MERIT) (R37) Award.

row.title: Obesity and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the evidence linking overweight and obesity to the risk of various cancers and to cancer survivorship.

row.title: Partners and Collaborators
Childhood Cancer Survivor Study: An Overview
row.field_short_title: Childhood Cancer Survivor Study: An Overview
row.field_page_description: Health problems that develop years later as a result of a cancer treatment are known as late effects. The Childhood Cancer Survivor Study (CCSS) was started in 1994 to better understand these late effects.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Retinoblastoma
Cetuximab Combined with Oxaliplatin-Based Chemotherapy May Not Be Effective First-Line Treatment for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Cetuximab Plus Oxaliplatin May Not Be Effective Primary Treatment for Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: In a randomized phase III trial, the addition of the targeted therapy cetuximab to oxaliplatin and fluoropyrimidine chemotherapy did not prolong survival or time to disease progression of patients with advanced colorectal cancer.

row.title: Inclusion Criteria for NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_short_title: Inclusion Criteria for NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_page_description: Professionals who provide services related to cancer genetics (cancer risk assessment, genetic counseling, genetic susceptibility testing, and others) must meet these criteria before applying to be listed in the National Cancer Institute's Cancer Genetics Services Directory.

row.title: Lung-MAP Launches: First Precision Medicine Trial From National Clinical Trials Network
row.field_short_title: Lung-MAP Launches: First Precision Medicine Trial From National Clinical Trials Network
row.field_page_description: A unique public-private collaboration today announced the initiation of the Lung Cancer Master Protocol (Lung-MAP) trial, a multi-drug, multi-arm, biomarker-driven clinical trial for patients with advanced squamous cell lung cancer. Squamous cell carcinom

row.title: CGH Spotlight Blog
row.field_page_description: Stay up-to-date with the latest information and news from CGH and the global health communities.

row.title: RAS Central
row.field_page_description: RAS Central is NCI's online forum for RAS researchers, featuring blog posts, an online discussion forum, events and videos, and other useful tools and resources.

row.title: RAS Reference Reagents
row.field_page_description: NCI researchers have developed unique and powerful reagents at the NCI labs. Learn about and purchase the latest RAS pathways and reagents.

row.title: RAS Cell Lines
row.field_page_description: Cell lines expressing mutant RAS genes are essential tools for finding ways to intervene in RAS cancers. Learn about the work of NCI RAS Initiative scientists to engineer and characterize these cell lines, creating a reliable resource.

row.title: About the Office of Budget and Finance
row.field_page_description: The Office of Budget and Finance (OBF) advises the NCI Office of the Director and senior NCI staff on the effective management of financial and other resources to ensure that NCI operates in an efficient and fiscally responsible manner.

row.title: TCGA researchers identify four subtypes of stomach cancer
row.field_short_title: TCGA researchers identify 4 subtypes of stomach cancer
row.field_page_description: Stomach cancers fall into four distinct molecular subtypes, researchers with The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) Network have found. Scientists report that this discovery could change how researchers think about developing treatments for stomach cancer, also c

row.title: Lung Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on lung cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Malignant Mesothelioma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Epithelial mesothelioma is the most common type of malignant mesothelioma, which forms in the cells that line organs. The other types begin in spindle-shaped cells called sarcomatoid cells or are a mixture of both cell types. Find evidence-based information on malignant mesothelioma treatment.

row.title: Plasma Cell Neoplasms (Including Multiple Myeloma)—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: There are several types of plasma cell neoplasms, including monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (MGUS), isolated plasmacytoma of the bone, extramedullary plasmacytoma, and multiple myeloma. Find evidence-based information on plasma cell neoplasms treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Neuroblastoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Neuroblastoma is a disease in which malignant cells form in the neuroblasts of the adrenal glands and paraspinal nerve tissue from the neck to the pelvis. Find evidence-based information on neuroblastoma treatment, screening, research, and genetics.

row.title: Neuroblastoma Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on neuroblastoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Soft tissue sarcomas are malignant tumors that arise in any of the mesodermal tissues of the extremities, trunk and retroperitoneum, or head and neck. Soft tissue sarcomas may be heterogeneous. Find evidence-based information on soft tissue sarcoma treatment and research.

row.title: Testicular Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Most testicular cancers are germ cell tumors. Germ cell tumors are divided into seminomas and nonseminomas. Nonseminomas tend to grow and spread more quickly than seminomas. Find evidence-based information on testicular cancer treatment, screening, and statistics.

row.title: Advanced Cancer Research
Resources for International Partners
Palliative Care in Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes the role of palliative care, which is comfort care given to patients from the time of cancer diagnosis and throughout the course of illness.

row.title: Breast Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Breast cancer is the second most common cancer in women after skin cancer. Mammograms can detect breast cancer early, possibly before it has spread. Start here to find information on breast cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Program Spotlight: Ground Broken for NCI-supported Cancer Treatment Center in Puerto Rico
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: Ground Broken for NCI-supported Cancer Treatment Center in Puerto Rico

row.title: NIH-funded study uncovers range of molecular alterations in head and neck cancers, new potential drug targets; TCGA tumor genome sequencing analyses offer new insights into the effects of HPV and smoking
row.field_short_title: Study uncovers range of molecular alterations in head/neck cancers
row.field_page_description: Investigators with The Cancer Genome Atlas (TCGA) Research Network have discovered genomic differences – with potentially important clinical implications – in head and neck cancers caused by infection with the human papillomavirus (HPV).

row.title: Infection and Neutropenia during Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Infection and neutropenia can be serious side effects during cancer treatment. Chemotherapy can increase your risk. Learn how to prevent infection during treatment. Find out what signs and symptoms to call the doctor about.

row.title: Testicular Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Testicular cancer most often begins in germ cells (cells that make sperm). It is rare and is most frequently diagnosed in men 20-34 years old. Most testicular cancers can be cured, even if diagnosed at an advanced stage. Start here to find information on testicular cancer treatment, screening, and statistics.

row.title: Cancer.gov Home Page
row.field_page_description: Accurate, up-to-date, comprehensive cancer information from the U.S. government's principal agency for cancer research.

row.title: NIH partners with industry to create new ‘Living Lab’ for research into molecular structures that can affect disease
row.field_page_description: A new type of lab has been created to utilize near-atomic resolution microscopy and other structural biology technologies

row.title: Vitamin D and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on vitamin D and cancer prevention. It includes information about dietary recommendations for vitamin D.

row.title: "Flipping the Switch": An Interview with Dr. Mark Gilbert, Chief of NIH’s Neuro-Oncology Branch
row.field_short_title: "Flipping the Switch": Dr. Mark Gilbert Interview

row.title: Surgery to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Surgery, when used to treat cancer, is a procedure in which a surgeon removes cancer from your body. Learn how surgery is performed and different types of surgery.

row.title: NCI CCT K Awards Evaluation
row.field_short_title: Evaluation of the Career Development (K) Awards Program

row.title: Cancer Prevention Research
Researcher Interview: Elaine Mardis
Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated
row.field_short_title: Mineral Oils: Untreated and Mildly Treated
row.field_page_description: Learn about mineral oils, which can raise the risk of nonmelanoma skin cancer, particularly of the scrotum. Workers in a variety of manufacturing industries are most commonly exposed to mineral oils, as are workers in engine repair, copper mining, and commercial printing.

row.title: Ethylene Oxide
row.field_page_description: Learn about ethylene oxide, which can raise your risk of lymphoma and leukemia. Exposure may occur through industrial emissions, tobacco smoke, and the use of products sterilized with ethylene oxide, such as certain medical products or cosmetics.

row.title: Arsenic
RAS Pathway v2.0
October Spotlight: Breast Cancer Disparity Highlights
row.field_short_title: October Spotlight: Breast Cancer Disparity Highlights

row.title: How Imatinib Transformed Leukemia Treatment and Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: This story outlines the discovery of imatinib (Gleevec), a ground-breaking drug that transformed the treatment of chronic myelogenous leukemia and sparked the beginnings of precision medicine.

row.title: Image-guided biopsy for diagnosis of prostate cancer can increase detection of high-risk tumors
row.field_short_title: Image-guided diagnosis of prostate cancer can increase detection of tumors
row.field_page_description: In the largest prospective study to date of image-guided technology for identifying suspicious regions of the prostate to biopsy, researchers compared the ability of this technology to detect high-risk prostate cancer with that of the current standard of

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Kimberly Payne, Ph.D. - Investigating Leukemia Health Disparities in Hispanic and Native American Children
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Kimberly Payne, Ph.D. - Investigating Leukemia Health Disparities in Children

row.title: Media Contacts
Advance Directives
row.field_page_description: Advance directives are legal documents that allow you to decide ahead of time what kind of medical care you want or who you want to make decisions for you if you're too ill to speak for yourself.

row.title: Pain in People with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Controlling pain is an important part of your cancer treatment plan. Learn how to track levels of pain. Find out how pain, a side effect of cancer treatment, is treated using acupuncture, biofeedback, and physical therapy.

row.title: Urinary and Bladder Problems
row.field_page_description: Problems such as radiation cystitis and urinary tract infections, which are sometimes caused by cancer treatments, are discussed along with ways to prevent or manage them.

row.title: Edema (Swelling) and Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Edema is a condition in which fluid builds up in your body’s tissues. The swelling may be caused by chemotherapy, cancer, and conditions not related to cancer. Learn about signs of edema, including swelling in your feet, ankles, and legs.

row.title: DNA breaks early in replication process associated with B cell cancers
row.field_short_title: DNA breaks early in replication in B cell cancers
row.field_page_description: Research by scientists at the NCI has identified a new class of DNA sites in cells that break early in the replication process. They found that these break sites correlate with damage often seen in B cell cancers, such as diffuse large B cell lymphoma.

row.title: Lymphedema and Breast Cancer Surgery
Disclaimer of Endorsement and Liability
row.field_page_description: As detailed in this disclaimer policy, the National Cancer Institute does not endorse or recommend any commercial product or activity on its websites.

row.title: The potential of large studies for building genetic risk prediction models
row.field_short_title: The potential of large studies for building genetic risk prediction models
row.field_page_description: NCI scientists have developed a new paradigm to assess hereditary risk prediction in common diseases, such as prostate cancer. This genetic risk prediction concept is based on polygenic analysis—the study of a group of common DNA sequences, known as singl

row.title: Drugs Approved for Rhabdomyosarcoma
Surgery Choices for Women with DCIS or Breast Cancer
row.field_short_title: Surgery Choices for Women with DCIS or Breast Cancer

row.title: Study establishes basis for genomic classification of endometrial cancers; proper categorization is important for choosing the best treatment
row.field_short_title: Study establishes basis for genomic classification of endometrial cancers
row.field_page_description: A comprehensive genomic analysis of nearly 400 endometrial tumors suggests that certain molecular characteristics – such as the frequency of mutations – could complement current pathology methods and help distinguish between principal types of endometrial

row.title: Insights into a signaling process that enhances the effectiveness of cancer immunotherapy
row.field_short_title: Signaling Enhances the Effectiveness of Cancer Immunotherapy

row.title: Collateral Damage: Missing Tumor Suppressor Gene Creates Opening for Cancer Treatment
row.field_short_title: Missing Tumor Suppressor Gene Creates Treatment Opportunity
row.field_page_description: Tumor cells that are missing one copy of the tumor suppressor gene TP53 often harbor another genetic alteration that may make them susceptible to a targeted attack, according to a new study.

row.field_short_title: Ras: Do We Know Its Structure Well Enough?

row.field_short_title: Dr. Stefan Ambs: Increasing Diversity in Cancer Research: One Lab at a Time

row.field_short_title: Adjuvant Chemotherapy Improves Prostate Cancer Survival

row.title: Smokeless Tobacco and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the health risks associated with the use of smokeless tobacco.

row.title: About NCI
row.field_page_description: Information about the National Cancer Institute, including information about NCI's organization, budget, advisory boards, and employment opportunities.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma are rare tumors that can be benign (not cancer) or malignant. Pheochromocytomas form in the adrenal glands, and paragangliomas usually along nerve pathways in the head, neck, and spine. Start here to find information on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma treatment, and research.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Pediatric Treatment
row.field_page_description: Find treatment information for different types of cancer in children. Includes information about diagnosis, staging, and prognosis.

row.title: PDQ® Adult Treatment Editorial Board
The TAILORx Breast Cancer Trial
row.field_page_description: A collection of material about the Trial Assigning IndividuaLized Options for Treatment (Rx), or TAILORx.

row.title: Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Extragonadal germ cell tumors form in parts of the body outside the gonads. They may begin to grow anywhere in the body, but usually form in the pineal gland in the brain, the chest, the lower part of the spine, or the abdomen. Start here to find information on extragonadal germ cell tumors treatment.

row.title: NCI Budget and Appropriations
row.field_page_description: Information about NCI's current and previous annual budgets, strategic plans for the institute, and Congressional Justification documents.

row.title: Ataxia Telangiectasia
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about ataxia telangiectasia (A-T), a rare, recessive genetic disorder of childhood that occurs in between one out of 40,000 and one out of 100,000 persons worldwide.

row.title: Biological Therapies for Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that provides an overview of how the immune system functions and describes the actions of biological therapies.

row.title: Urethral Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Urethral cancer is rare and is more common in men than in women. Urethral cancer can metastasize (spread) quickly to tissues around the urethra and has often spread to nearby lymph nodes by the time it is diagnosed. Start here to find information on urethral cancer treatment.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Genetics
Study reports peak longevity benefit with an hour of daily exercise
row.field_short_title: Peak longevity with an hour of exercise
row.field_page_description: People who engage in three to five times the recommended minimum level of leisure-time physical activity derive the greatest benefit in terms of mortality reduction when compared with people who do not engage in leisure-time physical activity.

row.title: Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial (SELECT): Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial (SELECT): Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: Learn the results of the Selenium and Vitamin E Cancer Prevention Trial. SELECT was a clinical trial to see if one or both of these substances could help prevent prostate cancer when taken as dietary supplements.

row.field_short_title: Study finds increases in risk of leukemias related to treatment
row.field_page_description: A new study describes the pattern of risk for chemotherapy-related acute myeloid leukemia among adult cancer survivors over the past three decades who have previously been treated with chemotherapy for other cancers. These patterns coincide with major shi

row.title: Electrocautery Superior to Topical Treatments for Precancerous Anal Lesions
row.field_page_description: Results from a randomized clinical trial conducted in Amsterdam suggest that electrocautery is better than topical imiquimod or fluorouracil at treating potentially precancerous anal lesions in HIV-positive men who have sex with men.

row.field_page_description: Patients with a type of cancer known as primary mediastinal B-cell lymphoma who received infusions of chemotherapy, but who did not have radiation therapy to an area of the thorax known as the mediastinum, had excellent outcomes, according to clinical tri

row.field_short_title: Testing lung cancer drugs and therapies in mice
row.field_page_description: National Cancer Institute (NCI) investigators have designed a genetically engineered mouse for use in the study of human lung squamous cell carcinoma (SCC). SCC is a type of non-small cell lung carcinoma, one of the most common types of lung cancer, with

row.title: Welcome to the New Cancer.gov
row.field_page_description: NCI has launched a new, dynamic, and easier-to-use version of NCI’s main websites, Cancer.gov and its counterpart in Spanish, Cancer.gov/espanol.

row.field_page_description: Find information about cancer research training for those from backgrounds underrepresented in cancer biomedical and behavioral sciences.

row.field_page_description: See obligations to major NCI program areas, including research; resource development; cancer prevention and control; and program management and support.

row.field_short_title: TAILORx Trial Shows Women at Low Risk for Breast Cancer Recurring May Forgo Chemo
row.field_page_description: A summary of results from the Trial Assigning Individualized Options for Treatment, or TAILORx, finds that women with early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer have a low risk of recurrence based on a test for the expression of 21 genes.

row.field_page_description: The randomized, controlled Adjuvant Hormone Therapy trial was launched in 1990 to assess the effects of estrogen-alone hormone replacement therapy in women treated for epithelial ovarian cancer.

row.field_page_description: According to a survey-based study of more than 1,500 physicians treating patients with lung or colorectal cancer, medical oncologists were the most likely and surgeons the least likely to refer patients to, or enroll them in, clinical trials.

row.field_page_description: Results from a randomized phase III trial of denosumab to prevent skeletal related events in several types of cancer were published online February 22, 2011, in the Journal of Clinical Oncology (JCO).

row.title: Colorectal Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on colorectal cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Kidney Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on kidney cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Liver and Bile Duct Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on liver cancer and bile duct cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Pancreatic Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Exocrine pancreatic cancer is cancer of the exocrine gland of the pancreas, whereas cancer of the endocrine gland usually forms as a collection of tumor cell types referred to as pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors. Find evidence-based information on pancreatic cancer treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Parathyroid Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Parathyroid cancer often presents as a benign adenoma, though malignant carcinomas are possible. Parathyroid adenomas represent a common endocrine problem, whereas parathyroid carcinomas are very rare tumors. Find evidence-based information on parathyroid cancer treatment.

row.title: Retinoblastoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Retinoblastoma is a pediatric cancer. For patients with extraocular retinoblastoma, intensive chemotherapy is required, including high-dose chemotherapy and autologous hematopoietic stem cell rescue. Find evidence-based information on retinoblastoma treatment.

row.title: Skin Cancer (Including Melanoma)—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Basal cell carcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma are referred to as nonmelanoma skin cancers. Melanoma is a malignant tumor of melanocytes, which make the melanin. Find evidence-based information on skin cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Skin Cancer (Including Melanoma) Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on skin cancer, including melanoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Specialized Programs of Research Excellence (SPOREs)
row.field_page_description: SPOREs enable the rapid movement of basic findings into clinical settings and help determine the biological basis for research observations. See funding for SPORE programs by mechanism and cancer site.

row.title: NCI Funding Trends
row.field_page_description: Find information about NCI funding in past fiscal years, including percent growth by mechanism and percent share by mechanism.

row.field_short_title: Promise of Precision Medicine for Common Type of Lymphoma

row.field_page_description: Learn about DCB’s offices and branches as well as how it prioritizes programs, facilitates research, and communicates with scientists.

row.title: Enhancing Drug Discovery and Development
row.field_page_description: Cancer drug discovery and development has long been a priority for the National Cancer Institute, most importantly in areas of need that are not being adequately addressed by the private sector.

row.title: NCI Releases Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2017
row.field_short_title: NCI Releases FY2017 Annual Plan & Budget Proposal

row.title: Regional Centers of Research Excellence in Non-communicable Diseases in LMICs FAQs
row.field_short_title: Regional Centers of Research Excellence in Non-communicable Diseases in LMICs FAQs

row.title: David Q. Matus, Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: David Matus studies cellular invasion--a characteristic behavior of metastatic cancer cells--in an evolutionary context.

row.field_short_title: Patients with Advanced Cancer May Benefit from Discussing Prognosis with Physicians

row.title: Antioxidants Accelerate the Growth and Invasiveness of Tumors in Mice
row.field_short_title: Antioxidants Accelerate the Growth and Invasiveness of Tumors in Mice

row.title: Drugs Approved for Conditions Related to Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Conditions Related to Cancer
row.field_page_description: People with cancer may have other conditions caused by the cancer or its treatment. Drugs approved by the FDA for some of these cancer-related conditions are listed on this page, and link to NCI's Cancer Drug Information Summaries.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Melanoma
Ruth L. Kirschstein NRSA for Individual Predoctoral MD/PhD Degree Fellows (F30)
Urethral Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Urethral cancer is a rare cancer. There are three types of urethral cancer. Squamous cell carcinoma is the most common type. Transitional cell carcinoma of the urethra, and adenocarcinoma in the glands around the urethra are less common. Find evidence-based information on urethral cancer treatment.

row.title: Causes and Prevention Research
row.field_page_description: Find the latest research articles on cancer causes and risk factors for cancers and how some cancers may be prevented.

row.title: Clinical Trials to Treat Leukemia
Site Map
row.field_page_description: Site map for the National Cancer Institute website.

row.title: Bladder Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The most common type of bladder cancer is transitional cell carcinoma, also called urothelial carcinoma. Smoking is a major risk factor for bladder cancer. Bladder cancer is often diagnosed at an early stage. Start here to find information on bladder cancer treatment, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Pituitary Tumors—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Pituitary tumors are usually not cancer and are called pituitary adenomas. They grow slowly and do not spread. Rarely, pituitary tumors are cancer and they can spread to distant parts of the body. Start here to find information on pituitary tumors treatment.

row.title: Cancer in Children and Adolescents
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about statistics, types, causes, and treatment of childhood cancers in the United States.

row.title: Professional Resources for Cancer Patient Education
Tests to Detect Colorectal Cancer and Polyps
row.field_short_title: Tests to Detect Colorectal Cancer and Polyps
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that discusses the advantages and disadvantages of several colorectal cancer screening tests.

row.title: Leukemia—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Leukemia is a broad term for cancers of the blood cells. The type of leukemia depends on the type of blood cell that becomes cancer and whether it grows quickly or slowly. Start here to find information on leukemia treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Garlic and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies on the consumption of garlic for cancer prevention.

row.title: NIH scientists identify molecular link between metabolism and breast cancer
row.field_short_title: NIH scientists identify molecular link between metabolism and breast cancer

row.field_short_title: Velcade® and the Fight against Multiple Myeloma

row.title: Cancer Control Leadership Forums
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Control Leadership Forums help increase the capacity of participating countries to initiate or enhance cancer control planning and implementation in their respective countries.

row.title: Women's Cancers Program (WCP)
row.field_page_description: CGH is committed to build capacity for prevention, screening, detection, diagnosis and treatment of women’s cancers in LMICs.

row.title: Gynecologic Cancers Steering Committee
row.field_page_description: The Gynecologic Cancers Steering Committee evaluates and prioritizes concepts for phase 2 and 3 clinical trials in adult gynecologic cancers. The GCSC is also intent on fostering collaboration with international groups and institutions conducting trials.

row.title: Clinical Trial Concept Submission Guidelines
row.field_page_description: A guide to current NCI procedures for submitting phase 3 or large phase 2 clinical trial concepts to be evaluated by Scientific Steering Committees.

row.field_short_title: Symposium Focuses on Global Cancer Burden
row.field_page_description: The NCI Global Cancer Research Symposium examined ways of increasing research collaboration, particularly in cancer prevention and screening, to reduce the global cancer burden.

row.title: NCI’s CRCHD Launches National Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_short_title: CRCHD Launches National Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative
row.field_page_description: The NCI CRCHD launches National Screen to Save Colorectal Cancer Outreach and Screening Initiative which aims to increase colorectal cancer screening rates among racially and ethnically diverse and rural communities.

row.title: CGH Continues Building Partnership with the Commonwealth of Independent States at World Cancer Congress
row.field_short_title: Recent Activities with partners in the Commonwealth of Independent States
row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Global Health and Commonwealth of Independent States partners collaborate on cancer control in Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, and Turkmenistan.

row.title: Track 3: Oncology Product Research and Review for Postdoctoral Research Fellows
row.field_short_title: IOTF: Oncology Product Review for Postdoc Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train physicians in aspects of drug, biologic, or device development and standards for assessing medical product safety. Learn more about this cancer training program.

row.title: DCB Funding
row.field_page_description: The Division of Cancer Biology (DCB) funds and supports extramural basic research that investigates the fundamental biology behind cancer. Find out more about DCB's grants process and funding opportunities.

row.title: Bioinformatics, Big Data, and Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers take on challenges and opportunities to mine big data for answers to complex biological questions. Learn how bioinformatics uses advanced computing, mathematics, and technological platforms to store, manage, analyze, and understand data.

row.field_page_description: The Pediatric and Adolescent Solid Tumor Steering Committee addresses the design, prioritization and evaluation of concepts for large phase 2 and phase 3 clinical trials in extracranial solid tumors of children and youth.

row.title: Study Confirms Benefits of Early Palliative Care for Advanced Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Confirms Early Palliative Care Benefits
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a clinical trial showing that patients with advanced cancer who receive early palliative care had improved quality of life and mood.

row.title: Metabolomics Study Reveals another Energy Source for Cancer Cells

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on a study showing that, instead of discarding lactate, cancer cells can use it to fuel biochemical reactions, support their growth.

row.title: ‘Unexpected’ Vulnerability Creates Treatment Opportunity in Aggressive Type of Lung Cancer

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post about a study that identified a way to target a key vulnerability in lung cancers that have mutations in the KRAS gene.

row.title: Partnership in Cancer Control Planning Saves Lives
row.field_short_title: Partnership in Cancer Control Planning Saves Lives
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Center for Global Health and partner Pink Ribbon Red Ribbon collaborate to reduce cervical and breast cancer in Zambia, Botswana, Ethiopia, and Tanzania.

row.title: Interagency Oncology Task Force Fellowship
Current and Alumni Fellows
row.field_page_description: NCI and FDA collaborate to train scientists in research and research-related regulatory review. Meet the current IOTF fellows.

row.title: Brain Cancer’s Cholesterol Addiction May Offer New Treatment Strategy
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a study showing that treating mice with brain tumors with a cholesterol-depleting drug slowed tumor growth and improved survival.

row.title: New Mouse Model Closely Mimics Most Common Leukemia in Infants
row.field_short_title: Improved Research Model for Childhood Leukemia
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on a study describing the development of a long-sought-after mouse model for an aggressive form of acute lymphoblastic leukemia that occurs commonly in infants.

row.title: IOTF Mentors: Track 3 and Track 4
row.field_page_description: While at FDA, fellows are assigned a mentor who is a senior member of FDA scientific review staff. Learn more about mentors for Tracks 3 and 4.

row.title: New Targeted Therapies Show Promise for Treating Advanced GIST
row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog post on early-stage clinical trials of two new therapies that target genetic mutations in gastrointestinal stromal tumors that fuel resistance to standard therapies.

row.title: 2017 Press Releases
row.field_page_description: Press releases from the National Cancer Institute for the year 2017.

row.title: When Combined with Chemotherapy, Bevacizumab Is Associated with Increased Risk of Death

row.field_page_description: Cancer patients who receive the targeted therapy bevacizumab (Avastin) in combination with chemotherapy are at increased risk of serious side effects that may lead to death, according to a meta-analysis of 16 clinical trials that was published February 2,

row.title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_short_title: PSA Velocity Does Not Improve Prostate Cancer Detection
row.field_page_description: A rapid increase in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) levels is not grounds for automatically recommending a prostate biopsy, according to a study published online February 24, 2011, in the Journal of the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma

row.field_page_description: In this phase III clinical trial, people with confirmed HER2-positive locally advanced esophageal cancer will be randomly assigned to receive preoperative radiation therapy and chemotherapy, with or without trastuzumab.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Moonshot is marshalling resources across the federal government to speed progress in cancer research and lead to improved cancer prevention, detection, and treatment.

row.title: The ‘Crisis’ of Low HPV Vaccination Rates: A Conversation with Dr. Noel Brewer
row.field_short_title: A Conversation about the HPV Vaccination Crisis
row.field_page_description: Following the release of a consensus statement from the NCI-Designated Cancer Centers urging HPV vaccination in the United States, Dr. Noel Brewer discusses the country’s low vaccination rates and how clinicians can help to improve them.

row.title: Mouse Study Points to Mechanism Linking Obesity and Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_short_title: Mouse Study Points to Mechanism Linking Obesity and Colorectal Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A missing hormone in obese mice may help explain a longstanding association between obesity and an increased risk of colorectal cancer in humans.

row.title: A Conversation with Elizabeth Jaffee
row.field_page_description: In this RAS Dialogue blost post, Dr. Elizabeth Jaffee talks about her career developing immunotherapies for cancer.

row.title: Reports
row.field_page_description: Information about major NCI reports as well as other reports released by government health agencies and nonprofit groups that provide information about cancer.

row.field_page_description: In a small clinical trial of people with an inherited condition that greatly increases gastrointestinal cancer risk, a two-drug combination shrank precancerous lesions in the duodenum.

row.title: Nanoparticle Generator Slips Chemotherapy Past Tumor Cells’ Protective Barriers

row.field_page_description: Researchers have developed a new injectable nanoparticle-generating technology that can deliver a cancer drug to the nucleus of metastatic breast cancer cells.

row.field_page_description: Low vitamin D levels are associated with metastasis in women with breast cancer, suggests a new study.

row.field_page_description: President Obama’s FY 2017 Budget Request includes $680 million to support Vice President Biden’s cancer research initiative.

row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified a genetic rearrangement that may drive the development of a rare benign brain tumor in children through three distinct biological mechanisms simultaneously.

row.title: NCI opens online platform to submit ideas about research for Cancer Moonshot

row.field_page_description: NCI has launched an online platform to enable the research community and the public to submit ideas on the National Cancer Moonshot efforts.

row.field_page_description: A collection of researcher resources specific to cancer biology research.

row.field_page_description: Two new studies from NCI researchers add to growing evidence of the promise of a novel type of cancer immunotherapy that uses infrared light to activate rapid and selective killing of cancer cells.

row.field_page_description: In this phase I clinical trial, HIV-positive patients receiving combination antiretroviral therapy who have cancer that has recurred after or has not responded to previous treatment will receive the immune checkpoint inhibitor pembrolizumab.

row.title: Enhanced Risk-Based Lung Cancer Screening May Prevent More Deaths than Current Approaches
row.field_short_title: Risk Profiling May Improve Lung Cancer Screening
row.field_page_description: A new modeling study suggests that individualized, risk-based selection of ever-smokers for lung cancer screening may prevent more lung cancer deaths and improve the effectiveness and efficiency of screening compared with current screening recommendations

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a new 3-D modeling tool that may help identify effective treatments for some cancers.

row.field_page_description: A Cancer Currents blog on research from two studies which found that drugs known as PRC2 and BET inhibitors shrank tumors in mouse models of the childhood brain cancer DIPG.

row.field_page_description: This booklet outlines successful strategies that can help people quit smoking and stay smoke-free.

row.field_page_description: The RAS Initiative, a "hub and spoke" model, connects researchers to better understand and target the more than 30% of cancers driven by mutations in RAS genes. Includes oversight and contact information.

row.field_page_description: Five extramural research divisions and several offices and centers monitor and administer NCI’s extramural grant and contract research activities.

row.title: Neuroblastoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Neuroblastoma is a cancer of immature nerve cells that most often occurs in young children. It usually begins in the adrenal glands but can form in the neck, chest, abdomen, and spine. Start here to find information on neuroblastoma treatment, screening, and research.

row.title: Chemotherapy Before Surgery May Increase Survival in Stomach Cancer
