row.field_page_description: Chemotherapy given before surgery for cancer of the lower esophagus and stomach increased the number of patients surviving for five years compared to surgery alone, according to findings presented at the 2007 ASCO meeting in Chicago.

row.title: Head and Neck Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Head and neck cancers include cancers in the larynx (voice box), throat, lips, mouth, nose, and salivary glands. Start here to find information on head and neck cancer treatment in adults and children, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: NCI Outstanding Investigator Award Recipients
row.field_page_description: Learn how these investigators' projects aim to break new ground in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical cancer research.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog from acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy providing an update on the activities of the National Cancer Moonshot Initiative’s Blue Ribbon Panel and its work to develop a final report.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about research into the mechanisms that allow breast cancer cells to invade bone and remain there for years before emerging to cause cancer.

row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog post on a recent study that suggest adolescents are not just using e-cigarettes as a substitute for conventional cigarettes but that e-cigarettes are attracting new users to tobacco products.

row.title: HIV and influenza share a similar structural blueprint

row.field_page_description: HIV uses a protein called the envelope glycoprotein spike to attach itself and fuse with the cell membrane; NCI scientists have now defined the structure of this spike in its pre-fusion state using cryo-electron microscopy

row.title: Fewer doses of HPV vaccine result in immune response similar to three-dose regimen

row.field_page_description: NCI scientists report that two doses of a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine, trademarked as Cervarix, resulted in similar serum antibody levels against two of the most carcinogenic types of HPV (16 and 18), compared to a standard three dose regimen.

row.field_page_description: An intact gut commensal microbiota, which is a population of microorganisms living in the intestine, is required for optimal response to cancer therapy, according to a mouse study by scientists at the National Cancer Institute (NCI)

row.field_page_description: ROS1ders, a group of lung cancer patients who share a rare genetic abnormality, united to promote research by foundations, academics, and industry.

row.field_page_description: NCI's Center for Cancer Genomics seeks to use genomics to find better treatments for childhood cancer

row.field_page_description: Many female cancer survivors have problems with mobility and other physical functioning as a result of persistent peripheral neuropathy caused by chemotherapy treatment, according to a new study.

row.title: Small Intestine Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on small intestine cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Single-Cell Analysis Zooms in on Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Single-Cell RNA Sequencing Study of Melanoma

row.title: New Treatment Target Identified for Key Prostate Cancer Driver
row.field_short_title: Study Identifies New Treatment Target for Prostate Cancer
row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified a potential alternative approach to blocking a key molecular driver of an advanced form of prostate cancer, called androgen-independent or castration-resistant prostate cancer.

row.title: Elevated bladder cancer risk in New England and arsenic in drinking water from private wells
row.field_short_title: Elevated Bladder Cancer Risk in New England

row.title: CGH observes National Women’s Health Week
row.field_short_title: CGH observes National Women’s Health Week

row.title: Grantees or Grant Applicants Submitting Data
row.field_short_title: Grantees or Grant Applicants Submitting Data
row.field_page_description: In order to be compliant with the Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy, extramural investigators should use the following to guide their steps through the grant life-cycle process.

row.title: Non-NIH Funded Investigators Submitting Data
row.field_page_description: Learn how non-NIH funded investigators may submit genomic data to the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP) or the Genomic Data Commons (GDC), under the NIH Genomic Data Sharing policy.

row.title: New on NCI’s Websites for June 2016
row.field_short_title: New on NCI’s Websites for June 2016
row.field_page_description: NCI periodically provides updates on new websites and other online content of interest to the cancer community.

row.title: Contracting Opportunities
row.field_page_description: Contracting opportunities with the National Cancer Institute can be found in several different ways. The NCI Office of Acquisitions also works to connect small and disadvantaged buisnesses with subcontracting opportunities.

row.title: About OA
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Office of Office of Acquisitions (OA) has several divisions that handle contracting and acquisitions for different parts of the National Cancer Institute.

row.title: Glioblastoma Study Highlights Sex Differences in Brain Cancer
row.field_short_title: Study Reveals Sex Differences in Glioblastoma
row.field_page_description: Men and women with glioblastoma appear to respond differently to treatment. A new study identifies biological factors that might contribute to this sex difference.

row.title: FNLCR Acquisitions FedBIzOpps Notices
row.field_page_description: Browse the list of FedBizOpps Notices regarding the FNLCR prime contractor competitive acquisition process.

row.title: NCI Awardee Skills Development Consortium: Research Education Short Courses (UE5)
TCGA's Study of Gastric Adenocarcinoma
NCI at AACR 2019
row.field_page_description: NCI is participating at the American Association for Cancer Research (AACR) Annual Meeting, March 29-April 3, 2019 at the Georgia World Congress Center in Atlanta, GA. See the schedule of NCI-sponsored sessions and NCI expert booth presentations

row.title: Sessions Featuring NCI Staff
row.field_page_description: The NCI-sponsored sessions at AACR are dedicated to discussing programs held throughout NCI, while the poster sessions and presentations offer a platform for NCI scientists to relay study findings. Find the sessions led by NCI staff at AACR 2019.

row.title: Tumor Microenvironment Influences Metabolism of Cancer Cells
row.field_short_title: Tumor Microenvironment Influences Metabolism of Cancer Cells
row.field_page_description: In a new blog post in RAS Dialogue, Dr. Cosimo Commisso discusses how the metabolism of cancer cells might be different in different parts of solid tumors.

row.title: Significant expansion of data available in the Genomic Data Commons
row.field_short_title: Expansion of data available in the Genomic Data Commons
row.field_page_description: The recently launched Genomic Data Commons will get a dramatic increase in the power and utility of its resources with the signing today of a data sharing agreement between the NCI and Foundation Medicine, Inc. (FMI), a molecular information company.

row.title: The Cancer Moonshot Summit: Reaching New Heights
row.field_short_title: The Cancer Moonshot Summit: Reaching New Heights
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog from acting NCI Director Dr. Doug Lowy on the Cancer Moonshot national summit hosted by Vice President Joe Biden in Washington, D.C., including a summary of the NCI-related activities stimulated by the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: Inherited Mutations in DNA-Repair Genes Found in Advanced Prostate Cancers
row.field_short_title: Inherited Mutations Identified in Advanced Prostate Cancers
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about the discovery in men with advanced prostate cancer of inherited mutations in genes that play a role in repairing damaged DNA.

row.title: Partner-Aided Skin Exams Increase Early Detection of New Melanomas
row.field_short_title: Partner-Aided Skin Exams Increase Early Detection of New Melanomas
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study which showed that people previously treated for melanoma can team up with a partner and be trained to find new melanomas.

row.title: Nanoparticle Delivers Cancer Drugs to Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_short_title: Nanoparticle Delivers Cancer Drugs to Tumor Blood Vessels
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on a study showing that, in cancer mouse models, nanoparticles that target P-selectin on tumor blood vessels shrank tumors and extended survival.

row.title: Oxygen can impair cancer immunotherapy in mice
row.field_short_title: Oxygen can impair immune response in mice
row.field_page_description: Researchers have identified a mechanism in mice by which anticancer immune responses are inhibited within the lungs, a common site of metastasis for many cancers.

row.title: Approach May Allow for Stem Cell Transplant without Radiation, Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Study Tests Safer Stem Cell Transplant
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a study testing a potentially safer way to perform stem cell transplants for treating cancer and other diseases.

row.title: RAS Biochemistry and Biophysics
row.field_page_description: This RAS Biochemistry and Biophysics lab investigates signaling by RAS proteins, which is regulated by the interactions with substrates, protein partners, and membranes.

row.title: NCI and FDA Address Common Concerns: A Win–Win for Making Progress against Cancer
row.field_short_title: NCI and FDA Collaborating on Common Concerns
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Norman Sharpless discusses efforts between NCI and FDA to advance progress against cancer, including initiatives to improve labeling of patient tumor and tissue samples and address challenges presented by new tobacco products.

row.title: Strategic Planning at NCI
row.field_page_description: NCI’s strategic goals and priorities aim to direct progress against cancer to meet the needs of all people. Learn how priorities are set and how funding decisions are made at NCI.

row.title: Heart Problems: Investigating the Cardiac Side Effects of Cancer Treatments
row.field_short_title: Investigating the Cardiac Side Effects of Cancer Treatments
row.field_page_description: Certain cancer treatments can damage the heart and the cardiovascular system, a problem known as cardiotoxicity. Cardiologists and oncologists met recently to discuss strategies and future research directions for addressing these side effects.

row.title: 2017 Outstanding Investigator Award Recipients
row.field_page_description: Learn how these investigators' projects aim to break new ground in biomedical, behavioral, and clinical cancer research.

row.title: Searching for Less-Toxic Cancer Treatments for Kids
row.field_short_title: Searching for Less-Toxic Cancer Treatments for Kids-Gregory Aune, M.D., Ph.D.
row.field_page_description: Frustration with the toxicities of chemotherapy and radiation spurs cancer survivor and investigator Greg Aune to look for less-toxic therapies for children.

row.title: Conversation with Dr. Shiva Malek and Dr. Christiaan Klijn
row.field_short_title: Conversation with Dr. Shiva Malek and Dr. Christiaan Klijn
row.field_page_description: Inhibiting MEK re-wires regulation of MAPK signaling so that inhibitors of RAF kinases are more effective against cells driven by mutant KRAS.

row.title: Trichloroethylene (TCE)
row.field_page_description: Trichloroethylene (TCE) is a chemical used to make refrigerants and as a metal degreaser. It may be found in contaminated soil or water near military bases and in some commercial and household cleaning products. TCE exposure may cause kidney cancer and increase the risk of lymphoma and liver cancer.

row.title: Plans for NCI’s Fiscal Year 2019 Budget
row.field_short_title: Plans for NCI’s Fiscal Year 2019 Budget
row.field_page_description: NCI Director Dr. Ned Sharpless on NCI’s FY2019 budget and important budgetary decisions, including those related to the Cancer Moonshot and young investigators.

row.title: About Rare Cancers
Fibrolamellar hepatocellular carcinoma
Challenges for Rare Tumor Researchers
Whole- and Partial-Breast Radiation Effective at Preventing Breast Cancer from Returning
row.field_short_title: Two Radiation Therapy Approaches Prevent Breast Cancer Recurrences
row.field_page_description: In women with early-stage breast cancer, whole- and partial-breast radiation therapy effectively prevent cancer from returning after breast-conserving surgery.

row.title: Clinical Trials Reporting Program
row.field_page_description: The Clinical Trials Reporting Program is a comprehensive database of all NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.title: Clinical Trials Search Results
Clinical Trials (PDQ®)
Reflections from a Year at the Center for Global Health
row.field_short_title: Reflections from a Year at the Center for Global Health

row.title: Human Cancer Models Initiative Will Create Next Generation Cancer Models That Have Genomic and Clinical Data
row.field_short_title: Launch of Human Cancer Models Initiative
row.field_page_description: The NCI has formed new international collaboration called the Human Cancer Models Initiative to generate better models of human cancers to support cancer research.

row.title: Researcher Interview: Aviv Regev
row.field_page_description: Amy E. Blum, M.A. spoke with Aviv Regev, Ph.D. in this CCG researcher interview.

row.title: Cancer Disparities
row.field_page_description: Basic information about cancer disparities in the U.S., factors that contribute to the disproportionate burden of cancer in some groups, and examples of disparities in incidence and mortality among certain populations.

row.title: Nanoparticle that Mimics Salmonella Counteracts Chemotherapy Resistance
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a nanoparticle that mimics Salmonella and may help counteract chemotherapy resistance.

row.title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_short_title: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Head and Neck Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA granted pembrolizumab accelerated approval for some patients with head and neck cancer.

row.title: NCI embraces scientific road map to achieve Cancer Moonshot goals
row.field_short_title: NCI embraces scientific road map to achieve Cancer Moonshot goals
row.field_page_description: NCI Acting Director Douglas Lowy, M.D., today accepted, with revisions that reflect NCAB’s discussion, the 10 transformative recommendations of a Blue Ribbon Panel.

row.title: CGH Roundtable on HPV Screening
Thymoma and Thymic Carcinoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Thymomas and thymic carcinomas are rare tumors that form in cells on the thymus. Thymomas grow slowly and rarely spread beyond the thymus. Thymic carcinoma grows faster, often spreads to other parts of the body, and is harder to treat. Start here to find information on thymoma and thymic carcinoma treatment.

row.title: Colorectal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Colorectal cancer often begins as a growth called a polyp inside the colon or rectum. Finding and removing polyps can prevent colorectal cancer. Start here to find information on colon and rectal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Meeting Patients Where They Are: Liberating Clinical Trials Data Under the Cancer Moonshot
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about a new application programming interface (API) that allows anyone to build online tools that help people find NCI-supported clinical trials.

row.title: Message from Dr. Lowy
row.field_page_description: A message from NCI Acting Director, Douglas Lowy, about the progress of the RAS Initiative and its goal to create a virtual network of scientists working collaboratively to solve the RAS problem.

row.title: Small Intestine Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Small intestine cancer usually begins in an area of the intestine called the duodenum. This cancer is rarer than cancers in other parts of the gastrointestinal system, such as the colon and stomach. Explore the links on this page to learn more about small intestine cancer treatment, statistics, research, and clinical t

row.title: Penile Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Penile cancer usually forms on or under the foreskin. Human papillomavirus (HPV) causes about one-third of penile cancer cases. When found early, penile cancer is usually curable. Start here to find information on penile cancer treatment and research.

row.title: Anal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Anal cancer cases have been increasing over several decades. Infection with human papillomavirus (HPV) is the major risk factor for anal cancer. Start here to find information on anal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, research, and statistics.

row.title: Cancer Treatment
row.field_page_description: Information on cancer treatment methods, specific anticancer drugs, and drug development and approval. Research updates, cancer treatment facilities, and other topics also covered.

row.title: Selected NCI-Supported Trials
row.field_page_description: Information about selected NCI-supported clinical trials, open or closed to patient enrollment.

row.title: New report highlights epidemic of tobacco and global health inequalities
row.field_short_title: New report highlights epidemic of tobacco and global health inequalities
row.field_page_description: A new set of 11 global health studies calls attention to the burden of tobacco-related inequalities in low- and middle-income countries and finds that socioeconomic inequalities are associated with increased tobacco use, second-hand smoke exposure and tob

row.title: NIH study finds sigmoidoscopy reduces colorectal cancer rates
row.field_short_title: NIH study finds sigmoidoscopy reduces colorectal cancer rates
row.field_page_description: Study finds that flexible sigmoidoscopy is effective in reducing the rates of new cases and deaths due to colorectal cancer. Researchers found that overall colorectal cancer mortality was reduced by 26 percent and incidence was reduced by 21 percent as a

row.title: REMARK checklist elaborated to improve tumor prognostic study reporting
row.field_short_title: REMARK checklist elaborated to improve tumor prognostician
row.field_page_description: Experts have elaborated on a previously published checklist of 20 items -- including descriptions of design, methods, and analysis -- that researchers should address when publishing studies of prognostic markers. These markers are indicators that enable d

row.title: Prognosis Discussions Improve Understanding of Illness for Patients with Terminal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Prognosis Discussions Improve Understanding of Illness for Patients with Terminal Cancer
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on patients with advanced, curable cancer and the effect of discussing their prognosis and their understanding of the serious nature of their illness.

row.title: Study Forecasts ‘Silver Tsunami’ of Cancer Survivors
row.field_short_title: Study Forecasts ‘Silver Tsunami’ of Cancer Survivors
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog on an NCI study that is forecasting a substantial increase in older cancer survivors over the next 25 years.

row.title: New Awards in NCI’s Cancer Systems Biology Consortium
row.field_short_title: New Awards in NCI’s Cancer Systems Biology Consortium
row.field_page_description: Announcement that NCI awarded four new grants in the Cancer Systems Biology Consortium (CSBC).

row.title: Cancer Clinical Trials API
Engineered Stem Cells Help Identify Potential New Treatment for Medulloblastoma
row.field_short_title: Improved Lab Model Developed for Studying Medulloblastoma
row.field_page_description: An NCI Cancer Currents blog about neural stem cells engineered to provide a new laboratory model for studying medulloblastoma.

row.title: RAS Initiative Events
row.field_page_description: The NCI RAS Initiative has organized multiple events with outside experts to discuss how the latest scientific and technological breakthroughs can be applied to discover vulnerabilities in RAS-driven cancers.

row.title: Tea and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that summarizes the results of studies about tea and cancer prevention. Includes information about the ingredients of tea and safety considerations regarding tea consumption.

row.title: What Is Cancer?
row.field_page_description: Explanations about what cancer is, how cancer cells differ from normal cells, and genetic changes that cause cancer to grow and spread.

row.title: Abortion, Miscarriage, and Breast Cancer Risk: 2003 Workshop
row.field_short_title: Abortion, Miscarriage, and Breast Cancer Risk: 2003 Workshop

row.title: Electromagnetic Fields and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about research on electric and magnetic fields and studies examining their potential connection with cancer.

row.title: PDQ® Cancer Information Summaries: Supportive and Palliative Care
Antioxidants and Cancer Prevention
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about antioxidants, substances that may protect cells from the damage caused by unstable molecules known as free radicals. Free radical damage may lead to cancer.

row.title: Social Media at NCI
Drug that blocks blood vessel growth may be beneficial in treating AIDS-related Kaposi’s sarcoma
row.field_short_title: Blood vessel growth blocker may treat AIDS-related Kaposi’s sarcoma
row.field_page_description: Patients with an AIDS-associated cancer, Kaposi's sarcoma (KS), showed improvement after receiving the combination of bevacizumab, a cancer drug that blocks the growth of new blood vessels, and highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART).

row.title: Primary Bone Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the diagnosis and treatment of cancers that develop in the bones.

row.title: Stomach (Gastric) Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Stomach (gastric) cancer occurs when cancer cells form in the lining of the stomach. Risk factors include smoking, infection with H. pylori bacteria, and certain inherited conditions. Start here to find information on stomach (gastric) cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Early Reproductive Events and Breast Cancer: Workshop Statement
row.field_page_description: This scientific workshop was convened by the National Cancer Institute in 2003 to present and review the information available on the risk of breast cancer associated with pregnancy.

row.title: End-of-Life Care for People Who Have Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that answers some of the questions patients, their family members, and caregivers may have about the end of life.

row.title: Prostate Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Prostate cancer is the most common cancer among men in the United States. Prostate cancer usually grows very slowly, and finding and treating it before symptoms occur may not improve men’s health. Start here to find information on prostate cancer treatment, research, causes and prevention, screening, and statistics.

row.title: Soft Tissue Sarcoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Soft tissue sarcoma is a cancer that starts in soft tissues like muscle, tendons, fat, lymph vessels, blood vessels, and nerves. These cancers can develop anywhere in the body but are found mostly in the arms, legs, chest, and abdomen. Start here to find information on soft tissue sarcoma treatment and research.

row.title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_short_title: Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, and Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_page_description: Ovarian epithelial cancer is the most common type of ovarian cancer. Cancer can also form at the end of the fallopian tube near the ovary or the peritoneum and spread to the ovary. Start here to find information on ovarian cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Description of NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_short_title: Description of NCI Cancer Genetics Services Directory
row.field_page_description: Background and Purpose of PDQ Cancer Genetics Services Directory

row.title: Cigar Smoking and Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about the health risks associated with cigar smoking.

row.title: Certificates of Confidentiality
row.field_page_description: Background information and application procedures for researchers.

row.title: Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975-2008, Featuring Cancers Associated with Excess Weight and Lack of Sufficient Physical Activity: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Annual Report to the Nation on Cancer, 1975-2008: Q&A
row.field_page_description: Overall cancer death rates have continued to decrease since the early 1990s among men, women, and children. Death rates decreased on average 1.6 percent per year between 2004 and 2008.

row.title: Hormone Therapy for Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes types of hormone therapy, its role in preventing and treating breast cancer, and possible side effects.

row.title: Many Patients with Cancer Need Better Treatments for Pain
row.field_short_title: Many Patients with Cancer Need Better Treatments for Pain

row.title: Chemoradiation May Help Some Patients with Bladder Cancer Avoid Radical Surgery
row.field_short_title: Chemoradiation May Help Some Patients with Bladder Cancer Avoid Radical Surgery
row.field_page_description: Researchers in the United Kingdom have found that adding chemotherapy to radiation therapy as a treatment for bladder cancer may reduce the risk of a recurrence more than radiation alone, without causing a substantial increase in side effects.

row.title: For Some Breast Cancers, New Drug May Be Treatment Option
row.field_short_title: For Some Breast Cancers, New Drug May Be Treatment Option
row.field_page_description: Results from an international clinical trial suggest that women with metastatic, HER2-positive breast cancer that is no longer responding to the targeted therapy trastuzumab (Herceptin) may soon have a new treatment option.

row.title: CCCT Contact and Staff Information
row.field_page_description: Contact and staff information for NCI's Coordinating Center for Clinical Trials (CCCT).

row.title: Expanding Smoking Cessation Services at NCI-Designated Cancer Centers: An Interview with Dr. Glen Morgan
row.field_short_title: Expanding Smoking Cessation at NCI-Designated Cancer Centers
row.field_page_description: A new smoking cessation initiative will support NCI-Designated Cancer Centers efforts to help more patients quit smoking, as Dr. Glen Morgan explains in this Cancer Currents interview.

row.title: Acalabrutinib Receives FDA Approval for Mantle Cell Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Acalabrutinib Approved for Mantle Cell Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: Acalabrutinib (Calquence®) has been granted accelerated approval by FDA for the treatment of adults with mantle cell lymphoma whose cancer has progressed after receiving at least one prior therapy.

row.title: Strengthening CGH’s partnerships in cancer research and control in Africa: AORTIC 2017
row.field_short_title: Strengthening CGH’s partnerships in cancer research and control in Africa: AORTIC 2017

row.title: Selected Interviews with the NCI Director
row.field_short_title: Selected Interviews by the NCI Director
row.field_page_description: See interviews given by Dr. Norman “Ned” Sharpless during his time as NCI director.

row.title: Volunteer Opportunities and Events
row.field_page_description: Volunteer with Scientists in the Community. NCI Trainees can participate upcoming events or an ongoing opportunity with flexible days and times.

row.title: Treatment of Head and Neck Cancer in Children and Adolescents—Patient Version
row.field_short_title: Head and Neck Cancer Treatment in Children and Adolescents
row.field_page_description: Find diagnosis, staging, and treatment information for these head and neck cancers: hypopharynx, larynx, lip and oral cavity, neck cancer with occult primary, nasopharynx, oropharynx, paranasal sinus and nasal cavity, and salivary gland cancer.

row.title: NCI’s Douglas R. Lowy and John T. Schiller to receive 2017 Lasker Award
row.field_short_title: NCI’s Lowy and Schiller win 2017 Lasker Award
row.field_page_description: NCI’s Douglas R. Lowy and John T. Schiller will receive the 2017 Lasker-DeBakey Clinical Medical Research Award. This NCI press release describes their HPV research, which led to the honor.

row.title: Forgoing Conventional Cancer Treatments for Alternative Medicine Increases Risk of Death
row.field_short_title: Alternative Medicine for Cancer Treatment Raises Mortality Risk
row.field_page_description: Choosing alternative medicine as an initial cancer treatment led to substantially worse survival than patients who received conventional cancer treatments, this Cancer Currents post explains.

row.title: A Brief Tour of DAVE: The Genomic Data Commons Analysis Toolkit
row.field_page_description: Get a tour of GDC's genomic analysis and visualization tools

row.title: Study Identifies Crucial Characteristic of High-Risk HPV
row.field_short_title: Study Identifies Crucial Characteristic of High-Risk HPV
row.field_page_description: For human papillomavirus type 16 (HPV16) to cause cervical cancer, a precise DNA sequence of the E7 gene may be required, this Cancer Currents post on a new study explains.

row.title: Pembrolizumab Secures FDA Approval in Stomach Cancer
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab Secures FDA Approval in Stomach Cancer
row.field_page_description: FDA has approved the immunotherapy drug pembrolizumab (Keytruda®) for use in some patients with advanced gastric (stomach) cancer that is PD-L1 positive.

row.title: Abemaciclib Approved by FDA for Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer
row.field_page_description: Abemaciclib (Verzenio™), a type of CDK4/6 inhibitor, has been approved by FDA for some patients with advanced or metastatic breast cancer.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, or Primary Peritoneal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Drugs Approved for Ovarian, Fallopian Tube, or Primary Peritoneal Cancer

row.title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_short_title: New Therapies Offer Valuable Options for Patients with Melanoma
row.field_page_description: Two phase III clinical trials of new therapies for patients with metastatic melanoma presented in June at the 2011 ASCO conference confirmed that vemurafenib and ipilimumab (Yervoy™) offer valuable new options for the disease.

row.title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_short_title: Exemestane Reduces Breast Cancer Risk in High-Risk Postmenopausal Women
row.field_page_description: Clinical trial results presented at the 2011 ASCO annual meeting showed that the aromatase inhibitor exemestane—used to treat early and advanced breast cancer—substantially reduced the risk of invasive breast cancer in high-risk postmenopausal women.

row.title: Drugs Approved for Liver Cancer
Contributing to Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Information about donating money to cancer research and contributing in other ways, such as volunteering, donating tissue, or participating in a research study.

row.title: Sodium Thiosulfate Prevents Cisplatin-Induced Hearing Loss in Some Children
row.field_short_title: Drug Prevents Chemo-Related Hearing Loss in Some Children
row.field_page_description: Sodium thiosulfate protected cisplatin-related hearing loss in children with a form of liver cancer, results from a clinical trial show. As this Cancer Currents post explains, the findings should affect clinical practice.

row.title: Ibrutinib plus rituximab superior to standard treatment for some patients with chronic leukemia
row.field_short_title: Ibrutinib-based therapy superior in CLL trial
row.field_page_description: An interim analysis of an NCI-supported clinical trial found ibrutinib plus rituximab superior to standard treatment for patients age 70 and younger with untreated chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

row.title: Teaching in Medical Education
row.field_page_description: The Teaching in Medical Education (TIME) course provides NCI postdoctoral fellows with basic knowledge in teaching methods, course planning, writing a syllabus and developing examinations. This course is for postdoctoral fellows interested in pursing an academic career at a medical school.

row.title: Vitamin D Supplements Don’t Reduce Cancer Incidence, Trial Shows
row.field_short_title: Vitamin D Supplements Don’t Reduce Cancer Incidence
row.field_page_description: Taking vitamin D supplements doesn’t decrease cancer risk, according to results from VITAL, the largest-ever clinical trial of vitamin D for cancer prevention.

row.title: Alveolar soft tissue sarcoma
Inflammatory myofibroblastic tumor
Epithelioid hemangioendothelioma
Center for Cancer Research Rare Tumor Clinics
New Research
Rare Tumors
Research
The Pathway to Independence Award for Outstanding Early Stage Postdoctoral Researchers (K99/R00)
row.field_page_description: The early K99/R00 will help researchers to complete n needed mentored training and transition in a timely manner to independent, tenure-track or equivalent.

row.title: NIH Fellows Editorial Board Editorial Process Guidelines
Preparing for Science-Based Non-Traditional Careers
What are rare bone tumors?
row.field_page_description: Rare bone tumors include bone cancer and cartilage cancer. They can be called by different names depending on where they are in the body. Particulare types of rare bone tumors affect children, adolescents, and young adults.

row.title: BRCA Exchange aggregates data on thousands of BRCA variants to inform understanding of cancer risk
row.field_short_title: BRCA Exchange serves as global data resource on gene variants
row.field_page_description: The BRCA Exchange, a global resource that includes data on thousands of variants in the BRCA1 and BRCA2 genes, is available to the public through a website and new smartphone app.

row.title: Mouse Study Links Immune Cells to Diarrhea Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_short_title: Immune Cells Linked to Diarrhea Caused by Chemotherapy
row.field_page_description: A study in mice sheds light onto how some chemotherapies cause diarrhea. The findings could be the basis for developing new treatments for patients with cancer who develop gastrointestinal side effects from chemotherapy, explains this Cancer Currents blog post.

row.title: New Immunotherapy Option Approved for Cervical Cancer, Rare Lymphoma
row.field_short_title: Pembrolizumab Approved for Cervical Cancer, Rare Lymphoma
row.field_page_description: The FDA has approved pembrolizumab (Keytruda) for some women with advanced cervical cancer and for some patients with primary mediastinal large B-cell lymphoma (PMBCL), a rare type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Esophageal Cancer
row.field_page_description: TCGA's Study of Esophageal Cancer

row.title: OMB Burden Statements for NCI Information Collections
row.field_page_description: Under the Paperwork Reduction Act, information collections approved by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) are linked to OMB Burden Statements that explain more about the specific collection and who to contact for more information. Burden statements for information collection by NCI are kept here.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Papillary Renal Cell Carcinoma
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Papillary Renal Cell Carcinoma

row.title: For Small Cell Lung Cancer, Immunotherapy Drug Finally Brings Improved Survival
row.field_short_title: For Small Cell Lung Cancer, Immunotherapy Drug Improves Survival
row.field_page_description: In a clinical trial of patients with advanced small cell lung cancer (SCLC), atezolizumab (Tecentriq), combined with standard chemotherapy, modestly increased survival—the first trial in more than 20 years to show a survival improvement in this cancer.

row.title: Cancer Moonshot℠ – FY 2017 and FY 2018 Funding Opportunities
row.field_page_description: Find funding opportunities that were available in previous fiscal years to align with the efforts of the Cancer Moonshot.

row.title: About Resources for Researchers
row.field_page_description: Find contact information to add or edit a resource in the Resources for Researchers tool.

row.title: TCGA Cancers Selected for Study
row.field_page_description: An overview of the 33 cancers selected for molecular characterization and the criteria TCGA used to select them.

row.title: Combining Immunotherapy and Radiation against Cancer
row.field_short_title: Combining Immunotherapy and Radiation against Cancer
row.field_page_description: Read how an NCI-funded team led by Robert Vonderheide showed the promise of combining immune checkpoint inhibitors and radiation therapy in melanoma.

row.title: NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity
row.field_short_title: NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity
row.field_page_description: Interested in learning about principles and practice of cancer prevention and control and molecular prevention? Read NCI Summer Curriculum: Strengthening Global Cancer Research Capacity and learn details about 2019 courses.

row.title: 2018 Social Media Events
row.field_page_description: Find past social media events involving NCI and its partners from 2018.

row.title: CGH Recognizes World Cancer Day 2019
row.field_page_description: Want to know more about World Cancer Day? Read how the NCI Center for Global Health promotes knowledge sharing in global cancer research and cancer control.

row.title: A CAR T-Cell Therapy for Multiple Childhood Cancers?
row.field_short_title: CAR T-Cell Study Suggests Promise for Childhood Cancers
row.field_page_description: A CAR T-cell therapy targeting the B7-H3 protein may have potential as a treatment for several childhood cancers, results from a study in mice suggest.

row.title: TCGA's Study of Testicular Germ Cell Cancer
row.field_short_title: TCGA's Study of Testicular Germ Cell Cancer

row.title: Can Topical Drugs Help Prevent Breast Cancer?
row.field_short_title: Can Topical Drugs Help Prevent Breast Cancer?
row.field_page_description: A topical form of tamoxifen, called 4-OHT, is being tested to see if it can prevent breast cancer as effectively as oral tamoxifen but with fewer side effects.

row.title: Drug Combination May Target the Unique Metabolism of Leukemia Stem Cells
row.field_short_title: Drug Combination May Target Metabolism of Leukemia Stem Cells
row.field_page_description: In AML, the drugs venetoclax (Venclexta) and azacitidine (Vidaza) team up to block the unique metabolism of leukemia stem cells, two studies show.

row.title: Anaplastic thyroid carcinoma
Neuroblastoma
NUT midline carcinoma
Cancer Research Interns
row.field_page_description: The Cancer Research Interns (CRI) summer program goal is to train a diverse number of students in labs and branches across the Center for Cancer Research.

row.title: Non-Academic Jobs for Fellows in Law Firms, Patent and Trademark Office and Scientific Intellectual Property
row.field_page_description: The Non-Academic Jobs for Fellows in Law Firms, Patent and Trademark Office and Scientific Intellectual Property workshop assists NCI Fellows, Staff Scientists, and Staff Clinicians in positioning themselves for job opportunites.

row.title: AI approach outperformed human experts in identifying cervical precancer
row.field_short_title: Researchers create AI approach for cervical cancer screening
row.field_page_description: An AI algorithm outperformed other screening methods in identifying cervical precancer. The approach could be especially valuable in low-resource settings.

row.title: Immunotherapy Effective in Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma
row.field_short_title: Immunotherapy Effective in Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma
row.field_page_description: In some people with alveolar soft part sarcoma (ASPS), atezolizumab (Tecentriq) shrank tumors or stopped them from growing, a small clinical trial has shown.

row.title: 2019 Press Releases
row.field_page_description: Press releases from NCI for the year 2019.

row.title: MyPART Upcoming Events
row.field_page_description: MyPART team members are participating in meetings to talk about our programs and to answer questions. Find us at events across the country!

row.field_short_title: CRCHD Supplements Café celebrates Black History Month

row.title: When Cancer Returns
Study Confirms Letrozole Prevents More Breast Cancer Recurrences than Tamoxifen
row.field_short_title: Study Confirms Letrozole Prevents More Breast Cancer Recurrences than Tamoxifen
row.field_page_description: After a median of 8 years of follow-up, women with estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer who received 5 years of letrozole were less likely to have their cancer recur or to die during follow-up than women who received 5 years of tamoxifen.

row.title: Global Health Diplomacy on Display: Dr. Varmus and Indian Prime Minister Modi

row.title: The Continuing Umbrella of Research Experiences (CURE)
row.field_page_description: The CURE program offers training and career development opportunities to increase diversity in the cancer and cancer health disparities research workforce.

Regional Cancer Registries – 20 Years and Growing

row.title: Adjusting to Cancer
row.field_page_description: Information that helps you and your family face life’s changes from cancer. Includes talking with your doctors, talking to children, changes for the family, and information on cancer support groups.

row.title: Changes for the Family
NCI establishes Genomic Data Commons to facilitate identification of molecular subtypes of cancer and potential drug targets
row.field_short_title: NCI establishes GDC to facilitate identification of molecular subtypes of cancer
row.field_page_description: NCI is establishing the Genomic Data Commons to store, analyze and distribute cancer genomics data generated by NCI and other research organizations. The GDC will provide an interactive system for researchers to access data, with the goal of advancing the

row.field_page_description: NCI’s Director, Dr. Harold Varmus, introduces the NCI Annual Plan and Budget Proposal for Fiscal Year 2016.

row.title: Cancer Genomics Overview
row.field_page_description: Cancer genomics uses technologies such as sequencing to identify DNA and RNA alterations, define molecular subtypes, and develop precision medicine in oncology.

row.title: Message from the Director
Formaldehyde
row.field_page_description: Learn about formaldehyde, which can raise your risk of myeloid leukemia and rare cancers of or near the nasal cavity. Formaldehyde is used in pressed-wood building materials, fungicides, germicides, disinfectants, and certain preservatives. Other sources include tobacco smoke and car emissions.

row.title: Analyzing the Gut Microbiome to Help Detect Colorectal Cancer
row.field_short_title: Analyzing the Gut Microbiome to Help Detect Colorectal Cancer
row.field_page_description: Two studies suggest that changes in the gut microbiome could help distinguish people with healthy colons from those with colorectal polyps or colorectal cancer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Veena Rao, Ph.D. - Unraveling the Mysteries of BRCA1 in African American Women
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Veena Rao, Ph.D. - Unraveling the Mysteries of BRCA1 in African American Women

row.title: CGH Celebrates World Cancer Day 2015
People in Health Care
row.field_page_description: Information about the treatment team of health care providers who work together to help cancer patients.

row.title: How Cancer Is Diagnosed
row.field_page_description: Learn about tests and procedures that diagnose cancer. Your doctor may ask about personal and family medical history or order lab tests, imaging scans, or a biopsy.

row.title: Lung Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The two main types of lung cancer are non-small cell lung cancer and small cell lung cancer. Smoking causes most lung cancers, but nonsmokers can also develop lung cancer. Start here to find information on lung cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics on lung cancer.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: The most common types of esophageal cancer are adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma. These forms of esophageal cancer develop in some parts of the esophagus and are driven by genetic changes. Start here to find information on esophageal cancer treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, and statistics.

row.title: Coping with Cancer
Exemestane Following Tamoxifen Reduces Breast Cancer Recurrences and Prolongs Survival
row.field_short_title: Exemestane Following Tamoxifen Reduces Breast Cancer Recurrences and Prolongs Survival
row.field_page_description: Postmenopausal women with early-stage hormone receptor-positive breast cancer had delayed disease recurrence and longer survival after taking 2-3 years of tamoxifen followed by exemestane for a total of 5 years compared to taking tamoxifen for 5 years.

row.title: NCI Fact Sheets
Grantee Spotlight: Dr. David Turner - Investigating the Role of Nutrition in Cancer Growth for African Americans Living with Prostate Cancer

row.title: Chemotherapy to Treat Cancer
row.field_page_description: Chemotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that uses drugs to kill cancer cells. Learn how chemotherapy works against cancer, why it causes side effects, and how it is used with other cancer treatments.

row.title: Step 4: Award Negotiation & Issuance
row.field_page_description: Before a grant can be awarded and accepted, several pre-award activities must happen to formalize the partnership. Ensuring compliance with federal laws, a review of costs and a negotiation of the appropriate funding level must all happen in order to receive a grant.

Grants Policies and Process
row.field_page_description: NIH prior approval is required for the transfer of a grant. Learn more about transferring a cancer research grant from one entity to another.

row.title: Advanced Cancer
Taking Care of Yourself
row.field_page_description: Caring for someone with advanced cancer brings new challenges and concerns. It's important to take care of yourself and reach out for help. Find tips specific to caregivers of patients with advanced cancer.

row.title: History of the National Cancer Institute
row.field_page_description: Since its establishment in 1937, the National Cancer Institute has supported and advanced cancer research in many ways.

row.field_page_description: Roster of members on the Cancer Care Delivery Research Steering Committee.

National Cancer Institute Overview and Mission
row.field_page_description: Learn about the National Cancer Institute and what we do, our impact, and our future plans.

row.title: NCI Dictionary of Cancer Terms
row.field_page_description: NCI's Dictionary of Cancer Terms provides easy-to-understand definitions for words and phrases related to cancer and medicine.

row.title: NIH tools facilitate matching cancer drugs with gene targets
row.field_short_title: NIH tools facilitate matching cancer drugs with gene targets
row.field_page_description: A new study details how a suite of web-based tools provides the research community with greatly improved capacity to compare data derived from large collections of genomic information against thousands of drugs. By comparing drugs and genetic targets, re

NIH study uncovers likely role of major cancer protein
row.field_short_title: Major cancer protein amplifies global gene expression
row.field_page_description: Scientists may have discovered why a protein called MYC can provoke a variety of cancers. Like many proteins associated with cancer, MYC helps regulate cell growth. A new study carried out by researchers at the National Institutes of Health and colleagues

row.title: Treating Patients with High-Risk Smoldering Myeloma
row.field_short_title: Treating Patients with High-Risk Smoldering Myeloma
row.field_page_description: In this phase III clinical trial, patients with smoldering myeloma classified as high risk for progression will be randomly assigned to undergo standard observation or six 4-week courses of treatment with the drug lenalidomide.

row.title: Contacts
Breast Reconstruction After Mastectomy
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes breast reconstruction after mastectomy, including surgical options, follow-up care, and breast cancer screening after reconstruction.

row.title: Report to the Nation shows U.S. cancer death rates continue to drop; Special feature highlights trends in HPV-associated cancers and HPV vaccination coverage levels
row.field_short_title: Report to the Nation shows cancer death rates dropping
row.field_page_description: The Annual Report to the Nation on the Status of Cancer, 1975–2009, shows that overall cancer death rates continued to decline in the United States among both men and women, among all major racial and ethnic groups, and for all of the most common cancer s

row.title: Results of the National CT Colonography Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_short_title: Results of the National CT Colonography Trial: Questions and Answers
row.field_page_description: Learn the results of the National Computerized Tomographic Colonography (CTC) clinical trial, which evaluated how well CTC identifies participants with at least one significantly large polyp using colonoscopy as the gold (or reference) standard.

row.title: Cancer Statistics
row.field_page_description: Basic information about cancer statistics in the U.S. and how they are used to understand the impact of cancer on society and to develop strategies that address the challenges that cancer poses.

row.title: About This Website
row.field_page_description: The National Cancer Institute (NCI) website serves to disseminate authoritative, evidence-based, and up-to-date information about cancer and NCI-supported cancer research. Much of the information is available for content reuse and syndication.

row.title: Immune-Based Treatment Shows Promise against Metastatic Cervical Cancer
row.field_page_description: In an early phase NCI clinical trial, two patients with metastatic cervical cancer had a complete disappearance of their tumors after receiving treatment with a form of immunotherapy called adoptive cell transfer.

row.title: Grantee Spotlight: Elisa Rodriguez, Ph.D., M.S. - Community-based Education and Outreach Can Increase Biospecimen Donations among Hispanics and African Americans
row.field_short_title: Grantee Spotlight: Elisa Rodriguez, Ph.D., M.S.

row.title: Program Spotlight: National Outreach Network's Community Health Educators Provide Much-Needed Support to Cancer Survivors from Racially/Ethnically Diverse Communities
row.field_short_title: Program Spotlight: National Outreach Network's Community Health Educators

row.title: July Spotlight: Cancer Awareness Highlights
Special Spotlight: Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month
row.field_short_title: Special Spotlight: Asian American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month

row.title: Bone Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on bone cancers, such as osteosarcoma and Ewing sarcoma, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Carcinoma of Unknown Primary—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Carcinoma of unknown primary (CUP) is a rare disease in which malignant cells are found in the body but the site of the primary cancer is not known. Most CUPs are adenocarcinomas, or undifferentiated tumors. Find evidence-based information on the treatment for carcinoma of unknown primary.

row.title: Esophageal Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on esophageal cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Gestational Trophoblastic Disease—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD) is a broad term encompassing both benign and malignant growths arising from products of conception in the uterus. GTDs contain paternal chromosomes and are placental in origin. Find evidence-based information on gestational trophoblastic disease treatment.

row.title: Intraocular (Eye) Melanoma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Intraocular (uveal) melanoma of the uveal tract (iris, ciliary body, and choroid), though rare, is the most common primary intraocular malignancy in adults. Find evidence-based information on intraocular melanoma treatment.

row.title: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Langerhans cell histiocytosis is a rare blood cancer that forms when a type of white blood cell called Langerhans cells becomes abnormal and grows in different parts of the body. LCH is most common in young children but can occur at any age. Start here to find information on Langerhans cell histiocytosis treatment.

row.title: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Histiocytic diseases, like Langerhans cell histiocytosis (LCH) and myeloid-derived dendritic cell disorder, in children and adults are caused by an abnormal accumulation of cells of the mononuclear phagocytic system. Find evidence-based information on Langerhans cell histiocytosis treatment.

row.title: Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Pheochromocytomas and extra-adrenal paragangliomas are rare tumors arising from neural crest tissue that develops into sympathetic and parasympathetic paraganglia throughout the body. Find evidence-based information on pheochromocytoma and paraganglioma treatment, research, and genetics.

row.title: Prostate Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Prostate cancers are often adenocarcinomas. Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia is often present in association with prostatic adenocarcinoma. Find evidence-based information on prostate cancer including treatment, causes and prevention, screening, research, genetics, and statistics.

row.title: Thyroid Cancer Research
row.field_page_description: Find research articles on thyroid cancer, which may include news stories, clinical trials, blog posts, and descriptions of active studies.

row.title: Vaginal Cancer—Health Professional Version
row.field_page_description: Vaginal cancer is often squamous cell carcinoma. Other types of vaginal cancer are adenocarcinoma, melanoma, and sarcoma. Infection with certain types of human papillomavirus (HPV) causes most vaginal cancer. Find evidence-based information on vaginal cancer treatment and research.

row.title: Diagnosis and Staging Research
The NCI Intramural Research Program
Reproductive History and Cancer Risk
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet that describes what is known about the relationship between pregnancy, miscarriage, abortion, fertility treatment and the risk of cancer.

row.title: Adrenocortical Carcinoma—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Adrenocortical carcinoma is a rare cancer which forms in the cortex (outer layer) of an adrenal gland. There are two adrenal glands. One sits on top of each kidney. Start here to find information on adrenocortical carcinoma treatment and research.

row.title: Vaginal Cancer—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Two-thirds of vaginal cancer cases are caused by human papillomavirus (HPV). Vaccines that protect against infection with HPV may reduce the risk of vaginal cancer. When found early, vaginal cancer can often be cured. Start here to find information on vaginal cancer treatment and research.

row.title: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Vaccines
row.field_page_description: A fact sheet about human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccines for the prevention of infection with certain types of HPV, which is the major cause of cervical cancer.

row.title: Plasma Cell Neoplasms (Including Multiple Myeloma)—Patient Version
row.field_page_description: Plasma cell neoplasms occur when abnormal plasma cells form cancerous tumors. When there is only one tumor, the disease is called a plasmacytoma. When there are multiple tumors, it is called multiple myeloma. Start here to find information on plasma cell neoplasms treatment, research, and statistics.

row.title: Eliminating Hairy Cell Leukemia Minimal Residual Disease
row.field_short_title: Eliminating Hairy Cell Leukemia Minimal Residual Disease
row.field_page_description: In this trial, patients with hairy cell leukemia who have disease-related symptoms that require treatment will be randomly assigned to receive cladribine with either concurrent rituximab or rituximab at least 6 months after completing cladribine therapy.

row.title: Privacy and Security Policy
row.field_page_description: Learn about the privacy and security policies for the National Cancer Institute (NCI) website.

row.title: Treatment Prevents Chemotherapy Side Effects for Children with Cancer
row.field_short_title: Treatment Prevents Chemotherapy Side Effects for Children with Cancer
row.field_page_description: Adding aprepitant to the anti-nausea drug ondansetron, with or without dexamethasone, effectively prevents chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children.

row.title: NCI and the Precision Medicine Initiative®
row.field_short_title: NCI and the Precision Medicine Initiative®
row.field_page_description: NCI's activities related to precision medicine focuses on new and expanded precision medicine clinical trials; mechanisms to overcome drug resistance to cancer treatments; and developing a shared digital repository of precision medicine trials data.

row.title: NCI-MATCH trial will link targeted cancer drugs to gene abnormalities
row.field_short_title: NCI-MATCH Links Targeted Drugs to Mutations
